Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Complete a Bank Reconciliation","Each month you will want to match your bank statement with your Rentvine account by performing a Bank Reconciliation. Any unexplained differences between the two records may be signs of non entry or financial misappropriation.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-complete-a-bank-reconciliation","

It is important to reconcile your bank accounts to ensure that your internal financial records match what’s happening in real life. This process helps you detect any anomalies, accounting mistakes, or inefficiencies within your business, ultimately resulting in more precise financial records.

<h4>By performing a three-way bank reconciliation as you navigate through the bank reconciliation process, Rentvine's reconciliation system aids in guaranteeing that the financial records entered in your Rentvine account correspond with your bank statements.&nbsp
• From the left navigation menu, click on Banking under Accounting
• Once you are in the New Bank Reconciliation page, fill in the top of the page
• Bank Account - Choose the bank account you want to reconcile
• Statement Start Date - This will be pre-filled if you have a prior reconciliation on this bank account
• Statement End Date - This will be the end date from your bank statement

column2: - Enter the statement ending balance amount from the bank statement
Optionally upload a file that you want to attach to the reconciliation. You would typically upload that month's bank statement.

column1: • Search Box - You can search for any items in the Money In and Money Out section by typing in a date, reference, description or amount
• From your bank statement, match the Money In (Deposits)
column2: and Money Out (Withdrawals) one by one and check the boxes on the left for the ones you want to clear as you go through the bank statement.

column1: • As you clear the Money In and Money Out transactions you will notice that the values in one or more of the three reconciliation boxes (Ending Balance, Cleared Balance, Adjusted Cash Balance) will change as the items are cleared.

If you wish to preserve your work, simply select the Save button to retain the progress of the cleared items. This feature proves beneficial if you reconcile on a daily or weekly basis and want to preserve your work until you receive your official bank statement. By saving, the next time you or anyone else visits this page, the checked-off items will remain intact.
<li>As you continue to clear items the three reconciliation boxes will turn green if the deposits and withdrawals from your bank statement match your Rentvine transactions.&nbsp
column2: This means a three way reconciliation has been completed and you can click Reconcile to complete the reconciliation.

column1: After you click Reconcile it will take you to the Reconciliation report page.
column2: Here you can click on the green Actions button and select print if you want to print it to a pdf.

column1: Some TIPS as to why one or more of the balance do not match (NOT ALL GREEN)
****below are some examples of possible reasons why****
• Bills were paid from a different bank account
You would want to go back and account for all of these transactions in Rentvine to clean up the accuracy of the Reconciliation.

column2: is what Rentvine thinks you should have in your bank account

column1: If the Adjusted Cash Balance is out of balance it could be caused by one or more of the following:

column3: of the time when the adjusted cash balance is out of balance, the issue typically arises from a discrepancy between the deposit date and the date of the itemized payment(s) linked to it. For instance, if you have a deposit recorded on the 30th or 31st of a month, but the itemized payment is dated the 1st of the following month, it is necessary to adjust the itemized payment date to either match the deposit post date or select a date prior to it to restore balance to the adjusted cash balance.

column1: When creating a deposit in the system, it's important to ensure that the post date of the individual payment(s) linked to the deposit either matches the date of the deposit or precedes it.

• Similar to the deposits, settlements can cause an adjusted cash balance discrepancy and this arises from a discrepancy between the settlement date and the date of the itemized payment(s) linked to it. For instance, if you have a settlement recorded on the 30th or 31st of a month, but the itemized payment is dated the 1st of the following month, it is necessary to adjust the itemized payment date to either match the deposit post date or select a date prior to it to restore balance to the adjusted cash balance.

<li>When bills are paid with a credit, a payment batch will still be generated. The day that the bill is paid with the credit will be the Date Posted/Date Allocated for the credit on the payment. The payment batch will also have a Date Posted, and it defaults to today's date but can be changed. If the Date Posted of the payment batch is changed to be prior to the Date Posted/Date Allocated of the credit, this can cause the Adjusted Cash Balance to be out of balance.&nbsp

<li>Make sure all your manually recorded lease payments, owner payments or other payments (All Money In type transactions) have been recorded as deposited. Ensure your deposit date is the same as the one shown in your bank deposit slip.&nbsp
<li>There are bank adjustments entered that are dated before the “Statement End Date”.&nbsp
column2: Bank adjustments will cause the adjusted cash balance to be out of balance.&nbsp
column3: We recommend to not enter bank adjustments.

column1: • There could be transactions that may not be dated correctly. For example you want to be sure that all transactions entered into Rentvine match what happened in real life. (I.e. deposits, payments, journal entries)
• There is a transaction(s) that should not be recorded in Rentvine or a transaction(s) that is missing from Rentvine regardless of the date posted.

When you set the statement end date on the reconciliation it changes what is the Total Cash Balance in that adjusted cash balance section. The total cash balance is basically the total of the bank balance breakdown of all ledgers in Rentvine as of the date entered in the “Statement End Date” field . See the screenshot below as an example.
Also, keep in mind that you can still reconcile as long as the first two boxes are green (Ending Balance and Cleared Balance).

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Forfeit a Security Deposit to the Existing Owner","Is the owner keeping all or part of the security deposit or is management ending? This article will show you how to send a security deposit on a lease to an existing owner in your Rentvine account and include it as part of an owner distribution.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-return-a-security-deposit-on-a-lease-to-an-existing-owner","<div class=""hs-callout-type-tip"" data-hs-callout-type=""tip"">
This is also a guide to returning security deposits from a lease to an owner, upon concluding management of the property.
• First, in your Settings, create an income account in your chart of accounts for ""Security Deposit Transfer Owner"" or something similar
• In the lease search box, search for the address or tenant(s)
• Click on the lease when you have found the correct lease
<li>Create a charge on that lease for the income account you just created in the amount of the security deposit (or the amount of the security deposit you are sending to the owner)
• In the lease, click the green Actions button on the right
• Enter in the Amount of the security deposit that you are giving to the owner
• Go back into the lease, click the green Actions button, and click on Release Deposit from the drop-down menu
• In Release Deposit, enter the amount of the security deposit. Then, enter that amount in the Security Deposit spot below, and in that charge you just created below that
• Enter the Amount of the security deposit that you are returning to the owner
• Enter in a Description of ""Returning security deposit to owner"" or something similar
• In the Deposit Balances section, enter the Release Amount, which will be the same amount that you entered above
• In the Pay Charges section, enter the Amount to Pay into the charge that you created in step 3, which will be the same amount that you entered above
• Click Post at the bottom right
column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-09-05%20at%202-25-42%E2%80%AFPM-png.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • Now, you should see these changes reflect on the portfolio ledger as an increase if you go to that specific portfolio ledger.
column3:
src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-09-05%20at%202-29-00%E2%80%AFPM-png.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

Please note that this can also be accomplished through the move out flow. The move out flow automatically releases the security deposit and applies it to unpaid charges. For additional help regarding the move out please click here.

column1: • The next step is to make your disbursement to the owner through the Pay Owners screen
column2: *See the article How To Pay Owners

column1: The final step is recording a bank transfer within Rentvine.

The final step will only apply to you if you return security deposit money from a bank account that is separate from the bank account that you hold that money for the duration of the lease (i.e. you hold security deposits in a separate escrow security deposit bank account, but you refund the money to the tenant from your operating trust rental account). If this step does apply to you, then you will want to transfer the money at your bank, and you will also want to record a new bank transfer in Rentvine as well to account for the transfer at your bank.
If you only have one bank account, or if you refund security deposits from the same bank account that you hold that money in, then the final step will not apply to you.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Pay Bills","Do you need to pay vendors?  This article will show you how to pay bills in Rentvine.

Once in the Pay Bills screen you will want to choose the bills that you would like to pay from the available list by clicking the checkbox to the right of each bill. You can also select the links on the top right of the page to easily select multiple bills to pay (Check Payable, Check Available Funds Only, Check All, Uncheck All).

clicking on this link will select all bills

By selecting a filter, you can narrow down the list of bills displayed on the page, making it easier for you to locate the bills you want to pay. This feature is especially useful if you have a long list of bills to pay and want to quickly find the ones that meet a specific criteria.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Portfolio Ledger Balances","Definitions of ledger balance terms. These can be found at the top of the portfolio ledger view page and throughout your Rentvine account.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/ledger-balances","
• Simplified Explanation: This is the amount of money available to pay bills and send to owners.
• Detailed Definition: Operating Balance = cash balance − security deposits not covered by escrow balance − prepayments − liabilities.
• Simplified Explanation: This is the total amount of money in non-escrow bank accounts.
• Detailed Definition: Net of all non-escrow bank accounts.
• Simplified Explanation: This is the total amount of money in escrow bank accounts.
• Detailed Definition: Net of bank accounts marked “Tracked as Escrow.”
• Simplified Explanation: The total of all security deposits being held. These must be covered by escrow bank accounts, or they will reduce the operating balance.

• Detailed Definition: Net of all liability chart of accounts marked “Tracked as Security Deposit” and “Tracked as Held.” Held deposits must be offset by escrow bank accounts, or they are held back from the operating balance.
• Simplified Explanation: These are security deposits held by the owner, so they don’t need to be covered by escrow bank account and will not reduce the operating balance.
• Detailed Definition: Net of all liability chart of accounts marked “Tracked as Security Deposit” and NOT “Tracked as Held.”
• Simplified Explanation: The total of all unpaid bills. This amount will be held from the operating balance when sending money to owners.
• Detailed Definition: Sum of all unpaid bills, reserved from the operating balance to be withheld while disbursing funds via the Pay Owners page.
• Simplified Explanation: The total of vendor credits that haven’t been used yet. These can reduce what you owe on bills.
• Detailed Definition: Sum of all unused vendor credits, used to reduce the amount owed on bills.
• Simplified Explanation: The total of unpaid charges, usually from tenants who haven’t paid rent or fees.
• Detailed Definition: Sum of all unpaid lease charges, typically unpaid tenant charges.

• Simplified Explanation: The estimated costs of open, pending and on-hold work orders, minus any paid bills for those work orders. This amount is held from the operating balance when sending money to owners.

• Detailed Definition: Sum of all estimated costs from pending, open, and on-hold work orders minus the sum of all paid bills on those work orders. Reserved from the operating balance while disbursing funds via the Pay Owners page.
• Simplified Explanation: The total amount owed for things that aren’t marked as prepayments or security deposits.
• Detailed Definition: Net of all liability chart of accounts not marked “Tracked as Prepayment” or “Tracked as Security Deposit.”
• Simplified Explanation: The total amount owed for things that are not prepayments, security deposits, and held back. These funds are included in the operating balance.

• Detailed Definition: Balance of all liability chart of accounts NOT “Tracked as Prepayment,” “Tracked as Security Deposit,” and “Tracked as Held.” These funds are NOT held back from the operating balance.
• Simplified Explanation: The total of all prepayments, which are held back from the operating balance.
• Detailed Definition: Net of all chart of accounts marked “Tracked as Prepayment.” They are held back from the operating balance.
• Simplified Explanation: The total of payments meant for non-escrow bank accounts (like rent or contributions) that haven’t been deposited or settled yet.

• Detailed Definition: Sum of all undeposited and unsettled lease payments, owner contributions, and other payments to non-escrow bank accounts. Unsettled payments are those not yet funded to the operating bank account.

column3: electronic payments that have not funded to a bank account yet.
column4: For example, if a tenant makes an eCheck payment on a Monday the payment will typically settle on Wednesday. This means that the tenant payment is unsettled until Wednesday.

column1: • Simplified Explanation: The total of payments meant for escrow bank accounts (like security deposits) that haven’t been deposited or settled yet.
• Detailed Definition: Balance of all undeposited and unsettled lease payments, owner contributions, and other payments to escrow bank accounts.
• Simplified Explanation: The total of all property reserves for the portfolio, which is held back from the operating balance when sending money to owners.
• Detailed Definition: Sum of all property reserves associated with the portfolio, reserved from the operating balance when disbursing funds via the Pay Owners page.
• Simplified Explanation: An extra reserve amount that can be set for each portfolio, held back from the operating balance.
• Detailed Definition: An additional reserve defined for each portfolio, withheld from the operating balance when disbursing funds via the Pay Owners page.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Owner Portal Registration","Listed below are steps showing you how to register/create an account in Rentvine in order to access your owner portal.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/owner-portal-registration","
<li>You will receive an email invitation from your property management company to access your owner portal.&nbsp
column2: In the email, click on the “Accept Invite” button to begin registering your account with Rentvine.&nbsp
column3: The invitation will expire in 30 days.&nbsp
column4: You will continue to get reminders every day if they don't accept the invite right away.&nbsp

column1: ***If the owner forgot their password there will be more steps to take to accept the invite link.***
1. Owner must first click on forgot password.
2. Enter the email you first used to sign up and proceed with the ReCAPTCHA
3. You will be sent a ""Reset Password"" link to your email. Once you receive it, continue and follow the instructions
4. Type your new password and complete the ReCAPTCHA
5. Once your password is made and you have access to your account please go back to the original email link your property manager sent you for portal access.

6. Once you accept the invite it will ask you for your username and password. Enter the same email address and the new password you just changed. After signing in, click accept invite and join your portal.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How To Sign-In to View Multiple Owner Portals with One Email Account (One Rentvine User Account)","For owners who need access to more than one owner portal, you can now sign in to the Owners Portal without registering for a new account (Rentvine User Account)

,en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-sign-in-to-view-multiple-owner-portals-with-one-email-account","

If you have already registered for an owner portal, and your property manager has sent you an additional invitation to access another owner portal, please follow the instructions below to access multiple owner portals with the same email address (Rentvine User Account).
• After accepting one portal invitation, you will accept the other portal invitations, but you will NOT need to register another Rentvine user account with the same email address.
column2: Click on the Accept Invite Button and it will redirect you to the Owner's Registration Form.

column1: Skip the registration and click the link found at the bottom of the registration screen that
column2: >says “Already have an Account? Sign In
password that the other ""owners"" are using and click sign in.
column4: After signing in, the owner will then have access to both owner portals and portfolios.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Process a Security Deposit Outside of the Move-Out Flow","This article will walk you through the process of releasing a security deposit and/or paying move-out charges with the security deposit.  Then, refund any remaining amount to the tenant.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-return-a-security-deposit-to-a-tenant","<div class=""hs-callout-type-note"" data-hs-callout-type=""note"">
The steps below are outside of the move-out workflow.
column2: Best practice is to use the Move Out workflow. Click here to view the Move Out article

column1: Find the specific lease that you would like to refund the security deposit
• Click on Leases on the left side of the screen
• In the search field, type the tenant(s) name or the address for the lease
• When you have located the lease, click on it
• You can also search for the tenant, property, or lease in the global search, then click on the lease.
1. Add any necessary additional charges to the lease
• While in the lease, to add charges, click on the green Actions button, and then click on Add Charge
• Select the date posted for the charge
• Click Save, or Save and Add Another to add multiple charges.

column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-09-04%20at%2010-54-32%E2%80%AFAM-png.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • Click on the green Actions button, and click on Release Deposit
• Enter the full Amount of the deposit at the top
• In the Deposit Balances section, enter the full amount of the deposit again in the Security Deposit field in the middle under Release Amount

column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-09-04%20at%2010-36-45%E2%80%AFAM-png-1.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">
column5:
src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-09-04%20at%2010-56-01%E2%80%AFAM-png.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">


3. Allocate Funds to Charges Created from the Security Deposit

column1: • If you created charges, you should see them under the Pay Charges section.
• Fill in the amount of money you would like to apply to those charges in the Amount to Pay field
column2: if you want to pay those charges using part of the security deposit.
>You should now see that the Total Open Credit
column3: > amount at the bottom has changed. This will be the total security deposit less any charges that you are paying from this security deposit.

column1: • Click on the green Post button at the bottom right
• Click on the green Actions button, and click on Refund
<li>Account, Name on check, and Date posted will automatically populate. Edit if necessary. Enter a check # if paying by physical check.&nbsp
• For Payment Address, you can leave this blank if the tenant contact has an address. If not, you can click on Custom Address to the right to fill in an address
• Enter the amount you would like to refund in the Amount to Refund field (this will default to the total open credit)
• Click the green Refund button at the bottom

column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-09-04%20at%2010-57-18%E2%80%AFAM-png.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • On the next screen, click the green Actions button
• Select Print Checks, and mail the check to the tenant
5. The final step is recording a bank transfer within Rentvine.

The final step will only apply to you if you return security deposit money from a bank account that is separate from the bank account that you hold that money for the duration of the lease (i.e. you hold security deposits in a separate escrow security deposit bank account, but you refund the money to the tenant from your operating trust rental account). If this step does apply to you, then you will want to transfer the money at your bank, and you will also want to record a new bank transfer in Rentvine as well to account for the transfer at your bank.
If you only have one bank account, or if you refund security deposits from the same bank account that you hold that money in, then the final step will not apply to you.

column2: ","Leases","Security Deposits","deposit,refund deposit,refund security deposit,release security deposit,return deposit,return security deposit,security deposit","2025-05-12T21:30:10.681Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Collect a Renewal Fee","Are you doing a renewal and want to charge the owner a renewal fee? This article shows you how to collect a renewal fee that is billed to the owner.
• Navigate to the current lease you want to collect the fee for.
• In the lease search box, search for the address or the tenant(s)
• Click on the lease when you have found the correct lease
<li aria-level=""1"">Once in the Lease, scroll down until you get to the<strong>&nbsp

• To add a Renewal fee, enter a renewal date, along with the rest of the fields below, and toggle Charge Renewal Fee on. Enter the Renewal Fee amount along with the date posted and select Save. *Note the Date Posted will be the date the Renewal Charge will be charged /billed

• If your Rentvine account is in management fee mode, the amount will automatically be transferred from the owner/portfolio ledger to your manager ledger. You will notice an increase in the manager ledger and a decrease in the owner's ledger
• If your Rentvine account is in bill management fee mode, a bill will be created for the amounts of the lease or renewal fee.

column2: ","Leases","Lease Financials","How to collect a lease fee,lease fee,renew leases,renewal fee","2025-05-13T23:35:28.157Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Record Bank Interest Earned","This article will show you how to record the interest you have earned on a trust bank account","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-record-bank-interest-earned","

If you receive interest on one or more of trust accounts, the best way to enter that into your Rentvine account is through a Journal Entry. Follow the steps below to show that you have received interest. Please note that there are two modes within Rentvine. The typical flow will be through Bill Mode but Marnager Ledger Mode is included in this article.

<li>First, you will want to have a GL in your chart of accounts created for ""Bank Interest Earned"" or something similar, and that will need to be an income account. Please create that account now if you do not currently have one.&nbsp

<li>Next you will need to make sure you have a portfolio created for your property management company. This is to create a ledger that you can tie money to but not affect the portfolio balance of your owners. To create a portfolio click on the portfolios tab, click the green actions button, and click ""New Portfolio"". You will just need this as a placeholder so you can also make an owner contact for the property management company.&nbsp
• Once that GL account is created, you will want to create a new journal entry
• On the left side of your screen, click on Accounting
• Click on the green Actions button on the far right
• Click on New Journal Entry from the drop down menu
<li>In the New Journal Entry screen, complete the fields to record for the interest earned
• In the Ledger field, type in the portfolio for the management company, and select that ledger. This will ensure the interest gets applied to your portfolio as income
• The Date Posted will default to today, but you can edit that to the day you received the interest
• Enter in a Description that explains the journal entry (i.e. May Bank Interest Earned)

• In the first Account field, select the GL account for Bank Interest Earned, or the GL account you created. Enter in $0 for the Debit field, and the amount of the interest you earned in the Credit field
• In the second Account field, select the bank account on which the interest was earned. Enter in the amount of interest you earned into the Debit field, and $0 in the Credit field
• You should now see that the debits equal the credits. If so, you are finished adding your entries

• Click the green Save button


    To check and make sure this interest applied correctly you can view the ledger tab from your property management company portfolio. You should see the income coming into the portfolio. You can also run a bank ledger report to view the increase.

<li>First, you will want to have a GL in your chart of accounts created for ""Bank Interest Earned"" or something similar, and that will need to be an income account. Please create that account now if you do not currently have one.&nbsp
• Once that GL account is created, you will want to create a new journal entry
• On the left side of your screen, click on Accounting
• Click on the green Actions button on the far right
• Click on New Journal Entry from the drop down menu
<li>In the New Journal Entry screen, complete the fields to record for the interest earned
• In the Ledger field, type in the same of your management company, and select that ledger. This will ensure the interest gets applied to you as income
• The Date Posted will default to today, but you can edit that to the day you received the interest
• Enter in a Description that explains the journal entry (i.e. May Bank Interest Earned)

• In the first Account field, select the GL account for Bank Interest Earned, or the GL account you created. Enter in $0 for the Debit field, and the amount of the interest you earned in the Credit field
• In the second Account field, select the bank account on which the interest was earned. Enter in the amount of interest you earned into the Debit field, and $0 in the Credit field
• You should now see that the debits equal the credits. If so, you are finished adding your entries

To check your work and ensure you entered the journal entry correctly, you can check your Manager Ledger and/or your Bank Ledger for that entry. You should notice an increase on both ledgers. If not, you can void that journal entry and enter it in again.

","Accounting","Banking","bank interest,banking,interest,interest earned,recording interest","2024-05-30T13:55:01.202Z","PUBLISHED","false"

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Rentvine Screening Fee Breakdown","We charge a $10.00 non-refundable processing fee or 10% per applicant (if the application fee is over $100). We allow you to customize your application fee and choose how you want to charge the processing fee.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/explain","<div dir=""ltr"">

To utilize Rentvine's screening, there are no additional monthly or annual fees. We do charge a $10.00 non-refundable processing fee or 10% per applicant (if the application fee is over $100). This processing fee helps cover the merchant account fees, transaction fees, and software support (includes phone and email support). We allow you to customize your application fee and choose how you want to charge the processing fee,
column2: I Will Pay The Fee, or Tenants Pay The Fee.

column1: The $10.00 processing fee will be deducted from your application fee before screening.
• Rentvine Processing Fee: - $10.00 or 10% ( if application fee is over $100 ) per applicant
• Amount Remitted To You Before Screening: $40.00 per applicant
The $10.00 processing fee will be added to the application fee as an additional line item upon submission and payment of the application.
• Rentvine Processing Fee: + $10.00 or 10% ( if application fee is over $100 ) per applicant
• Amount Remitted To You Before Screening: $60.00 per applicant

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Run and View a Credit Report","Do you need to run a screening report for an applicant? This article will walk you through running the screening report and show you how to view the screening results. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-run-and-view-a-credit-report","<ul>
• Once on the Applications page, you will locate the application you would like to view and screen.
• Hover over and click on the Application Tab to be taken to the Application Details page
• On the Application Details page, you will locate the Actions icon.
• You will then select your screening package from the drop-down or your default screening package.

• Our system will then integrate with TransUnion's screening system to process the applications. You will see a Screening Tab under Screening Reports. Under the Status Tab, it will show ""processing"" until all the reports have been pulled successfully.

<li>The screening should take no more than 30 seconds. However, if the reports are taking longer than normal to pull, you can refresh the page or click out of the screening window, and our system will notify you through email that the reports have been completed.&nbsp
• Once you see the reports have been completed, you will click on View Report.
• You will click ""Credit"" within the Screening Report Details section.
• If there were Criminal or Eviction records that were pulled, you would then be able to click ""Criminal"" or ""Eviction"" to view those records.
• Our system will then pull those records within a preview browser where you can create those records as PDFs or print them for your screening records.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Make a Payment or Contribution Through the Owner Portal","This article will walk you through the process of submitting a payment / contribution to your property manager through your portal","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-make-a-payment-through-the-portal","

• If you select Saved Payment Method, follow these steps:

• After selecting the payment method, enter the Amount To Pay

column2: Conditions, and then switch toggle button ""On"" (green)

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Merge Applications?","*Please note: We recommend merging applications together prior to screening, to avoid being double charged for screening.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-merge-an-application","<ul>
• Once on the Applications page you will locate the application you would like to view and screen.
• Hover over and click on the Application Tab to be taken to the Application Details page
• On the Application Details page you will locate the Actions icon.
• You will then select from the drop down or type in which application you would like to merge together.
• You will then see the two applicants within the Application Details screen.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How To Unmerge Applications?","*Please note: We recommend unmerging applications prior to screening, to void being double charged for screening.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-unmerge-applications","<ul>
• Once on the Applications page you will locate the application you would like to view and screen.
• Hover over and click on the Application Tab to be taken to the Application Details page
• On the Application Details page you will locate the Actions icon.
• You will then check the box of the application you would like to Unmerge.
• You will then see where our system will remove the one applicant chosen from the Application Details screen.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Add a Note","This article will help you create notes and save it in Rentvine.  You will be able to share notes with the owner if you would like as well. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-add-a-note","<ul>
• Once on the Applications page you will locate the application you would like to view and screen.
• Hover over and click on the Application Tab to be taken to the Application Details page
• On the Application Details page you will locate the Actions icon.
• The Note will then appear within the Notes section on the right hand side of the screen.
• By Clicking the ellipsis icon (...) you can Edit or Delete the Note.
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Add a Letter?","","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-add-a-letter","<ul>
• Once on the Applications page, you will locate the application you would like to view and screen.
• Hover over and click on the Application Tab to be taken to the Application Details page
• On the Application Details page, you will locate the Actions icon.
• Hover on and click on the Letter Icon and select Create a new Letter

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to View Application and Screening Settlements (Payouts)?","This article will show you how to get a breakdown of the Application and Screening payout / settlement","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-view-application-settlements","

Application fees are not tracked in Rentvine's trust accounting. The Application and Screening fees are remitted to the bank account that we have on file (typically your business operating bank account).

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How To Set Up Default / Global Recurring Charges","This article will show you how to configure a default set of recurring charges. These recurring charges will then be pre-filled for you as you are creating a financial lease during the move in process for all leases you create.  ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-set-up-global-recurring-charges","<ol>
<li>Navigate to the Global Settings section of your Rentvine account
• Go to the settings page (click on the ellipsis next to your name in the lower left corner of the page and select Settings)

column2: section, click on Recurring Charges

column1: • On the right side, click on the green New Default Recurring Charge button
<li>In the Add Recurring Charge screen, fill out the fields below
• Select the Charge Account from the drop down menu
• The Description will pre-fill based on the name of the charge account, but you can adjust this if needed

• Enter in an Amount if the amount for the charge is typically consistent among all or most of your leases. This is not a required field, so you can leave this field blank, and enter in the amount at the time of the lease creation. You will also be able to adjust this amount if you do enter in an amount at this time

• The next time you create a financial lease (Move In process), the recurring charge(s) you just created will appear on the Recurring Charges screen automatically, along with a recurring charge for your rent account
You do not need to create a default recurring charge for Rent.
column2: The Move In process already includes that recurring charge.

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Create or Edit an Owner Statement Setting and Add Reports to the Statement","Custom Owner Statements for Every Owner. Share as much or as little information with your owners as you want to on your statements. Create different owners statements to meet the owners needs of what they would like to see on their statements.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-create-a-custom-owner-statement","

Rentvine is the only property management software that allows property managers to create multiple, custom owner statements. We have found that many customer service issues occur because of confusing owner statements. Give your owners the information they demand.

Your customers are different, and owner statements are not one size fits all. Rentvine helps you deliver perfect customer service to your clients. 90% of your owners will be satisfied with one standard statement but for those other 10% create additional custom statement settings to meet those particular owner requirements. Simply turn each module and option on or off!
Easy Customization for Large Portfolios - Consolidate your data!
Consolidate rents and management fees for your bigger portfolios. No need to show dozens of individual management fees and rents received from multiple tenants in multiple units. Unless you want to!
Add Multiple Custom Reports to Statement Packets
In addition to custom statements, property managers can provide their customers with multiple custom reports in each statement packet.
Show Paid Bills (attached as a Rentvine generated PDF)

column2: (attached as a Rentvine generated PDF)

column1: Include Multiple Custom Financial Reports
Where do I edit my owner statement settings or setup additional owner statement settings?

All owner statement settings are available in your global settings. Think of these statement settings as templates, each with different module options selected, controlling how future statements are generated. Statement settings can be applied to each portfolio individually.
If you do not see the option to update statement settings please check with the account owner as to your access level.
Go to the settings page (click on the ellipsis next to your name in the lower left corner of the page and select Settings)
Click on ""Statements"" under Accounting Settings. If you do not have access to this setting please contact the account owner.

This will return a list of ALL statement settings within your account. You can choose to view/edit an existing statement by clicking on the statement name or create a new statement by clicking the new statement setting button at the top right of the screen.

**If you edit an existing statement setting it will update the settings for all portfolios that are currently setup to receive that statement going forward. This is a global update. This only affects future statements.

If you choose to create a new statement setting, please give it a name that will help identify that statement setting. Click ""Save"" to generate the statement settings default and begin your customizations!
Click on the ""Edit"" button to begin customizing your statement setting.
Completed Work Orders and Paid Bills (attached as a Rentvine generated PDF)

The first option in the statement settings allows you to control if the owners are able to see COMPLETED work orders or PAID bills. As always these items are optional. Simply toggle the individual options on and off.
Changing these settings will affect any upcoming statements. Changing the settings will not update existing generated or published statements.
Include Paid Bill Attachments and Completed Work Order Attachments
You can also choose to include any Paid Bill Attachments or Completed Work Order Attachments.
column2: Work order attachments may include documents uploaded by tenant to the work order from the portal. Paid bill attachments may include vendor invoices.&nbsp

column1: Choose if you would like to include attachments with markups or discounts. If you suppress these items from the owner, we suggest you do not include them on the statement settings.
• Attachments do not need to be ""Shared with Owner"" to be attached
Example Statement Packet including Additional Customer Reports, Completed Work Orders, Paid Bills and Attachments. Each item is a PDF that can be viewed, downloaded and printed as needed.
The summary section is optional. This is a great overview for owners to help them understand their portfolio activity, balances and payout.
""Break After Module"" is a page break. If you toggle this option On, it will have only the summary on the first page. Additional modules start on the next page. This option shows in each module.

The summary module was designed to resemble a bank statement which is something that most owners should be comfortable with and understand how to read. The statement summary module allows you to share beginning balances, income, expenses and adjustments (equity and non-held liabilities). Clearly show the amount of the owner distribution, and any reserves being held. This summary identifies to the owner how much money they will receive and how that amount was calculated.

Need to hold additional reserves for upcoming work orders or unpaid bills? The summary will show those reserved funds and the reason for the additional reserve. Additional reserve notes will be included with a ** below the reserves section.

The summary module is broken into a few important sections. The summary balance shows, for the statement period, the beginning balance, any income, expenses, adjustments and the ending balance. This number may not match the distribution amount, in green.

column3: src=""https://f.hubspotusercontent20.net/hubfs/9252921/screencapture-123pm-rentvine-api-manager-portfolios-statements-files-356-preview-2021-09-17-14_22_38-edit%20(1).png"" width=""395"">The Total Distribution Amount takes into consideration any additionally held reserves which you can choose to show or hide lower in the statement.

column1: The total distribution amount shown in GREEN will match the check, e-check, or fund transfer to the owner.

In addition to your normal reserves, Rentvine allows you to create additional reserve categories for anything from taxes to remodels. Also show reserves for unpaid bills and open work order estimates. Any additional reserves will show below as a note ** Property Taxes

This yellow warning appears when portfolio balance goes below reserve amount. This takes into consideration unpaid bills. Notify the owner of funds needed to bring the account back to required reserve including unpaid bills if any.
Tax summary is typically used for year end reporting to show total taxable income. Choose if you would like to include prepayments in this statement setting.

Show owners a summary of all income, expenses and adjustments. Show the amount and ending balance. Choose to show ""Year to Date"" or restrict the information to the date range of the statement that is generated. The summary is a high level view showing all transactions by type for the entire portfolio.
There is a black line showing 1 of 3 that is a break in the page.

Show owners transaction details for every property and unit within their portfolio. The transactions are grouped by property or units. You choose whether to consolidate items based on owner preference.

column2: >Consolidations allow you to choose how granular you would like to get within the owner statement. Some owners would like to see all of the data broken out by units, transactions by date, income or management fees while others with multiple properties or units would rather see only the totals for the statement period.&nbsp

column1: • Consolidate Units - if toggled on, all unit transactions that are part of a multi unit property will be consolidated to the property. I.e., the unit details will not be shown

column2: - if toggled on, all transactions will be grouped by the GL / Chart of Account. i.e., the transactions will not be broken out by date, rather it will be a total amount for the statement period. (Typically used for Year End type statements).

column1: • Consolidate Income - if toggled on, all income type transactions will be grouped by the GL / Chart of Account. i.e., the income transactions will not be broken out by date, rather it will be a total amount for the statement period.

• Consolidate Mgmt Fees - if toggled on, all management fee transactions will be grouped by the GL / Chart of Account. i.e., the management fee transactions will not be broken out by date, rather it will be a total amount for the statement period.
This allows you to select the order in which the transactions appear in the statement. Date is the default order setting.
This setting will show the increase and decrease with each transaction. Keep this option off to see only starting balance and ending balance.
Choose to show or hide the Payee or Payer name of the transaction.
column2: NOTE: A payment from a tenant will not show the tenant name, instead it will show ""resident""

column1: Choose to show or hide the property reserve.
Net change for each unit on the portfolio balance. There is also a ""Statement Net"" shown before the ending balance.
This allows you to select the order in which the properties appear in the statement. Name is the default order setting or you can select number.

The transaction details for each property and unit within the portfolio will be displayed, showing the transactions in chronological order along with a running balance. These transactions will be listed individually based on their dates, without grouping them by property or unit.
Choose to show or hide the Payee or Payer name of the transaction.
column2: NOTE: A payment from a tenant will not show the tenant name, instead it will show ""resident""

column1: If you want to, you can show your owners a list of any open work orders so that owners will always know what to expect on future statements. These estimates will account for additional reserves on the portfolio seen in the summary module.
If you want to, you can show your owners a list of work orders that were closed during the reporting period of the statement.
column2: It will show the closed status and the amount billed for that work order.

column1: If you want to, you can show owners their unpaid bills and why the funds are being reserved. This can help to clear up any questions owners may have in regards to the summary module showing additionally held reserve amounts.

This is essentially your ""Rent Roll."" This module shows owners current rent, security deposits withheld and current lease start and end dates for every unit in their portfolio. As always, this section is optional. Unit balance, tenant names and lease move-in date are optional.

Need to provide your owners with additional notes that you have made throughout the reporting period? Enable the notes section to display notes shared with owner from various sections of the software. Notes must be shared with owner to appear in the statement.
Share with owner anywhere. Click the three dots to share with owner. Note that was CREATED within the statement date
range will be shared with the owner. Date can be modified to show on a different reporting period.
Changing this date to the past will NOT update existing or previously published statements.
Notes that are shared with the owner will appear with the date posted. Please be sure to include information about the property or object in the note if the owner has more than one property.
Statement Packets: Include Multiple Custom Financial Reports
Attach any custom report that you would like to your owner’s statement packet. Always deliver the information that your customers demand, automatically.
In the upper right section of the statement settings page click on the Add button next to Reports.

Once you select a report, you will be able to choose the file type this report is generated in. This includes JSON, PDF, CSV, or Excel. You will also be able to choose if this includes headers or not. If you choose a PDF you can also choose if this is in portrait or landscape.
A popular choice is to include a Cash Flow report for year end statements
Owner statements are available in the portfolio -->
column2: Statements tab. Click on a date range to view that statement packet.&nbsp

column1: The statement packet will show each individual report as well as any work orders, attachments, bills or bill attachments IF enabled in the statement settings

Create statements without publishing them if you would like. This allows you to review or spot check your statements for accuracy before your owners see them. If you are confident in your statements, you can create and publish with one click.
How to Preview Owner Statements Before Publishing
When your statements are ready and published, your owners receive notification that their statement packet is ready and in their portfolio. Send one or all of your statements automatically.
How to Send/Publish Owner Statements

column2: >Don't Forget to Save Your Changes!","Portfolios","Owner Statements","add report,attach report,custom owner statement,customize statement,end of year,end of year statement,owner packet,owner statement,statment,year end,year end statement","2025-07-14T15:42:50.879Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Find & Download a NACHA File","If you have made a payment in Rentvine where the payment method was NACHA File, this article will walk you through the steps of locating and downloading the NACHA file.  ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-download-a-nacha-file","<div class=""hs-callout-type-tip"" data-hs-callout-type=""tip"">

column3: one of the most common types of payment files and is used to execute domestic ACH payments through the National Automated Clearing House Association.

column2:
>
NACHA payments must be enabled on the bank account in order to generate a NACHA file.
column3: Click here if you need to enable NACHA payments first.

column1: • Click on Money Out from the drop down
• In the Money Out screen, click on the Payment Batches tab
• Locate the correct payment batch and click on it. There will be a total in the ACH column if one or more of the payments within that batch were made via NACHA file
• After clicking on the correct payment batch, click the green Actions button on the right side
• Click on Download NACHA File from the drop down
• The Effective Date of the NACHA File will pre-fill, but you can change the date if necessary
• Click the green Download button
• From here, you can go through your normal process of uploading that file to your bank

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Return a Security Deposit to an Owner Outside of the Move-Out Flow","This article will walk you through the process of returning a security deposit to an owner who is not in your Rentvine account.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-return-a-security-deposit-to-a-new-owner/an-owner-who-is-not-in-your-rentvine-account","<h4>&nbsp

column2: >This process will walk you through refunding the security deposit outside of the move-out flow. If you are offboarding this owner or would like to do this through the move-out flow, you can follow the leases section of this article here.

column1: Sometimes, you will run into the scenario where an owner sells a property, and you have to return the security deposit on that property's lease to the new owner. Oftentimes, that owner will not be in your Rentvine account as an owner contact or a portfolio. If that is the case, please follow the steps below to send the security deposit to the new owner.
<li>Go to the specific lease that you would like to refund the security deposit
• Click on Leases on the left side of the screen
• In the search field, type the tenant(s) name or the address for the lease
• When you have located the lease, click on it
<li>While in the lease, add any charges to the lease that you need to first (ex., tenant damages)
• To add charges, click on the green Actions button, and then click on Add Charge
• Fill out the necessary fields to create the charge
• After adding charges, go back into the lease
• Click on the green Actions button, and click on Release Deposit
• Enter the full Amount of the deposit at the top, and then fill in a Description
• In the Deposit Balances section, enter the full amount of the deposit again in the Security Deposit field in the middle under Release Amount

• If you created charges, you should see them under the Pay Charges section. Fill in the amount of money you would like to apply to those charges in the Amount to Pay field if you want to pay those charges using part of the security deposit.
column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-09-04%20at%2010-26-06%E2%80%AFAM-png.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • You should now see that the Total Open Credit amount at the bottom has changed. This will be the total security deposit less any charges that you are paying from this security deposit
• Click on the green Post button at the bottom right
• Click on the green Actions button, and click on Refund
<li aria-level=""1"">Fill out the information on the top section
• The Bank Account will pre-fill to the Lease Refund account on that portfolio's posting setting, but this can be changed if needed
• Enter a Memo for the check if you would like
• For the Name on Check, overwrite the tenant's name and fill in the name of the new owner
• Date Posted will default to today, but you can adjust this if necessary
• The Check Number will default to the next check number in order of your Rentvine account, but you can override this by entering a different check number
• For Payment Address, click on Custom Address to the right and fill in the address of the new owner
• Enter the amount you would like to refund in the Amount to Refund field (this will default to the total open credit)
• Click the green Refund button at the bottom
column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-07-03%20at%2010-27-18%E2%80%AFAM-png.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">
column5: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-07-03%20at%2010-30-06%E2%80%AFAM-png-1.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • On the next screen, click the green Actions button
• Select Print Checks, and mail the check to the new owner

• The final step is recording a bank transfer within Rentvine. The final step will only apply to you if you return security deposit money from a bank account that is separate from the bank account that you hold that money for the duration of the lease (i.e. you hold security deposits in a separate escrow security deposit bank account, but you refund the money to the tenant from your operating trust rental account). If this step does apply to you, then you will want to transfer the money at your bank, and you will also want to record a new bank transfer in Rentvine as well to account for the transfer at your bank.
If you only have one bank account, or if you refund security deposits from the same bank account that you hold that money in, then the final step will not apply to you.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How To Send Remote Checks When Making Payments out of Rentvine","This article will walk you through the process of sending a payment via remote check","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-send-remote-checks-when-paying-vendors-or-owners","<div class=""hs-callout-type-note"" data-hs-callout-type=""note"">

column2: >If you would like to have your Rentvine account configured to send remote checks, please reach out to Rentvine Support at support@rentvine.com. This is the first step to being able to send remote checks out of your Rentvine account. Once configured, please follow the steps below to send remote checks.
>Please Note: Remote Checks cost $1 per Remote Check sent out.

column1: • The process of sending remote checks is the same as paying a vendor or owner by check, but instead of printing the checks, you will select the option to send remote checks. The payment method selected for that vendor or owner must be set to 'check' before submitting the payment. This article will start at the point where you have already submitted at least one check payment. Proceed to the Money Out screen and select a bill(s) to pay, or an owner(s) to pay. For additional help on paying bills or paying owners, please visit How to Pay Bills or How to Pay Owners
column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-05-30%20at%2010-10-00%20AM-png.png"" width=""206"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • After you have submitted the payment(s), you will be taken to the Payment Batch screen. Click on the green Actions button on the right side
• On the confirmation pop-up, select the payments from the batch that you would like to send via remote check by clicking the checkboxes next to the payments
• Click on the Send button. All payments that you have selected will automatically send checks on your behalf
• To view the remote check(s) that you have sent, click on that payment under Check Payments from within the Payment Batch

• That will take you to the Payment Details screen for that specific payment, where you will see Remote Checks down towards the bottom. Click on View Check Image, and that will open the image of the check in a new tab
<li>If you need to view this check image again at a later time, or if you need to resend the remote check, you can do this by finding that specific payment from <strong>Accounting &gt
column2: Money Out and then clicking on the Payments tab. Locate that specific payment and then click on it to get to the Payment Details view, such as in the image above
>Here is an example of what a Remote check will look like when sending to Vendors.&nbsp
>Please note that this will also be for any refunds done by check at the lease level as well.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Creating a Lease Through the Application Process","This article will walk you through how to create a lease from an application that was submitted on a property.

,en","https://help.rentvine.com/creating-a-lease-through-the-application-process","{% video_player ""embed_player"" overrideable=False, type='hsvideo2', hide_playlist=True, viral_sharing=False, embed_button=False, autoplay=False, hidden_controls=False, loop=False, muted=False, full_width=False, width='688', height='402', player_id='193674103331', style='' %}
1- Navigate to the ""Screening"" tab on the left hand navigation bar and select ""Applications""
2- Find the application you are wanting to create the lease for and click on the application
3- Using the green ""Actions"" button select ""Create Lease"". You will now be asked to enter the specifics of the lease through a lease generation flow

column2: >Details - Here you will be selecting the start and end dates of the lease along with the move in dates. Also on this page you will select your late fee setting for this lease and the specific agreed upon rent amount. Select ""Next"" at the bottom to proceed to the next section

>Tenants - Rentvine will automatically enter the Tenant, Cosigners, Occupants, Pets, Vehicles, and Emergency Contacts information from the application that you selected to the lease. You can also enter any renters insurance information on this page as well and is optional. Once satisfied with your entries go ahead and select ""Next"" at the bottom to proceed to the next section

column3: first see the Monthly Charges. These will always be due on the first of the month, and you can now add Escalations to the Monthly Charges.

column2: can be known as a predetermined date a Monthly Charge is to be increased. This saves your team time in having to do this manually on the lease and adjusting the amount. For example, if you have a predetermined date you would like to increase a Monthly Charge, such as the Rent Charge, you can do so here.

>On the same screen, you will also see, Advanced Recurring Charges, these can be something that is billed to the tenants that is not as frequent as a Monthly Charge. For example, if you were to bill your tenants an
column4: Fee quarterly, you can add those charges here.

column2: >You will see the Move In Charges next, which will pull the information of both the Default Monthly Charges and the Default Move In Charges.

column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202025-07-11%20at%201-45-23%E2%80%AFPM-png.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

column2: >You will also notice that the Defaulted Move In Charges
column4: are the only charges in this section that are fully priced. The rest of the Move In Charges will be those&nbsp

column1: You'll also notice the Security Deposit cannot be
column2: prorated. You can also notice that Deposits will be highlighted
column3: Green for easier visibility of the charge.

column2: >Depending on the settings you have for the Move In Proration, you can also see the last section labeled&nbsp

column6:
src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202025-07-11%20at%201-46-50%E2%80%AFPM-png-1.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

This section will be the Rent Charge, along with the Default Monthly Charges , and will prorate the charges for the second month of the lease

column2: >This will all show on the summary section of the move in flow

column3: - This is a detailed breakdown of the lease you created and will review important information like the Rent Amount, Tenants Information, and the Move in / Recurring charges. If there are any corrections needed you can use the ""Previous"" buttons to change a section or you can simply use the ""Edit"" features in each category. Lastly you can instantly send ""Portal Invitations"" and ""Activate"" the lease from this final review page by simply using the toggle buttons. Your lease will be created one you choose the ""Submit"" button on the bottom of the screen. You can also adjust the application status here if needed.

column1: *Note: If there is an active lease on the property you cannot use the ""Activate lease"" option, you will instead leave it toggled ""Off"" and the lease will be ""Pending"" until the current lease is closed.

column2: ","Screening","Applications & Screening","Lease Creation,add lease,applications,create a new lease,creating a lease,creating a new lease,lease,new lease,starting a lease","2025-07-30T19:33:09.132Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Create Scheduled Reports","This article will walk you through the process of scheduling reports to be automatically created and emailed at the frequency you choose. You can have these reports sent to yourself or the owner if you would like.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-create-scheduled-reports","

To create scheduled reports, you will first need to have at least one saved report. Follow the steps below to create a report, save a report, and then schedule a report.
• On the left side of the screen, click on Reports

column2: On the Reports screen, you will see two tabs, Details and Scheduled Reports. Under Details, there will be a section on the left for all of your Saved Reports, and there will be several sections for the standard reports that you can customize and create. If you already have a saved report, you will be able to create a schedule for that report. If not, select one of the reports from the other sections, such as Accounting Reports, Lease Reports, Portfolio Reports, etc.

column1: • After selecting a report, configure your Filters and additional filters on the first tab, then select Build Report.
Once you filter the report, you can add extra columns on the right-hand side to include more detail in the report
To group the report, click and drag the column into the row group section. This will group the report by the column you selected.
• In the top right corner, you can select the save option to save the report
• On the pop-up menu, give the report a name and click Save
• You will now see that report in your Saved Reports section
• Next, click on the Scheduled Reports tab
• On the right, click on the green New Scheduled Report button
• Complete the fields in the Add Scheduled Report pop-up
• Give the scheduled report a name that you would like to appear in the Scheduled Report Name field.
• In the To field, type in an email address where the report will be emailed. To enter multiple email addresses, hit the Tab button on your keyboard after entering each email address.
• If you would like to also blind carbon copy someone or multiple people on the report, enter their email address into the BCC field
• In the Subject field, enter a subject for the email that will be sent
• In the Message field, enter a message for the body of the email

column2: > field, enter the date that you want the first report to be sent

column1: • In the Repeat Every field, select a number that will correlate with the frequency field.

column2: > field, select the frequency from the drop-down menu that you would like the report to be created and emailed

column1: • Your scheduled report will now appear in the Scheduled Reports tab of the Reports section of your Rentvine account. If you ever want to delete this scheduled report or any other scheduled report, you can click the ellipses on the far right side of the report and click delete.
<li>You can click into the scheduled report to view it.&nbsp
• In here, you can click edit report to edit any of the report details, like the frequency or who this report gets sent out to.
• If you click add under the reports section, you can add any saved report that you have in the system, you can choose the export type, and if you would like to show headers.

column2: >Please note that you can add as many reports as you would like to this scheduled report, and it will add them as attachments when this gets sent out.
