Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Transfer a Management-Held Security Deposit to an Owner-Held Security Deposit","Are you already holding the tenant's security deposit and need to transfer it to the owner to hold for the life of the lease? This article will show you how to transfer it.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-record-owner-held-security-deposits","<h4>This article will show you how to initially collect the security deposit as a management-held security deposit.&nbsp
column2: Then, using the ""Transfer Deposit to Owner Held"" process to easily transfer it as an owner-held security deposit, and sending it out to the owner.

><strong>Please note that this is only when you want to record the deposit as being owner-held and still managing the current lease. If you want to forfeit the security deposit to the owner when completing the move-out, then please follow the <a href=""https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-return-a-security-deposit-on-a-lease-to-an-existing-owner"" rel=""noopener"">forfeiting the deposit to the owner.&nbsp

column1: Step 1 - Be sure to have a Chart of Account that is specific for Owner-Held Security Deposits.
<li>Before following the rest of this article,&nbsp
column2: you will need to create or check that you have a liability chart of account called ""Owner Held Security Deposit"" (ensure that the option ""is Tracked as Held"" is toggled OFF and ""is Tracked as Security Deposit"" is toggled ON).
column3: If you need to create this account, follow this article on How to Create a Chart of Account

column1: <h3>Step 2 - Create a charge on the lease for the Security Deposit&nbsp
• On the lease, use the green actions button ""Add Charge"". Use your normal security deposit chart of account.
• Click on the Green Actions button and select Add Charge from the dropdown menu.
<li aria-level=""1"">Fill out the New Lease Charge form:
• Account - Choose the appropriate security deposit account, which is typically the management-held security deposit account
• Amount - Type in the dollar amount that is being charged
• Description - Type in a comment, ie, Security Deposit
<li>Once the tenant pays the security deposit charge that was just created, you can move on to the next steps.&nbsp
column2: The tenant can pay this via the portal, or the property manager can record the manual payment (check, cash, money order)

column1: Step 3- Transfer the Security Deposit to the Owner
• From the lease, use the green actions button and select ""Transfer Deposit To Owner"".
• Choose the Owner Held Security Deposit liability chart of account.
• Enter the amount you are transferring to the owner.
• Choose the bank account you will send the funds from.
• Choose the owner you are paying the Security Deposit to and hit ""Post.""
• Once you hit ""Post,"" a menu will display with three options.

• Pay Bill - Selecting this option will bring you to the bill being paid to the owner for the Security Deposit. Paying this bill will send the funds to the owner (Select this option to go ahead and send the funds to the owner)
• Go to Bill - Selecting this option will allow you to review the bill details (*note: you can pay this bill from the green actions button as well when viewing the bill)
• Go to Lease - Selecting this option will bring you to the lease page

<li>Once the bill has been paid, the funds are sent to the owner for them to hold the deposit. You will notice on the lease that the deposit is displayed, and on the owner's ledger, you will see the ""owner held security deposit"" amount listed.&nbsp
• When it comes time for the tenant to move out and the owner to send the funds back, the owner can return the deposit by performing an owner contribution. *This can be done right from the portal.

column2: >When the tenant moves out, you can follow this knowledge base article to process the security deposit.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Income Verification FAQs","Frequently Asked Questions about Income Verification.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/income-verification-faqs","
We encourage adding verbiage within your Rentvine Application Template (Income Verification Section Message) that states:
<blockquote><em>We highly recommend ALL applicants go through our Income Verification process. This Income Verification is through Plaid.&nbsp
column2: This process will allow you to securely sign into your online banking account to verify your income. The only information that is shared with the Property Management Company will be your income transaction history. For more information about Plaid’s Income Verification please visit&nbsp

column1: • How long does the income verification take?
• Once the application is submitted the Income Verification report will be available for you to review.
• Where will this option appear for the applicants when applying online?
• It will appear within the Income Verification section of your Rentvine application.
• Will we be able to view the documents provided?

• You can still require the applicants to manually upload the paystubs within the Document section of the application. That way you have the income verification report and their actual pay stubs to verify.
• How will this process work alongside TransUnion?
• This does not work along with TransUnion. They are two separate companies, we currently use Plaid for our Income Verification process.
• This is going to be an opt-in feature meaning that not every applicant has to choose this feature, correct?

• We implemented the opt out option because, if an applicant does not have an online banking account they will not be able to verify their income through the Plaid integration. Furthermore, if an applicant does not see their banking institution within Plaid’s banking network they again will not be able to go through the process. That is why we give them the option to opt out. We do recommend adding verbiage within the Income Verification Section message (within your Rentvine Application Template) letting the applicants know that you highly recommend going through the income verification process.

*To add, we give you over two (2) years of income transactions (Payroll, Deposit, Account Transfer, etc), and give you a 6 month average of their estimated monthly income. The Estimated Monthly Income you will receive is going to be Net instead of Gross.
What Does an Applicant See When Completing the Income Verification?

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Enable or Disable Automatic Tenant Past Due Balance Notices","Do you want to automatically send email notifications to tenants that have a past due balance on their lease? This article will show you how to enable or disable the past due balance notices on a lease","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-enable-past-due-balance-notification-email","

Enabling this feature will send an email notification to all tenants that have a past due current balance greater than $0.00 on an
column2: >Active lease. For example, if the current balance is due on the 1st, it will be considered past due on the 2nd and send out an email on the 2nd, regardless of any grace period.

column1: <h4>An email will be sent out once a day until the balance has been paid.&nbsp
column2: The tenant will have an option to silence the notification if they choose to.&nbsp
column3: If silenced, it will stop sending the emails for that month.&nbsp
column4: If the tenant still has a past due current balance the following month, the email notification will be sent out again. An example of the built in email notification is shown at the end of this article.

column1: • Go to the settings page (click on your profile name in the top right corner of the page and select Settings)

column2: Lease Settings under the Lease section
Enable Tenant Past Due Notices is set to No, click on the
column3: Edit button to enable it.

column2: Email template For Tenant Past Due Notices blank if you want to use the built in email notification template.
column3: Otherwise click on the box and select an existing email template that you already created (You can create your own Lease email template). Click Save.

column1: Note: If the ""Enable Tenant Past Due Notices"" is toggled off it will be disabled for all leases
<h4>Once the Past Due Notices are enabled in the global settings, by default all active leases will now send out past due notices.&nbsp
column2: if you want to disable it for individual leases, follow the steps below:

column1: <li>Click on the tab labeled ""Leases"" on the left side of the screen. This will pull up a list of all the leases you have.&nbsp
• Next you will search for the specific lease you want to change the past due notices in. You will then click on that property to pull up the lease.

• Stay in the tab labeled ""Details"". You will then look for a box labeled ""Lease Info"". In the top right of this box click the blue actions button then click the edit button to pull up fillable fields you can change.

• You will then look for the toggle that is labeled ""Tenant Past Due Notices Enabled"". Toggle this on or off depending if you want them enabled or disabled for this specific lease. Make sure to click the green save button at the bottom to save any changes made.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Trouble Accessing Portal","Are you receiving an error when trying to access your portal? such as ""This site can't be reached""","en","https://help.rentvine.com/trouble-accessing-portal","<ul>
<li>If you are experiencing difficulty accessing your portal and are receiving a message like the one below:&nbsp
• A possible reason is that the WIFI network that you are using may have a firewall/router/advanced security system that could be blocking access to the URL account.rentvine.com
• You can verify this by disconnecting from the WIFI network and use a different internet connection, such as your mobile phone's (LTE or 5G)
• Contact your ISP (Internet Service Provider) and let them know that you can't access the URL account.rentvine.com
<li>For example, if you are using using xFinity or comcast as your internet service provider a possible issue could be that you have ""Xfi Advanced Security"" turned on.&nbsp
column2: You may need to turn it off or contact Xfinity to troubleshoot further.&nbsp
column3:
Below is a link to a help article from Xfinity

https://www.xfinity.com/support/articles/using-xfinity-xfi-advanced-security

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How do you Configure ID Verification within the Application Template?","Enabling the Identity Verification section within your Application Builder.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-configure-id-verification-within-application-template","

Enabling the Identity Verification section will add Plaid Identity Verification to your application. Plaid provides a client that requires the applicant to upload photos of their identification documents. Plaid is able to verify the authenticity of the uploaded documents with a facial comparison from a selfie taken by the applicant.
• Locate your Username on bottom left hand side of Navigation
• Select which Application Template(s) you want to activate the ID Verification
• Click on the Ellipsis (three dots) - IF you have multiple application templates, you will do this for each application template you want ID Verification activated on
• Click within the pink-purple Identity Verification Section to activate this Section by clicking on the Active Toggle to the right hand side
• To save changes, Click on Save and Quit

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Credit a Tenant","Do you need to give a credit to a tenant?  The article below shows you how.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-add-a-lease-credit-credit-a-tenant","<div class=""hs-callout-type-tip"" data-hs-callout-type=""tip"">

When a lease credit is added, the credit is coming from the Owner / Portfolio of the property. This means that the Portfolio ledger will be decreased. A credit is typically applied to offset any unpaid rent or other charges on the tenant's account. As a result, the credit is reflected on the portfolio ledger as a decrease in the balance.

column2:
Rentvine has ledgers that work in a hierarchical manner, flowing from the tenant to portfolio. When a prepayment is made for example, those funds belong to the tenant until earned (applied to a charge on the lease). The cash is accounted for on the tenant ledger, which also ultimately means it is accounted for on the portfolio ledger as CASH. However, it is NOT available as OPERATING BALANCE, meaning that the funds, while accounted for and a part of total portfolio funds, are not available for things like paying bills or disbursing to the owner. Similarly when a LEASE CREDIT is issued and it is not applied to any charges, those funds are now technically tenant funds (until such time as they are applied against a charge). While it won't impact the CASH balance on the portfolio, it does impact the OPERATING CASH balance on the portfolio.

(Typically the Chart of Account associated with the lease credit is an income or expense).

If you are in Manager ledger mode, the credit can be given from the management company. To do this, you would use the ""Transfer From Manager"" toggle on the form. This toggle is only available in manager ledger mode and allows you to transfer a credit from the management company's ledger to the tenant's account.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Configure and Use RUBS (Ratio Utility Billing System)","This article will walk you through the steps on how to configure and utilize Rentvine's Ratio Utility Billing System.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-configure-and-use-rubs","<h4>What is RUBS? RUBS stands for Ratio Utility Billing System. RUBS uses an algorithm available to spread various bills across multi-unit properties.&nbsp
column2: RUBS is typically associated with a complex/buildings that have many units that are not sub-metered.

column1: 1. For your Multi-Unit properties you will a have a setting under the details section named Utility Billing.
Select the '+' in the top right of this box to add a utility billing configuration.
2. Once you have selected to configure this setting the system will ask you to set your parameters for RUBS.
• Utilities- This drop down menu will have you select the type of utility.

column3: You will select the Vendor associated with the utility, the vendor must be in the system under Vendor Contacts.
typically when choosing the bill charge account, you want to select an Expense Account. Due to the fact the owner is paying for the bill, this is usually an expense.
The Lease Charge Account is being paid by the tenant, this is typically an Income account.
This is if there is a percentage being paid by the tenant and owner. If this does not apply and the tenant will pay for the full Bill, you will enter 100% in this field.
The drop down menu will have you select from the following:
split by number of tenants (The lease that has more Tenants will pay more).
based on square footage / (square footage has to be filled out in Unit details section.)
per bedroom / (amount of bedrooms has to be entered in the Unit details section).

column2: >Tenant and Occupant - split by number of tenants and occupants (The lease that has more Tenants and Occupants will pay more).

column1: If studio is selected, please select 1 bed. If studio needs to be charge accordingly.
Please Note: Allocations only apply to ACTIVE status leases.
If a lease is in a Closed or Pending status, when adding RUBS Billing it will NOT charge those leases.

column2: >3. Once you have configured the above the next step is to add a Utility Bill.
><strong>If the Property does not have a utility configured the system will bring up an error.&nbsp
column3: Go to the property view and follow steps 1 and 2 above.

column2: >Once the Property and Utility are selected, you will see. Utility Info section appear to the right of your screen.

column1: Utility Info will pull from the configuration created at the Property Level

column2: These fields are optional but you may enter info for your records.
This date is when you would like the lease charge to be posted.
Total Dollar Amount of the Utility Bill.
The period of time in which the owner was billed for.
>Once you have entered all the information above you can click ""Save.""
>If the Utility Bill is voided, this Action will NOT void the tenant lease Charges.

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How Do You Enable a Generic Application?","A Generic Application will allow applicants to apply even if you do not have any active listings on the market. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-do-you-enable-the-generic-application","

If you would like to have the option to allow applicants to apply to a property that may not be available yet, you can enable a Generic Application and link it to an application template.
column2: The Generic Application will allow applicants to continue without selecting an Address to Apply For.&nbsp

column1: Follow these steps to enable your Generic Application:

column2: in the top right to view a list of items.

column1: <li>Click on the pencil icon in the top right of this section.&nbsp
• Locate Generic Application Enabled and turn the toggle ON

• Click Toggle ON for Available Units Only (If you want this setting on, it will only show the available units in the Address Field drop-down. However, any address entered will be allowed to be applied for.)
• Select the Application Template you want linked to the Generic Application
• Go to your Public Apply Application URL to view
• Applicants will click on the Green Icon, Continue without Address, to apply
• The application is not linked to a property, so Applicants will have to enter the property address they want to apply for

column2: ","Screening","Applications & Screening","Generic,How to turn on generic application,applications,blank application,enable generic application,generic app,generic application","2025-08-07T13:15:28.466Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Generate Mass Letters","This article will guide you through the process of generating Mass Letters to multiple recipients. This will allow you to send a letter to a mass selected group of tenants, vendors or owners. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-generate-mass-letters","
In Rentvine you are able to Generate Mass Letters for Leases, Vendors, and Portfolios.
When generating Mass Letters for Portfolios and Leases there are multiple ways of completing this action.
Generating Mass Letters from the Portfolio section in Rentvine:
• Click Portfolios in the left side navigation
<li>Select the Actions button on right side of the screen&nbsp
• Click ""Generate Letters"" from the drop down. See screenshot below:
Generate Mass Letters from the Lease section in Rentvine:
• Click on Leases in the left side navigation
• Select the Actions button on the right side of the screen
• Click ""Generate Letters"" from the drop down. See screenshot below:
Generate Mass Letters from the Contact section on Rentvine:
<li>Click on Contacts in the left side navigation&nbsp
• Select ""Messages"" from the drop down, see screenshot below:
• Then click the ""Actions"" button on the right side of the screen.
• Select the type of Mass Letter you would like to create.
• The system will then ask you to select the recipients of the Mass Letter
• After you select your recipients, you'll then need to select the Letter Template you want to generate from the drop down option then select Create.

• Once the Mass Letter is created, the next screen that will appear is the Mass Letter Details. This will give you a quick summary of the Mass Letter that was generated, along with the date created, recipients, and if the letters were processed.
Once the Mass Letters have been generated, you can send it via email or view / download if you wish to print them instead
<li>Select the Actions button on right side of the screen&nbsp
column2: You can then select from the drop down options, if needed

","Settings & General","General","Generate Mass Letters,How to generate mass letters,Lease Mass Letters,Mass Letters,Portfolio Mass Letters,Vendor Mass Letters,create letter,create letters for multiple recipients,generate letter,how to send out letters to everyone,letters,multiple letters,sending out multiple letters,sound out mass letter","2024-05-30T20:22:58.392Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Record a Security Deposit","This article will walk you through the steps of charging a security deposit and collecting the funds for said security deposit. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-record-a-security-deposit","<h3>Step 1 - Create a charge on the lease for the Security Deposit&nbsp
• On the lease, use the green actions button ""add charge"". Use your normal security deposit chart of account.
• Click on the Green Actions button and select Add Charge from the dropdown menu.
<li aria-level=""1"">Fill out the New Lease Charge form:
• Account - Choose the appropriate security deposit account
column2: this is typically the management-held security deposit account.

column1: • Amount - Type in the dollar amount that is being charged
• Description - Type in a comment, ie, Security Deposit

column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-07-03%20at%203-03-16%E2%80%AFPM-png-3.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: <h3>Step 2 - The Tenant pays the Security Deposit charge&nbsp
• The tenant can record a receipt via the portal by submitting an eCheck or Credit Card payment, or the property manager can manually record the receipt (check, cash, money order
• If you are manually recording this payment and have a separate bank account that holds Security Deposits, change the bank account from Auto
column2: to Your Security Deposit Bank Account.

column1: • Once the charge is paid, the lease will show that there is a held security deposit.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Edit the Name of a Portfolio","This article explains how to edit the name of any portfolio in Rentvine.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-edit-the-name-of-a-portfolio","

The name of the portfolio will be for all of this owner/owners properties and leases. This name will appear in many places in Rentvine and can be whatever you want or however you want to associate it.

To start, go to the desired portfolio you would like to change the name of. From there you will go into the details tab of the portfolio. You will then click the ""Edit"" button in the top right of the Details box.

This will bring up a sidebar and in the name space delete the previous name and type in the new desired name of the portfolio. When you are done make sure to click save at the bottom of the screen to save that new name.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to View a Portfolio Ledger","This article will show you how to view and understand the Portfolio Ledger.  It will show all the increases and decreases to that ledger along with the balance on it.

,en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-view-a-portfolio-ledger","The portfolio ledger is a combination of every single transaction that has happened on every property and lease under this portfolio. You will be able to view every one of these transactions by clicking the hyperlinks attached. You will also get a breakdown of what account all the money is in. For example, you will be able to see all of the money that you have in accounts flagged as ""Held Liability"". You can also hover over the black 'i' icon to get a breakdown of why money is in this account.
• Next, select the portfolio you want to view
• Select Ledger from the Top Navigation menu
<li>The ledger will show all financial details for that portfolio along with all the increases and decreases to that ledger with the balance attached.&nbsp

column2: >For more information on the balances on the top of the page, click here

column1: • Lastly, you can customize the report and add additional filters select the ""Edit Report"" button. You can also add columns by clicking the right navigation to view all columns.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Impersonate an Owner Portal","This article will show you how impersonate an owner portal and see what an owner can see in their portal.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-impersonate-an-owner-portal","

Impersonating an owner portal will give you the ability to view the owner's portal and see everything that they can see when they log in. Some actions will be blocked in this mode like making contributions for the owner.

column16: ><iframe width=""undefined"" height=""undefined"" src=""https://www.loom.com/embed/bd63f8c6b654468fa9e35bed1f2695e6"" frameborder=""0"" webkitallowfullscreen="""" mozallowfullscreen="""" allowfullscreen="""" style=""position: absolute

column1: The first step is to go to the portfolio tab on the left side of the page. Click or search for the portfolio with the owner you would like to impersonate. In the owner contact box click on the owner.

When you are in the owner profile scroll down to the box labeled ""portal access"". In the top right of that box click on ""View Owner Portal"". This will take you into impersonation mode in that owner's account. You will have limited access to certain actions of their portal but you will be able to view everything that they can see.

Another way to get there is to go to the contacts tab on the left side of the page. Then you will click on the owners tab and type in the desired owner you would like to impersonate and click on them.
After that you will just follow the same steps listed above by scrolling down to the portal access box and clicking ""View Owner Portal"".

column2: ","Portfolios","Portfolios","How to view owners portal,Owner portal view,What does the owner portal look like,owner portal impersonation mode","2025-05-09T20:02:19.177Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Edit the Posting Setting of a Portfolio","This article will show you how to edit the posting setting of any portfolio","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-edit-the-posting-setting-of-a-portfolio","
The Posting Setting allows you to configure which bank account funds should automatically post to when transactions are entered into Rentvine for any properties/units that are owned by the portfolio.

The first step is to click on the portfolio tab on the left of the screen and select the specific portfolio for which you want to edit the posting setting. The next step will be to go into the details tab of the portfolio. Then click the ""Edit"" button in the top right of the details box.

This will open up a sidebar on the right side on the screen. In that sidebar click on the dropdown menu labeled ""Posting Setting"". This will give you all the options for posting settings set up and change it for the selected portfolio.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Send Chat Messages to the Owners of a Portfolio","This article will show you how to send chat messages to the owners of a portfolio.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-send-chat-messages-to-the-owners-of-a-portfolio","<div class=""hs-callout-type-tip"" data-hs-callout-type=""tip"">
Chat messages are sent to all owners of a portfolio. If a portfolio has more than one owner, all the owners will receive the chat message.
column2: Once the chat message is sent, owners will be notified by text or email letting them know they have received a chat message.&nbsp
column3: The notification will contain a link that they can click on so they can view the message and/or reply.

column15: ><iframe width=""640"" height=""372"" src=""https://www.loom.com/embed/f5d524f6cd224efab78c2658737e31df"" frameborder=""0"" webkitallowfullscreen="""" mozallowfullscreen="""" allowfullscreen="""" style=""position: absolute

column1: The first step is to click on the portfolio tab on the left side of the screen. The next step is to click or search for the specific portfolio to which you want to send a chat message. Once you select that portfolio you will click the ""Chat"" tab.

The next step is to write the message in the messaging field. You can also upload files in the designated field under the message. Make sure to press the green Send button on the right when done writing your message to send it to the owner. In this tab you will also be able to see old chat messages sent, search for old messages, and print the chat.

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Send a Text Message to an Owner","This article will show you how to send a text message to any owner in Rentvine","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-send-a-text-message-to-an-owner","

Text messages use a phone number that is created with your Rentvine account. This will be the same number for everything and doesn't change. Whenever a text is sent out, the replies will appear in this section shown in this article. Notifications will be sent out to whoever sent the last text message.

The first thing you will do is click on the portfolio tab on the left side of the screen. Then you will select the specific portfolio with the owner you want to send a text message to. Once you are viewing the portfolio, click on the ""Messages"" tab at the top.

The next step is to click on the contact dropdown in the text messages box and select the owner or contact you want to message. You will compose your message in the message field at the bottom of the text messages box. When done click on the green send button to send your text message to the contact. This box also will contain previous text messages sent back and forth that you can scroll to read.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Send an Email to an Owner","This article will show you how to send an email to any owner in Rentvine.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-send-an-email-to-an-owner","

The email is one line of communication you can have with an owner. If you generate an email in Rentvine, you will be able to reply from your email client but the email thread will still show in Rentvine. This only happens if the first email was sent through this page shown below.

The first thing you will do is click on the portfolio tab on the left side of the screen. Then select the specific portfolio with the owner you want to send an email. Once you are on the portfolio view page, click on the ""Messages"" tab at the top.

Once you are in the messages section you will click on the ""Compose"" button that is located in the top right of the Email box. This will bring up a pop-up window for you to write your email. This section will also show previous email messages sent to this owner.
• Select an email template if you have previously made any in the email template dropdown. You can also check a box to be able to email a copy to yourself.
• Add additional recipients to the email or add BCC.
• Write the body of the email in the message field.
• There will be a field called attachments under messages where you can add any files you want to attach to the email.
<li>When you are done composing your message, make sure you click the green send button to send the email to the recipients.&nbsp

","Portfolios","Portfolios","How to email an owner,How to send an email to an owner,email an owner,email owner,how to create email for owner,how to email owner,owner email,send email,where to email an owner","2025-05-09T20:18:43.225Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Edit the Default Owner Statement Setting of a Portfolio","This article will show you how to edit or change the default owner statement on any portfolio in Rentvine","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-edit-the-default-owner-statement-setting-of-a-portfolio","

The default owner statement setting will be the statement setting automatically selected when creating new owner statements. You can create as many statement settings as you would like. This article will show you how to change this at the portfolio level.

column16: ><iframe width=""undefined"" height=""undefined"" src=""https://www.loom.com/embed/ae4ad3d5d32c4036b8f7e0da3884c78f"" frameborder=""0"" webkitallowfullscreen="""" mozallowfullscreen="""" allowfullscreen="""" style=""position: absolute

column1: The first step is to click on the ""Portfolios"" tab on the left side of the screen. When in that tab select or search for the specific portfolio you want to edit the owner statement of. The next step is to go into the box labeled ""Details"" and click on the button in the top right labeled ""Edit"".

When you click the edit button a side bar will pop up on the left side of the screen. There will be a drop down box labeled ""Statement Setting"". You will click on this and select whatever statement setting you want to be the default. Once selected you will need to press the green save button at the bottom of the side bar.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Add Photos/Images to Properties","This article will show you how to add photos/images to a specific property in Rentvine. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-add-photos/images-to-any-property-in-rentvine","
The images in this section will be the images used for marketing when you activate the listing for this property.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Edit the Square Footage of a Property or Unit","Is the square footage wrong or an addition has been made to the property? This article will show you how to edit the square footage on any property or unit in Rentvine.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-edit-the-square-footage-of-a-property-or-unit","

The first step is to click on the ""Property"" tab on the left side of the screen then click ""Properties"". Then you will need to select the property you want to edit the square footage of. Once selected you will look in the ""Details"" tab for a box called ""Rental Details"". In the top right of the box, you will click the Edit button.

Once you click edit a small tab will pop out with different options. You will look for the size bar and enter the correct square footage of this property or unit. When you are done click on the green update button at the bottom of the window to save changes.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Edit the Property Type of a Property","Is the property type (Single Family, Townhouse, Multiplex, etc.) incorrect and needs changed? This article will show you how to change that.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-edit-the-property-type-of-a-property","<div class=""hs-callout-type-caution"" data-hs-callout-type=""caution"">

column2: >Please note that if the toggle was selected for ""Multi-Unit"" in the creation of the property you will not be able to change it back to a single unit and vice versa

column1: The first step is to click on the ""Property"" tab on the left side of the screen then click ""Properties"". Then you will need to select the property you want to edit the property type of. Once selected you will look in the ""Details"" tab for a box called ""Details"". In the top right of the box, you will click the Pencil button.

Once you click edit a sidebar will pop out with different options. You will look for the ""Property Type"" dropdown box and select the correct property type for this property (i.e. Single Family Home, Condo, Apartment, etc.). When you are done click on the green Update button at the bottom of the sidebar to save changes.
Note: You can not switch from a single to a multi-unit or switch from a multi-unit to a single.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Edit the Name/Code of a Property or Unit","Do you need to change the name that shows before the address of the property? This article will show you how to edit that name/code.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-edit-the-name/code-of-a-property-or-unit","<div class=""hs-callout-type-tip"" data-hs-callout-type=""tip"">
The name field is useful if you would like to give the properties/units a unique naming convention that applies to your business.

The first step is to click on the ""Property"" tab on the left side of the screen then click ""Properties"". Then you will need to select the property you want to edit the name/code of. Once selected you will look in the ""Details"" tab for a box called ""Details"". In the top right of the box, you will click the pencil icon button.

Once you click edit, a side tab will pop out with different options. You will look for the ""Name"" field and type in what you would like the name/code to be for the property. When you are done, click on the green save/update button at the bottom of the sidebar to save changes.

The first step is to click on the ""Property"" tab on the left side of the screen then click ""Properties"". Then you will need to select the property you want to edit the beds and baths of. Once selected you will look in the ""Details"" tab for a box called ""Rental Details"". In top right box you will click the pencil icon button.
If you need to update a unit that is part of a multi-unit property, you will need to click on the units tab first and then and select the unit that you want to update.

Once you click edit a side tab will pop out with different options. You will look for the beds/half baths/full baths dropdown bars and enter in the correct amounts for this property or unit. When you are done click on the green save/update button at the bottom of the side tab

This article will show you how to change the address of any property or unit in Rentvine.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-edit-the-address-of-a-property-or-unit","

The first step is to click on the ""Property"" tab on the left side of the screen, then click ""Properties"". Then you will need to select the property you want to edit the address of. If you need to update the address of a unit that is part of a multi-unit property, you will need to click on the units tab first and then select the unit that you want to update.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Add a Property assignee to a Property or Unit","Do you have multiple property managers in your system and want them to be associated to certain properties? This article will show you how to add a property manager to any unit or property in Rentvine.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-add-a-property-manager-to-a-property-or-unit","

Adding property managers will give you a way to filter by property assignee when searching for properties and when running reports. This will not filter notifications as notifications are global and not broken down by the property and property manager associated with them.

The first step is to click on the ""Property"" tab on the left side of the screen, then click ""Properties"". Then you will need to select the property you want to edit the Property assignee. Once selected you will look in the ""Details"" tab for a box called ""Details"". In the top right of the box, you will click the pencil icon button.

Once you click edit a side tab will pop out with different options. You will look for the ""Property assignee"" dropdown/search box and click the property assignee you want associated with this property or unit. When you are done click on the green save/update button at the bottom of the side tab to save changes.

1.
column2: Click on the ""Property"" tab on the left side of the screen. Under that, click on the tab called ""Properties"" to pull up the entire list of properties.
Search for the specific property you want to add or edit appliances in.
column5: The next step is to go into the details tab inside of that property. Scroll down until you see a box labeled ""Appliances"". In the top right of that box click on ""Add Appliance"".

column2: This will pull up a side tab in the middle of the page where you will select the type of appliance you are adding. You will then fill out any other information you would like to add about the appliance. When you are done, make sure to click the green save button at the bottom of the sidebar to save any changes made.

column1: If you would like to edit an appliance:

Go to the same box labeled appliances. Once there is an appliance added, it will show up in this box. You will go to the appliance you want to edit, and on the right side of the screen, there will be three dots that you will click on. This will bring up a dropdown and select edit. This will bring up the same sidebar to add any information you would like.

This article will show you how to override the payment method set at the owner contact level.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-override-the-owner-contact-payout-method-of-a-portfolio","

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Add a Property to a Group","Have you created a property group and now want to add a certain property to that group? This article will show you how to do this.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-add-a-property-to-a-group","

Property groups are used to categorize certain properties for filtering and report purposes. You will be able to click the filter icon from the main properties tab and filter by all of the properties associated to a property group. You can also add property groups as filters and columns on all property/unit reports.
Before getting started you need to have already created a group in Rentvine. If you still need to do this please refer to ""How to Create a Property Group"".

column2: Once you have the group created you click on the ""Property"" tab on the left side of the screen. Under that click on the tab called ""Properties"" to pull up the entire list of properties.
Search for the specific property you want to add into a group.
The next step is to go into the details tab inside of that property. Scroll down until you see a box labeled ""Groups"" towards the bottom. In the top right of that box click on ""Add Group"".

This will pull up a menu that will have a dropdown. In the dropdown you will be able to type whatever group you have previously created. Make sure after selecting a group that you press the green add group button to save.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Edit the NSF Fee Amount of a Property or Unit","Do you want to change the NSF amount for a specific property to be different from the default NSF fee amount? This article will walk you through changing this.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-edit-the-nsf-fee-amount-of-a-property-or-unit","

1.
column2: Click on the ""Property"" tab on the left side of the screen. Under that click on the tab called ""Properties"" to pull up the entire list of properties.
Search for the specific property you want to edit the NSF fee of.
The next step is to go into the settings tab inside of that property. In this section you will see a box labeled ""Accounting Settings"". In the top right of this box you will click the pencil icon.
Once you click on the pencil icon, you will be able to go into the NSF Fee Amount field and change it to the desired amount. Ensure to click save to apply any changes.

column1: NOTE: When the NSF fee amount is defined here it will override the NSF fee in the global settings. The NSF fee amount on a property or unit is used as the default NSF fee when creating a lease (Move In)

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Share a File With an Owner, Tenant, or Vendor","This article will walk you through how to share a file that you have uploaded to your Rentvine account in specific areas throughout the software. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-share-a-file-with-an-owner-tenant-or-vendor","

Once you have uploaded a file to a specific section within Rentvine you will have the ability to share the file with a few different parties. These shared files will only then show up on that specific party members portal under ""documents"".
By navigating to any files menu tab within Rentvine you can select the ellipsis to the right hand side of the file you are trying to share and then select ""share with"" that party.
Depending on which section you are in within Rentvine will determine which parties you will have the ability to send the files too.
1- From a portfolio - The files within this section will allow you to share only with the owner.
2- From a property or a lease - The files within this section will have the ability to be shared with both the Owner and the Tenant of the property.
3- Files can also be attached to a specific user contact (Owner, Tenant, Vendor) - Sharing files under these sections will be shareable only to that specific contact.
4- Files can also be attached to work orders - In this case the files are shareable to the Owner, Tenant and the Vendor.
5- Upon sharing the file with any party member within Rentvine you will know it is being shared by the icon that displays ""sharing with"" and the contact label.

column2: ","Settings & General","General","How to share a file with owner,How to share a file with tenant,Where to share files,how to send an uploaded file to the owner,how to share a file,sending files after uploading,share file after uploading","2024-05-29T14:57:40.036Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Attach a File","This article will show you how to attach a file to specific areas within Rentvine. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-attach-a-file","

Files can be attached to certain areas within Rentvine. These specific sections include the following.
To attach a file you simply navigate to the section of the software that you are looking to add the file to and find the ""file"" menu tab.
From this section you will now have two options to upload a file
1- Drag and drop option - Select a file from your computer and drag it onto the screen right under the files column titles (usually depicted by a grey bar)
2- Use the ""Click to Select"" files option button - This will allow you to search your files on your computer to upload to the Rentvine files section.

column2: Click on the ""Property"" tab on the left side of the screen. Under that, click on the "" Properties "" tab to pull up the entire list of properties.
Search for the property you want to edit the management fee setting of.
The next step is to go into the settings tab inside that property. In this section, you will see a box labeled ""Management"". In the top right of this box, you will click on the pencil icon.
You can then select from the list of management fee settings you have created. When you are done make sure to click the green save button at the bottom to save any changes made.

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Add an Additional Reserve Amount and Description to a Portfolio","This article will show you how to add an additional reserve amount and a description to any portfolio in Rentvine","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-add-the-additonal-reserve-amount-and-description-to-a-portfolio","

The ""Additional Reserve Amount"" is an additional fixed amount that you can hold back from an owner when distributing funds to the owner. The summary section of the owner statement will show the additional reserve amount along with the description.

column2: The first step is to click on the ""Portfolios"" tab on the left side of the screen to pull up all portfolios
You will then search for the specific portfolio you would like to add an additional reserve amount and description on and click it.
In this section you will make sure you are in the tab labeled ""Details"". In this tab there will be a box also labeled ""Details"" that you will see.
In this box you will find a button labeled ""Edit"" in the top right. Click this button to pull up a sidebar that you can change anything in the details box.
In this sidebar you will look for a toggle labeled ""Additional Reserve"" and you can click on it to toggle it on.&nbsp

Once this is toggled on, two fillable fields will appear at the bottom labeled ""Additional Reserve Amount"" and ""Additional Reserve Description"". Fill in these fields and click the green save button at the bottom of the screen to save any changes.

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Remove Owners From a Portfolio","This article will show you how to remove any owner from any portfolio in Rentvine","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-remove-owners-from-a-portfolio","

Removing an owner will take away their distributions and any transactions associated with the portfolio

column2: The first step is to click on the ""Portfolios"" tab on the left side of the screen to pull up all portfolios
You will then search for the specific portfolio from which you would like to remove an owner and click on it
In this section,, you will make sure you are in the tab labeled ""Details"". In this ta,b there will be a box also labeled ""Owner Contacts"" that you will see.
In this box you will find a button labeled ""Edit"" in the top right. Click this button to pull up more settings to edit.
When editing, it will show all owners that you have under this portfolio. To remove an owner click on the red minus button on the right side of their contact.&nbsp

This will then bring up a confirmation screen that you want to delete the owner from the portfolio. You will click on the ""Confirm Removal"" button. When you are done click the green save button to save any changes made.

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Edit the Minimum or Maximum Distribution Amount of a Portfolio","This article will show you how to edit the minimum and maximum distribution amount of any portfolio in Rentvine","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-edit-the-minimum-and-maximum-distribution-amount-of-a-portfolio","

Setting an amount to either the maximum or minimum distribution amount fields of a portfolio will affect the amount that you can pay owners when going through the Pay Owner process.

For example, if a portfolio has $1,500 available for distribution, but its maximum distribution amount is set to $1,000. In that case, the Pay Owner page will restrict the distribution amount to $1,000.

Another example, if a portfolio has $1,500 ready for distribution, but its minimum distribution amount is set to $2,000. In that case, the Pay Owner page will restrict the distribution amount to $0.00.

column15: ><iframe width=""640"" height=""354"" src=""https://www.loom.com/embed/36286b2d2156473cb25b7803a6c20dd8"" frameborder=""0"" webkitallowfullscreen="""" mozallowfullscreen="""" allowfullscreen="""" style=""position: absolute

column2: The first step is to click on the ""Portfolios"" tab on the left side on the screen to pull up all portfolios
You will then search for the specific portfolio you would like to edit the minimum and maximum distribution amount of and click it.
In this section you will make sure you are in the tab labeled ""Details"". In this tab there will be a box also labeled ""Details"" that you will see.
In this box you will find a button labeled ""Edit"" in the top right. Click this button to pull up a side bar that you can change anything in the details box.

In the sidebar you will look for the boxes with fillable fields labeled ""Minimum Distribution Amount"" and Maximum Distribution Amount"". Fill these fields out and click the green save button at the bottom to save any changes made.

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Hold Distributions From Being Sent to an Owner","This article will show you how to prevent distributions from being sent to an owner by enabling the hold distribution setting on a portfolio.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-hold-distributions-from-being-sent-to-an-owner","

Enabling the hold distribution setting will affect the amount that you can pay owners when going through the Pay Owner process.
For example, if a portfolio has $1,500 available for distribution, but the hold distribution setting is on, the Pay Owner page will restrict the distribution amount to $0.00.
<li>The first step is to click on the ""Portfolios"" tab on the left side of the screen to pull up all portfolios.&nbsp
column2: You will then search for the specific portfolio you would like to hold distributions on and click it.

column1: • On the portfolio main page, you will see the tab labeled ""Details"". In this tab, there will be a box also labeled ""Details"". Click the edit button in the top right of this box

In this sidebar you will look for a toggle labeled ""Hold Distributions"" and you can click on it to toggle it on. Once this is done it will hold the distributions from the owner of the portfolio. This will also enable a Comments section where you can add additional details that will show up on the owner statement. Make sure to click the green save button at the bottom of the side bar to save any changes made.

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Add an Owner to a Portfolio","This article will show you how to add an owner to any portfolio in Rentvine","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-edit-th","

Adding an owner to a portfolio will allow you to edit the distribution and taxable percentage between owners. You can split this and it will take this into account for all their properties and leases.

column2: The first step is to click on the ""Portfolios"" tab on the left side of the screen to pull up all portfolios
You will then search for the specific portfolio you would like to add an owner to and click on it.
In this section, you will make sure you are in the tab labeled ""Details"". In this tab there will be a box also labeled ""Owner Contacts"" that you will see.
In this box, you will find a button labeled ""Edit"" in the top right. Click this button to pull up more settings to edit.

This will open up a list of all the contacts that are a part of the portfolio. To add an owner look for the buttons at the bottom left of the box. There are two options to ""Add Existing Owner Contact"" and ""Add New Owner Contact"". Select the one you want. If you select add new owner contact you will have to fill out their information in the side bar that pops out. When you are done click the green save button at the bottom to save any changes made.

>Note: If you are adding an owner to a portfolio that already has an owner contact made, make sure to click ""add existing owner contact"" so they will be able to see this new portfolio in their owner portal.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How To Disable/Enable Resident Portal Payments on a Lease?","This article will show you how to disable/enable resident eCheck payments, Credit card payments, or both on just a single lease","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-disable/enable-tenant-portal-payments","
• Select the lease you want to disable/enable tenant portal payments for.
• Once on the lease click the Green Actions button

column2: message will show up to confirm if you want portal payments disabled

column1: • You will also have the option to toggle on ""Required Certified Funds"". This will still disable the portal payments but also show that certified funds are required on the tenants portal.
Please note: Using the steps above will disable portal payments in general. So when a tenant logs into their portal they will not be able to make an eCheck or credit card payment.
Following the steps above go to the lease you want eCheck payments disabled.
A message will show up to confirm if you want eCheck portal payments to be disabled.
Please note: This will only disable echeck portal payments. Tenants will still be able to make payments via credit card through their portal.

column2: ><strong>How to disable credit card portal payments&nbsp

column1: Following the steps on the top of the page go to the lease you want credit card payments disabled.
• Click the Green Actions button on the lease
A Message will show up to confirm if you want Credit Card portal payments to be disabled

column2: This will only disable credit card portal payments. Tenants will still be able to make payments through their portal via eCheck.

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Add or Edit the Images of a Property or Unit","The images of a property will be all of the images used when activating the listing for the property and will be the images pulled. This article will show you how to upload or edit those images.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-add-or-edit-the-images-of-a-property-or-unit","

1.
column2: Click on the ""Property"" tab on the left side of the screen. Under that, click on the tab called ""Properties"" to pull up the entire list of properties.
Search for the specific property you want to edit the images of.

The next step is to go into the Images section inside the property details page. In this section, you will be able to add images by dragging the file of the picture into the upload box or clicking on it to bring up your files.

To delete an image, click on the trash can icon once in the bottom right of a specific image. Once you click the Trash can Icon, the image will be deleted automatically. You can also do a mass delete by selecting all the images.&nbsp

Reorder Images, which will allow you to change the order you view the images by dragging them where you want (make sure to click ""Save Image Order"" to save changes), Download Images, and Delete All Images. Please select one image and this will bring up the image tab.

If you click on the ellipses on a specific image it will bring up the options for it. The options are to edit which allows you to change the file name and add a caption to the image (Make sure to press save when making changes). An option to download the image. There is also an option to ""Set Default"" which will set it as the main picture that you will see when pulling up the property by clicking the Main photo Box on the desired image.&nbsp
>Please note that you will need to set a default image on the property to market your properties

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Edit the Move In Date, Start Date, and End Date of a Lease","Do you need to change important dates attached to a lease? This article will show you how to edit the move in date, start date, and end date on any lease in Rentvine ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-edit-the-move-in-date-start-date-and-end-date-of-a-lease","

1.
column2: Click on the tab labeled ""Leases"" on the left side of the screen. This will pull up a list of all the leases you have.&nbsp
Next you will search for the specific lease you want to change the dates in. You will then click on that property to pull up the lease.

Stay in the tab labeled ""Details"". You will then look for a box labeled ""Lease Info"". In the top right of this box click the blue actions button then click the edit button to pull up fillable fields you can change.

You will then look for the fillable fields labeled ""Move in Date"", ""Start Date"", and ""End Date"". Fill these out and make sure to click the green save button at the bottom to save any changes made.

column1: Scroll down and click Save when completed.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Print the Details of a Lease","Do you need to print off the details section of your lease page? This article will show you how to print the details of any lease in Rentvine","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-print-the-details-of-a-lease","

1.
column2: Click on the tab labeled ""Leases"" on the left side of the screen. This will pull up a list of all the leases you have.&nbsp
Next you will search for the specific lease you want to print. You will then click on that property to pull up the lease.

This will bring up the lease and you will click the green actions button in the top right. In that menu you will press print. This will bring up a print preview with all the details about the lease that you can print off.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Delete a Lease","Do you have a lease with no financial transactions and would like to remove it from Rentvine? This article will show you how to delete any lease within Rentvine","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-delete-a-lease","<div class=""hs-callout-type-caution"" data-hs-callout-type=""caution"">

column2: >Please note that if there were any transactions added to the lease unpaid or paid you will not be able to delete the lease for auditing purposes. Even if you void the transactions you cannot delete the lease. To fix this you can change the status to closed and it will be out of the way.
Click on the tab labeled ""Leases"" on the left side of the screen. This will pull up a list of all the leases you have.&nbsp
Next you will search for the specific lease you want to delete. You will then click on that property to pull up the lease.
This will bring up the lease and you will click the green actions button in the top right. In that menu you will press delete.
This will bring up a screen where you will confirm you want to delete the lease by typing delete in the field then pressing the red delete button.
","Leases","Lease Details","delete,delete a lease,delete lease,how to delete a lease,why can't i delete a lease,won't let me delete a lease","2024-06-05T18:34:25.343Z","PUBLISHED","false"

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Refund a Tenant","Do you have a receipt or credit that you would like to create a check for and manually refund the tenant? This article will show you how to refund any tenant within Rentvine","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-refund-a-tenant","

1.
column2: Click on the tab labeled ""Leases"" on the left side of the screen.&nbsp
column3: Next you will search for the specific tenant's lease you are looking to refund. Click on the row to view the lease.

This will bring up the lease and you will click the green actions button in the top right. In that menu, you will click refund. This will bring up a new screen with the refund details. You can then fill out all of the information for the check including the bank account, memo, name on the check, date posted, check number, and the payment address.&nbsp

column2: This will then pull up a confirmation screen. On this pop up you will click on the ""Confirm Refund"" button to finalize the refund.

Once completed you can click on the refund from the transactions tab of the lease. This will pull up the refund information. From the green actions button your will be able to print the check from the system with all of the information you just filled out.&nbsp

1.
column2: Click on the tab labeled ""Leases"" on the left side of the screen. This will pull up a list of all the leases you have.&nbsp
Next you will search for the specific lease you want to edit the renters insurance of. You will then click on that property to pull up the lease.

This will bring up the lease and you will stay in the details tab. You will then scroll down until you see a box labeled ""Renters Insurance"". In the top right of this box you will click the edit button.

This will allow you to change or enter information. Enter in all their information in the correct fields. You can also upload files in the perforated box at the bottom. Make sure to click save at the bottom to save any changes made.
><strong>Note: The tenant can enter this information themselves through the tenant&nbsp

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Edit the Tenant Liability Insurance (TLI) Provider of a Lease","If you have added a TLI provider in your global settings> Tenant Liability Insurance Providers, then this article will show you how to edit the tenant liability insurance provide of any lease in Rentvine","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-edit-the-tenant-liability-insurance-tli-provider-of-a-lease","

1.
column2: Click on the tab labeled ""Leases"" on the left side of the screen. This will pull up a list of all the leases you have.&nbsp
Next you will search for the specific lease you want to edit the TLI provider of. You will then click on that property to pull up the lease.

This will bring up the lease and you will stay in the details tab. You will then scroll down until you see a box labeled ""Tenant Liability Insurance Provider"". In the top right of this box you will click the edit button.

This will bring up a check box where you can automatically enable TLI insurance for the specific lease. If you do not have Rentvine's TLI insurance set up for your account, please contact support@rentvine.com via email. When you are done make sure to press the green save button to save any changes made.

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Add or Remove a Tenant From a Lease","Do you need to add a new tenant or remove a tenant that was accidentally added?This article will show you how to add or remove a tenant from any lease in Rentvine","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-add-or-remove-a-tenant-from-a-lease","

1.
column2: Click on the tab labeled ""Leases"" on the left side of the screen. This will pull up a list of all the leases you have.&nbsp
Next you will search for the specific lease you want to add or remove a tenant from. You will then click on that property to pull up the lease.

column3: Look in the details tab of the lease. There will be a box labeled ""Tenants"" that you will go to. In the top right of this box you will click the blue actions button. You will then either select ""Add existing tenant"" or ""Add new tenant"". Only select existing tenant if you have made a tenant contact for a person previously.

column2: This will bring up a side bar for you to fill out information where you create a tenant or add an existing one. Fill out the necessary fields and make sure to click the green save button at the bottom to add the tenant to the lease.

Look in the details tab of the lease. There will be a box labeled ""Tenants"" that you will go to. On the very right of this box there will be an ellipses for each tenant on the lease. You will click on this and select ""Delete"" and this will take them off of the lease.
This will bring up a confirmation making sure you want to remove this tenant from the lease. You will click on the red delete button to confirm.

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Add, Edit, or Delete an Occupant on a Lease","Do your tenants have occupants living with them and you would like to record them on the lease? This article will show you how to add, edit, or delete an occupant on any lease in Rentvine","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-add-edit-or-delete-an-occupant-on-a-lease","

1.
column2: Click on the tab labeled ""Leases"" on the left side of the screen. This will pull up a list of all the leases you have.&nbsp
Next you will search for the specific lease you want to edit the occupants of. You will then click on that property to pull up the lease.
In the lease you will stay in the details tab. You will scroll until you find a box labeled ""Occupants"". In this box you will click add occupant in the top right.
This will pull up a side bar where you will fill out the information in the fields. When you are done click save to add the occupant to the lease

In the lease you will stay in the details tab. You will scroll until you find a box labeled ""Occupants"". In this box you will click the ellipses connected to the occupant you want to edit and click the edit button.
This will pull up a side bar that you will edit the information of the occupant in. When you are done make sure to click the green save button at the bottom to save any changes made.

In the lease you will stay in the details tab. You will scroll until you find a box labeled ""Occupants"". In this box you will click the ellipses connected to the occupant you want to delete and click the delete button.
This will pull up a confirmation screen for deleting the occupant. You will click the red delete button to remove the occupant from the lease.&nbsp

In the lease you will stay in the details tab. You will scroll until you find a box labeled ""Recurring Credits"". In this box you will click the ellipses on the right connected to the recurring credit you want to edit and then click the edit button.
This will pull up a side bar that you will edit the recurring credit information in. When you are done make sure to click the green save button at the bottom to save any changes made.

In the lease you will stay in the details tab. You will scroll until you find a box labeled ""Recurring Credits"". In this box you will click the ellipses to the right connected to the recurring credit you want to delete and click the delete button.
This will pull up a confirmation screen for deleting the recurring credit. You will click the red delete button to remove the recurring credit from the lease.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Find All Unprinted Checks","Are you looking for all unprinted checks in the system?  This article will show you where to find those unprinted checks in Rentvine. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-find-all-unprinted-checks","<ul>
<li>Start by clicking the Accounting Tab and then Banking.&nbsp
column2: This will pull up the Banking page where you will see all bank accounts and all of the unprinted checks associated.&nbsp

column1: <li>Next, Click on the number of the unprinted checks and it will pull up the Print Checks screen.&nbsp
column2: From here you can select all by clicking the select all box or you can just select the checks individually you want to print by selecting the check box. Once you selected the checks you want to print hit the green print button.&nbsp

column1: <li>The final screen will be the print screen where you can select the print icon to print your check.&nbsp

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Send a Text Message to a Tenant on a Lease","Do you want to send a text message directly to a tenant's phone? This article will show you how to send a text message to any tenant in Rentvine ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-1","

1.
column2: Click on the tab labeled ""Leases"" on the left side of the screen. This will pull up a list of all the leases you have.&nbsp
Next you will search for the specific lease you want to send an email message in. You will then click on that property to pull up the lease.

You will then click on the ""Messages"" tab at the top to pull up the messages screen. On the left side of this page you will be able to send text messages. First you will have to select the contact name at the top, then compose you message in the bottom message box. When you are done make sure to click the green send button to send the text message. You will also be able to see previous text messages in the middle.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Send an Email to Tenants on a Lease","Do you want to send an email to a tenant in Rentvine and want the whole email thread to be saved in the system? 1.
column2: Click on the tab labeled ""Leases"" on the left side of the screen. This will pull up a list of all the leases you have.&nbsp
Next you will search for the specific lease you want to send an email message in. You will then click on that property to pull up the lease.

Click on the Messages tab at the top of the lease screen. Once you are in the messages section you will click on the ""Compose"" button that is located in the top right of the Email box. This will bring up a pop up window for you to write your email. This section will also show previous email messages sent to this tenant.

column1: • Select an email template if you have previously made any in the email template dropdown. You can also check a box to be able to email a copy to yourself.
• Add additional recipients to the email or add BCC.
• Write the body of the email in the message field.
• There will be a field called attachments under messages where you can add any files you want to attach to the email.
<li>When you are done composing your message make sure you click the green send button to send the email to the recipients.&nbsp

You will then click on the ""Chat"" tab at the top. In this section you will see all previous messages previously sent. column2: Click on the tab labeled ""Leases"" on the left side of the screen. This will pull up a list of all the leases you have.&nbsp

You will then click on the ""Ledger"" tab at the top to view the ledger. You will then be able to see all of the transactions that have happened in this lease.&nbsp
You can view the report customization to export, same, and send this ledger to anyone you may need.&nbsp

column3: You can also click the blue customize button in the ledger. This will allow you to customize the ledger report you want to run. You can add filters or columns that you want to include on the report then press the ""Run Report"" button to populate the report.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Edit a Lease Credit","Do you need to change the information attached to a lease credit? This article will show you how to edit any lease credit in Rentvine","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-edit-a-lease-credit","

column2: >Please note that if the credit is allocated to a charge you will first need to unallocate it from charges to edit certain information.
Click on the tab labeled ""Leases"" on the left side of the screen. This will pull up a list of all the leases you have.&nbsp
Next you will search for the specific lease you want to edit the lease credit on. You will then click on the row to pull up the lease.

You will then click on the tab labeled ""Transactions"" at the top. This will pull up all of the transactions attached to this lease. You will look for the specific lease credit you want to edit and click on it.&nbsp
This will bring up that specific charge on this lease. You will then look in the box labeled ""Credit Details"". In the top right of this box, you will click edit.

This will let you change everything about that lease credit. The fillable fields that you can change are the date posted, and the description. When you are done make sure to click the green save button to save this lease charge.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Split a Security Deposit Between Multiple Tenants Outside of the Move-Out Process","Do you have multiple tenants attached to a lease and would like to refund their deposit separately? This article will show you how to split a security deposit between multiple tenants on any lease in Rentvine.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-split-a-security-deposit-between-multiple-tenants","

column2: >If you would like to split the deposit during the move-out process, please view the split deposit during the move-out article by clicking here.

column1: 1.) To begin, click on the ""Leases"" tab located on the left side of your screen. Next, search for the specific lease associated with the security deposit that you wish to split.

column2: In this lease, you will need to click on the green actions button in the top right. This will access a dropdown, and you will click on ""Release Deposit"".

In this screen, you will fill out any necessary information, like how much of the deposit you want to release and any charges you would like to pay with the security deposit, if applicable. Make sure to click the green post button to release the deposit.
Next, you will return to the same lease and click the green actions button again. You will then click on the button labeled ""Refund"".

This will pull up the refund page. In here, you will fill out all the information for a single tenant who is a part of the lease. When you are done in the refund receipts section, you will put the amount that the tenant is getting from the security deposit. Make sure to press the green Refund button to post the refund.&nbsp
column3: It will be refunded as a check.

column2: After returning to the main lease page, you will need to repeat the process of clicking the green actions button and selecting the refund option. Then, you'll follow the same steps as before, but with a different tenant's information and the specific refund amount for that tenant. Repeat these steps for each tenant who needs to be paid out using the security deposit.

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Enable Notices to Owners When the Portfolio Operating Balance Drops Below the Total Required Reserves","Do you want to automatically send email notifications to owners whose portfolio operating balance drops below the total required reserves? This article will show you how to enable it for all owners.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-enable-portfolio-balance-notification","

Enabling this feature will send an email notice to all owners of a portfolio where the operating balance falls below the total required reserves.
Total Required Reserves = Reserves + Additional Reserves + Payables + Work Order Estimates

<h4>For example, if the portfolio balance is $1000 and the Total Required Reserves is $1900, it will be considered that the operating balance has fallen below the total required reserves by $900.&nbsp
column2: Therefore, the owner owes $900 in order to bring the operating balance back up.

column1: <h4>An email will be sent out once a day (approximately 10:15am EST) until the balance has been paid.&nbsp
column2: The owner will have an option to silence the notification if they choose to.&nbsp
column3: If silenced, it will stop sending the emails for that month.&nbsp
column4: If the owner still has a portfolio where the operating balance falls below the total required reserves the following month, the email notification will be sent out again. An example of the built-in email notification is shown at the end of this article.

column1: Go to the settings page (click on the ellipsis next to your name in the lower left corner of the page and select

column3: is set to No, click on the&nbsp

column1: • Exclude Reserves when Calculating Total Required Reserves - Does not include property reserves in the calculation of total required reserves for that portfolio. This is referring to the notice being sent out and will not include the reserve when calculating when the notification is sent out.
Balance Notice Threshold - Set amount where the Operating Balance has to be below the Total Required Reserves in order to send the notification.

column2: >***For Example - If the Operating Balance is $100 below the Total Required Reserves and the Balance Notice Threshold is set to $0.00, the notification will be sent.
>If the Operating Balance is $100 below the Total Required Reserves and the Balance Notice Threshold is set to $100.00, the notification will NOT be sent.
column3: The Operating Balance has to be greater than $100 below the Total Required Reserves to send out a notification.&nbsp

column2: Email Template For Balance Notices blank if you want to use the email notification provided by Rentvine.
column3: Otherwise click on the box and select an existing email template that you already created (You can create your own Portfolio email template).

column1: To deactivate notifications for specific owners, navigate to the portfolio details page and toggle the Disable Balance Notices switch to the ON position.

column2: >Below is an example of the built-in email notifications that are sent
