Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Pay Rent/Other Charges and Security Deposit in the Resident Portal","This article will show you how to pay for rent and how to pay your security deposit separately","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-pay-rent/other-charges-and-security-deposit-in-the-resident-portal","

Inside your resident portal you will see a tab labeled ""Summary"" that you will go to. In here there will be two options one to make a payment and another to pay a security deposit.

In the summary section there will be a box labeled ""Security Deposit"" that you will go to. To pay the security deposit you will click on the green button labeled ""Pay Deposit"". This will bring up a screen that will allow you to put in your payment information.
Note: The security deposit has to be paid separately from other payments.
In the summary section there will be a box labeled ""Balances
column2: >"" that you will go to. To pay rent and any other charges you will click on the green button labeled ""Make a Payment"". This will bring up a screen that will allow you to put in your payment information and you can pay current and upcoming charges.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Update Tax Information for 1099 Tax Reporting","This article assumes that you have already configured your tax reporting settings.  It will show you how to recompile your tax reporting so your updated information shows for all payees.

column2: >Click here if you have not configured your tax reporting settings

column1: • You will start by going to your account tab on the left side of the screen and clicking on the tab labeled transactions. In here you will click on the green actions button in the top right then click on the option labeled ""Tax Reporting"".
• This will bring up all of your 1099 tax reporting for the year. Click the green actions button in the top right again and click on the option labeled ""Recompile"".
<li>In this page you will need to change the compilation option to the one labeled ""Update ALL Information"".&nbsp
column2: Please be sure to pick the proper tax year that you want to report on. This will show all of the new information you have put in for everyone that needs to receive a 1099. Then you will click the green compile option and everything will be updated.&nbsp
column3: If you want to include Prepayments be sure to toggle that on as well.

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Create Custom Fields","This article will show you how to create custom fields for any portfolio, lease, property, etc. in Rentvine","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-create-custom-fields","

1.)
column2: First you need to go into your global settings by clicking on the profile icon in the top right of your screen. You will then click on the settings button.
This will bring up all of your global settings. In the right column at the bottom look for an option labeled ""Custom Fields"" and click on it.

You will then select what you want to associate this custom field to. The options for this you can choose are owner, tenant, vendor, lease, property, unit, work order, portfolio, listing, appliance, and association.

>Note: Custom fields will attach to the details section of whichever option you select. For example if you add a custom field to tenants it will show up in the detail sections of all tenants and if you add it to a lease then it will show up on all lease details in Rentvine. This is the same for all other options as well.&nbsp

Once you select one of the options you will be able to add a category. You do this by clicking the green add category in the top right of the page. This will pop out a sidebar and you will insert the name you want for the custom field. Make sure to click the green save button to save the category.
In your new custom field you will be able to add new fields, edit the name, and delete the category. You can do this by clicking on the blue actions in the top right of the field.

If you select the ""new field"" option a pop out tab will appear. You will be able to select a name for this field and the field type. Make sure to click save when done to save the field. The field type options are:
Gives you a single line to fill inside of the field
Gives a larger box to fill in on the custom field
Gives you options through a dropdown field

column1: • Date: Lets you enter in the date easily in the custom field

column2: Lets you add any numerical value to the field
Lets you add a monetary value to any field
Lets you easily add whole numbers to the field

>For the dropdown option: if you select the dropdown field a blank field will appear underneath the option. You will be able to click on this and type in the dropdown options. After you type one option make sure to click the enter key to save the option. You can add as many as you would like.

Once you have created the custom field you will now be able to view it and fill it out in whatever section you attached it to. For example a lease custom field will be available in the lease details section.
>Note: Now when running reports you can filter and pull by your custom fields if you would like

Everyone over the age of 18 years must apply separately.
column2: On the application template there is an option to activate a field “I Am The…” and this will allow the applicant to select if they are the Applicant, Co-Applicant, Occupant, Guarantor.

column1: The template has a Question Section that will allow you to add a question to ask if the applicant is applying with someone and when answering ""Yes"" it will prompt a text box to leave the full name of the other person they are applying with.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How Can I Access the Invoices for My Rentvine Software Service","This articles will show you how to access the invoices for your Rentvine software service (monthly billing)","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-can-i-access-the-rentvine-invoice","<ul>
• From the top right hand side of the screen, click on the profile icon with your initials.
• Then select Billing
<li>On the next screen, you will see a list of invoices.&nbsp
column2: Click on the invoice number to see more details.

column1: <li>In the Details page of the invoice, you have the option to&nbsp
column3: It will either open up a new window with a PDF of the invoice or download it for you.&nbsp
column4: From there you will be able to print it at your convenience.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Record an Owner Contribution/Receipt (Money In)","This article will show you how to record an owner contribution/receipt manually in Rentvine when an owner contributes funds.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-record-an-owner-contribution/payment-money-in","<ul>
<li>Start by going to Accounting/Money In on the left navigation menu.&nbsp
column2: Select the Green Action menu to pull up the dropdown list and select Record Owner Receipt.

column1: <li>On the next screen you will fill out the details of the receipt. This includes:
• Portfolio- select the portfolio ledger that this will be tied to
• Description- enter a description of this receipt
• Owner- select the owner of the portfolio this contribution is from
• Reference- add any reference you want to add for the receipt
• Account- select the general ledger account here (this will default to the owner contribution account)
• Date Posted- select the date this was received
• Bank Account- select the bank account this was made to

• Payment Type- select the type you received these funds with in real life

    Click save at the bottom of the page to confirm this.
• Since this is a manual contribution recorded you will also need to Record a Deposit in Rentvine to track when these funds were deposited in your bank account.

They can update their account and routing numbers here.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-an-owner-can-update-the-bank-account-where-their-distributions-get-deposited","

When an owner is on their portal they have the option to change their bank account info where their distributions will be sent.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Set or Change your Payment Allocation Order","This article will show you how to set or change the payment allocation order of unpaid charges on a lease in Rentvine.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-change-your-payment-allocation-order","

This effects which unpaid charges are paid first when a payment is made by a tenant from their portal or when a payment is manually recorded on a lease.
• Start by going to your Global Settings by clicking your initials in the top right of the screen and clicking settings. Then select ""Accounting Settings"" .
<li>Scroll down until you see the Payment Allocation card.&nbsp
column2: Here you will be able to edit how you would like the system to allocate payments to unpaid charges on a lease.&nbsp

column1: • Here is the options you can choose from:
• Oldest First - If you choose oldest first, Rentvine will pay the oldest charge first and then the next oldest charge next and so on.
• Newest First - If you choose newest first, Rentvine will pay the newest charge on the lease first and then go down the list from newest to oldest.
• Account - If you choose Account, Rentvine will pay the charges based on GL account. Select what GL account you want the system to allocate the payment to first.
column2: For example, you could choose RENT and the system will pay all rent charges first. If you had multiple rent charges it will pay the oldest rent charge first and then the next rent charge in order of dates. You can also set up the order you want the system to pay using multiple GL accounts.&nbsp
column3: If you want the Rent first then Late Fees and finally NSF fees you would set it up like the screenshot below.&nbsp
column4: Keep in mind you can drag and drop to adjust the order if need be.&nbsp
column5: Once all the GL accounts that are specified are paid first, it will then try to pay any other remaining unpaid charges by oldest&nbsp

column1: ","Accounting","General Accounting","allocation order,apply payments,charges,pay charge,payment allocation order,unpaid charges","2024-06-03T04:27:01.134Z","PUBLISHED","false"

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Configure Account Notifications","Alerts contacts outside of your Rentvine users when certain actions or events occur in your Rentvine account. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-configure-notifications","<div class=""hs-callout-type-tip"" data-hs-callout-type=""tip"">

Manager notifications are configured per user and cannot be disabled here.
This page enables you to set up extra email addresses or phone numbers to receive notifications. This section is more used to add a group email or the email/ phone number of a someone that is not a user in your system. To manage YOUR notifications, you can follow this article. Personal Notification settings
• Start by going to Settings / Notifications
The Notifications page allows you to choose who gets notified for certain actions or events.
<li>The tabs on top organize the notifications into types.&nbsp
column2: Select the type of notifications that you want to configure.

column1: • Manager - Here you can add contacts from outside of your system or group emails to receive certain notifications
• Owner - Notifications that are useful for Owners
• Vendor - Notifications that are useful for Vendors
• Applicant - Notifications that are useful for Applicants
• Tenant - Notifications that are useful for Tenants
<li>Once you have selected one of the tabs, you can then select the notification(s) that you want to configure.&nbsp
column2: For example, if you want to configure extra users to get notified when a Tenant Payment is received:

column1: • Select the Recipients that you want the notification to go to. by adding an email or a phone number for this notification.

column2: >Please note that these are global and the user added will receive a notification for this event regardless of the assignee

column1: <li>If you want to configure other notifications you can click on every individual notification.&nbsp
column2: Once you are satisfied with what is configured, be sure to click the Save button at the bottom of the page so all the changes are saved.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Configure Sales Tax on your Rentvine Account","Do you need to collect sales tax for certain goods and service fees? This article will show you how to set up your Rentvine account to automatically collect sales tax and then have the sales tax paid out to the management company.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-configure-sales-tax-on-your-rentvine-account","

By following these steps, you can ensure that sales tax charges on taxable goods and services are automatically created helping you to accurately track and manage your tax obligations.

In general, it is best practice for Property Managers to charge and collect sales tax on taxable goods and services that are applicable, and then paid out to the management company when fees are collected. The Property Manager should then remit sales tax to the state from their corporate books.
• Go to the settings page (click on your initials in the top right corner of the page and select Settings)

column2: button and enter the applicable name of the agency in your area.
column3: Then Add E.g, New Mexico Taxation and Revenue Department

column1: In this step you are configuring the tax rate and the default Chart of Account to be used when a sales tax charge is created.
column2: The sales tax setting will be applied to a property in step 4.

column1: • Go to the settings page (click on your initials in the top right corner of the page and select Settings)

column2: New Sales Tax button

column3: Select one of the Tax Agencies from the dropdown menu

column1: Sales Tax Percent - Enter the applicable tax rate percentage
Expense Account - Select the default Chart of Account to be used when a sales tax bill is automatically created.
Income Account - Select the default Chart of Account to be used when a sales tax lease charge is automatically created.

column2:
>If you need to create a Sales Tax expense and income chart of account(s) you can do so by following this article

How to Create a Chart of Account
if you are managing properties that are using different tax rates.

column1: Be sure to add your default Sales Tax Income chart of account (COA) as an Additional Mgmt Fee (Suppressed Fee) to your management fee setting(s).
column2:
This will ensure that sales tax will be paid out to the management company when fees are collected and then can be remitted to the state from your corporate books.

Click Here to learn how to add a chart of account as an Additional Mgmt Fee

column1: Step 3: Review which Goods and Services are Taxable (Select which Chart of Accounts are subject to Sales Tax)
Make sure to select the chart of accounts that are subject to sales tax.
column2: For example, if Rent, Management fees and General Repairs should be taxed you have to be sure that the Rent, Management Fee, and General Repairs chart of accounts (COA) are subject to sales tax.

column1: • Go to the settings page (click on the ellipsis next to your name in the lower left corner of the page and select Settings)
Go through the list of income and expense accounts and review which of those chart of accounts should be subject to sales tax
column2: (sales tax will be automatically added when used).
column3: If Subject to Sales Tax is green it means the chart of account is already configured to have sales tax added to it.

column1: If you need to make a chart of account
column2: Subject to Sales Tax, click on it so you can modify it.

column1: If you need to add sales tax on management fees, it is important to configure your Management Fees chart of account (COA) properly and to ensure that the ""Is Subject to Sales Tax"" option is turned on for the relevant account. This will ensure that sales tax is automatically added on management fees when the management fees are collected.
Step 4: Set the Property(s) that you want to charge Sales Tax
Choose which properties to charge Sales Tax

column1: <li>Select the property and the go to the&nbsp
Step 5: Specify the Vendor(s) for whom you would like to apply Sales Tax while generating a bill with the vendor as the payee.
When creating bills to pay vendors, choose which vendors you want to automatically apply sales tax to their bill.

There is no need to specify the property management company if you have configured the default management fee expense COA as subject to sales tax, the sales tax will be automatically added to the management fee bills that are created through the ""Bill Management Fee Process"".

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How Do You Activate or Deactivate The Income Verification On The Application?","This article will show you how to Activate or Deactivate the Income Verification feature within the Application Template.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-do-you-activate-or-deactivate-the-income-verification-on-the-application","

To Activate or Deactivate the Income Verification within your Application Template(s), follow these steps:
Select the Application Template(s) you would like to Activate or Deactivate the Income Verification (you will need to do this for each Application Template)
• Click on the Ellipsis Icon (three dots) to open the Application Template
• Scroll down to locate the Income Verification Section
• Click within the Pink Income Verification text box to activate the Section Settings on the Right
• Click on the Toggle to Activate or Deactivate Income Verification
• Repeat these steps to Activate or Deactivate the Income Verification Documents in the section right underneath Income Verification

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Error Uploading NACHA File to your Bank","If you receive a service code error 200, 220 or 225 you may need to modify the NACHA settings in your Rentvine account","en","https://help.rentvine.com/error-uploading-nacha-file-to-your-bank","

If you receive a 200, 220, or 225 service code error from your bank when it tries to process the NACHA file, it may be because the Generate Balance File toggle may not be set correctly.
To modify the Generate Balance File setting:
• Click on Accounting on the left side of your screen
• You should now see your bank account(s) listed. Click on the bank account that has NACHA enabled.
• In the middle section for Bank Account Information, there will be a field for Is Nacha Enabled. It should be set to ""YES"", you will want to click Edit to the right
• After clicking Edit, an Update Account Information pop-up will show with your current bank account information. Look for the Is Nacha Enabled toggle and toggle it on (blue)
You will notice the Nacha Details section populates and it looks like the image below.
Go to the Generate Balanced File Toggle and modify it to ON or OFF
• If turned ON, a balanced file is a file that does carry the offset (settlement) account within the file. This generates the file with a service code of 200.

• If turned OFF, an unbalanced file is a file that does not carry the offset (settlement) account within the file. The offset (settlement) account is managed by the ODFI. This generates the file with a service code of 220 or 225.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Undeposited Funds that are Associated to a Portfolio.","When paying owners, is there a message that shows an amount of undeposited funds under the portfolio name? ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/when-paying-owners-do-you-see-a-undeposited-funds-message","

Occasionally, when making a payment to the owners, you may notice a message/label beneath the portfolio indicating an amount of undeposited funds.
This indicates that a receipt was recorded for a tenant, owner, or other entity associated to a specific portfolio has not yet been recorded in the system as deposited or settled.
Please click the link below to see the article that shows you how to record a deposit in the system.
How to Record a Deposit

column2: This only applies if the payment was NOT an eCheck or Credit Card payment such as a check or money order.
column3: eCheck and Credit Card payments are automatically deposited as a Settlement.&nbsp
column4: More information on Settlements at the end of this article.

column1: Once the deposit for that specific check or money order payment is recorded in Rentvine, the amount of that payment will be deducted from the undeposited funds.
You can also view the undeposited funds amount of a specific portfolio on the ledger tab in the portfolio view page.
Undeposited Funds that are associated to an electronic receipt (eCheck or Credit Card payments by tenants or owners).

If all your NON eCheck and Credit Card payments are recorded as deposited in the system and you continue to see the undeposited funds message/label in the pay owners screen, it signifies that there is a payment(s) associated to that portfolio that was made electronically by eCheck or Credit Card. There's no need to take any manual action to resolve this, as the message/label will disappear automatically once the electronic payment settles in the bank account. Typically, eCheck or Credit Card payments take 1-2 business days to settle.

You can still pay your owners even though the undeposited funds message/label is showing. It is recommend to wait for the electronic payment(s) to settle in the bank account, because you can run the risk of those funds not being in the bank account. It is safer to wait until the payment(s) has settled in the bank account before paying owners

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Resident Portal Introduction","This article will walk you through how to navigate your Rentvine resident portal","en","https://help.rentvine.com/resident-portal-introduction","&nbsp

column2: >Quick Links to the Breakdown of all the Different Tabs within the Resident Portal

column1: • The first thing that you will see within your resident portal will be the summary page. In this page you will be able to view/pay your security deposit, set up autopay for monthly charges, view your upcoming balance, and current balance. Here you can also view and recent notices that your property management company posted.

column2: >Please note that you may not see the ""Pay Deposit"" button. If this is not in your portal don't worry you can pay the deposit through the

column1: • In here you can also quickly view your most recent activity. Your recent activity will be made up of all charges that have been posted to pay and any payments that you have made. There will also be a blue link labeled ""View Receipt"" where you can see the receipt for any of your payments. There is also a button in the top right to ""View All Activity"". This will take you to your activity page where you can view all charges and payments.
• You can also view your lease details on this page. This will show you the start date and the end date that your lease is for.

• In this box there will be a box labeled ""Move Out Notice"". This is how you can notify and your property manager of a move out and fill out information like why you are leaving and your forwarding address.

column2: >Please note that you may not have the option to give move out notice through your portal. This is because it has been disabled by your property manager and they may have you give move out notice a different way

column1: • The last thing you will see is the monthly charges set up on your lease. This will show what the charge is, the frequency the charge will post, the next charge date, and the amount.

• The first thing you will see in the payment tab is your account snapshot. This will show you your current amount due and upcoming charges. The current amount due is made up of charges that are due right now and need to be paid. The upcoming charges is made up of any charges that are going to post within 18 days and will show that full amount.
• The next thing you will see is how you would like to pay. The first way to pay is Payment Method, this comes from the Wallet Section in the resident portal.
To add a payment method, you will need to create on in the wallet section of your resident portal first. Click here to jump to this section of the article, Wallet Tab

column2: to pay via eCheck that you can select and this will collect the money using your account number and routing number straight from your bank account. You can save this payment to use for future payments if you select the check box under this.

column1: <li>Your other option for payments is to use a credit or debit card. You would first need to click on the credit or debit card option and then you will need to fill out the card number, expiration month and year, the CVC, name on the card, and postal code. You can also save this payment method to use for future payments.&nbsp

column2: >Please note that for debit or credit card options there is a 4% Processing Fee on your payment that is non refundable

column1: • Your last option for payments is to pay via CashPay. You would first need to click on the CashPay option and then click on the green button labeled Pay with Cash

Please note this option will only show if enabled by the property manager. For further information on how to make a payment if this option is enabled in your portal, please visit this knowledge base article, Cash Pay through Resident Portal

column2: step is to choose the amount you want to pay. Your options are to choose if you want to pay the current, current &amp
column3: upcoming, or the other payment. To select the current this will be everything that you owe up to today's date and will need to click on the bubble. For current &amp
column4: upcoming this will be the amount you currently owe plus any charges that are going to post within 18 days and will need to select that bubble. If you choose other you will need to click that bubble and enter in that amount in the allotted field.&nbsp
column5: There will be no processing fee if you select eCheck but there will be a 4% processing fee if you select credit or debit card. Click the Next Review Payment button, to view the total that you are paying.

column2: >Please note that you may not have the other option on your portal. If this is the case it is because your property manager is only accepting payments in full and no partial payments
the total amount that you are paying and ensuring this is the correct amount. Then selecting the terms and agreement box and submitting you payment by clicking Make Payment.

>This tab will show you the full activity of your account. In here you will be able to see any charges that have been posted to your portal as well as any payment that you have made. For any payments that you have made you can also view the receipts for them by clicking on the payment. The last thing you will see in here is that you can update filters at the top. This will allow you to change the date range of your activity.

>In this tab you will be able to see all of your saved payment methods. If you already created one through the payment screen it will populate in this section. If you would like to add a payment method you can click on the green actions button in the top right and select if you would like to add an eCheck or Credit Card to the system. This will allow you to choose this payment method when making a payment or setting up a recurring payment.
>The files tab will hold every file that you upload or any&nbsp
column3: files your property manager has shared with you. To upload files you can click on the perforated box to upload files straight from the&nbsp
column4: device you are on, you can also drag and drop the file. You can&nbsp
column5: search for specific files using the search bar at the top. If you would like to download certain files you can do this by clicking on the ellipses button and the download option will show on that specific file.

column2: >This tab is how you can upload&nbsp
column3: your renters insurance. The information you will need to have is the insurance company, expiration date, policy number, and the file. Once submitted, the property manager will need to review over the information submitted and approve of this on their end.&nbsp

column4: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202025-01-07%20at%2012-31-03%E2%80%AFAM-png.png"" width=""2806"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • To edit the renters insurance information, you will need to click the pencil icon button at the top right of the screen.

column2: >The maintenance tab will allow you to view all of your service request that you have made or your property manager has made and shared with you. You can click Open to view all the currently open maintenance requests or click history will show all the past closed maintenance requests. You can also create a new service request by clicking the green create service request in the top right.

>When creating a new service request you can select the priority from high to low, put in the description, the incident location, the category of this maintenance request, and can upload files or images of the issue.

column1: • The step will ask you about the property access. You can choose between vendor may access the property, resident presence is required. Schedule a time for maintenance to be performed, or not applicable.

• If you select vendor may access the property, this means you allow the vendor to access the property while you are not present. You can provide more information to entry of the property for the vendor in the text box below labeled Instruction for vendor entry.

• If you select, resident presence is required. Schedule a time for maintenance to be performed, then you will need to select 4 separate times for the vendor to select the best time of the 4 that works.

column2: >The last step will review the entire work order information that was entered and you can review all this to confirm everything is correct. If everything is correct, you can select Submit Maintenance Request.

>The next screen will bring you to the details tab of the newly created work order and the information.
This will have all the work order details, vendor information, and the issue photos uploaded.
>The next tab of the maintenance request will be the files tab. Here you can view any files shared with you from the property manager related to this work order.

>The last tab within a specific work order is the chat tab. The chat tab is messages just for that specific work order. It will allow for communication between you, the property manager, and the vendor. Only send messages in this section that pertain to this specific work order.
>The chat tab is a tab you can use to communicate with your property manager specifically. In here you will be able to&nbsp
column3: view previous chat messages with the scrollable field, send new messages, and upload files straight to your property manager. The chat here is just through the portal and the only way to reply is through this tab. You will get notified by email or text when you receive a new chat message.

column2: >Example of the Email Notification when you get a New Chat Message

>Please note that the chat functionality in the chat tab and the chat in a service request are two different chats. Please view this knowledge base article that explains the differences: Difference between service request chats and the chat tab

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Submit Corrections for 1099's","This article will walk you through the steps on how to create a correction and download the FIRE File.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-submit-corrections-for-1099s","

Under Tax Reporting you will see a list of Payee's for the current reporting year.
Select the pencil icon associated to the contact which needs a correction.
Next, the Modify Tax Record screen will appear. At the bottom of the menu you will check off ""Is Correction.""
When Tax Identifier or Payee Name is selected you will need to enter the previously recorded information under the Correction Reason field:
Once the information above is completed, please update the Payee name and Tax-ID with the new corrections that will be reported to the IRS in the fields above the Correction Reason drop down.
If the Correction Reason is ""Payment Amount."" Please the update the Taxable Amount and click
At this time please do not select ""Other"" as your Correction Reason, this option will not update a tax record.
Once you've made the all corrections to your Payee's, select the payee's you have made changes to.

column3: This will generate a FIRE file that can be used to upload to the IRS.
column4: It will download to your device.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Difference Between the Chat Tab and the Chat Within a Service Request","The article will explain the difference between these chat tabs and how to use both of them","en","https://help.rentvine.com/difference-between-the-chats","<h3>&nbsp

column2: >

>The main line of communication in the portal is through the chat tab. This chat should not be used to talk about specific service requests. In here you will be able to communicate with your property manager. In here you will be able to search for messages, view previous chat messages with the scrollable field, send new messages, and upload files straight to your property manager. The chat here is just through the portal and the only way to reply is through this tab. You will get notified when you receive a new chat message.

>The maintenance tab has a chat message functionality within it. Once a service request is created you are able to click on it and go to a chat within the service request. Once in the chat tab you can send messages to the vendor, property manager, or other residents.&nbsp

column1: This service request chat should only be used with issues or concerns pertaining to this specific service request. It is not intended for chats about the lease or anything else. Please use the chat tab to talk about these things.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Credit a Tenant from the Property Management Company","This article will walk you through the steps on how to credit a Tenant from the Property Management Company.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-credit-a-tenant-from-the-management-company","<ul>

• If you are in Manager ledger mode, the credit can be given from the property management company. To do this, you would use the ""Transfer From Manager"" toggle on the form. This toggle is only available in manager ledger mode and allows you to transfer a credit from the management company's ledger to the tenant's ledger.
• If you are in Bill Management Fee mode there are two ways to credit a tenant from the management company.
• Scenario 1 does NOT require the Property Manager to fund the Trust bank account from an Outside source (i.e. Corporate Bank Account).
• Scenario 2 does require the Trust bank account to be funded from an Outside source (i.e. Corporate Bank Account).
• First, you'll create a new income type C.O.A. named ""Credit from Management Company.""

column2:

Management Fee.
>Make sure to have this fee 100% suppressed.

column1: • Next, add a Lease Credit to the lease using that new suppressed income C.O.A.

• Below is an example of how the credit should be added:

column1: Please note the GL account used in the credit above is the same GL account used to record the lease credit (this is the suppressed C.O.A. we created). Also the Payee must be the Management Company and the Payer must be the Unit Address (Like shown above).

• The last step is to apply that vendor credit (view the applying credits section of this article) to an unpaid bill due to the property management company from the owner(portfolio) of the unit. Once that is completed you've credited the tenant without affecting the cash balance of the owner(portfolio).

column4: Be sure to select a suppressed income account to suppress the transaction from the owner.

• Next, navigate to the lease you want to credit. Click the Green Actions Button and then click Add Credit.
The Lease Credit should also be the same dollar amount as the Other Receipt, if not the credit will not be fully suppressed.

The final step is to transfer funds from an external bank account (typically your business or corporate bank account) to the trust account in order to cover the amount of the credit and other payment you recorded.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Owner Portal Introduction","Are you an owner and your property manager is using Rentvine to manage your properties? This article will show you how to use your Rentvine owner portal","en","https://help.rentvine.com/owner-portal-introduction","<hr>

column2: >Quick Links to Different Tabs within Your Owner Portal

>The first thing you will see in your Rentvine owner portal is all of the properties that are owned by you and managed by the property manager. You can click on each property to view more details about your property.

>Inside the property, you will be able to view the details tab. This will show you the details (address, property type, etc.), the rental details, and any notes that your property manager has shared with you.

>In the Marketing Tab, you will be able to see the marketing information for your property. This includes contacts, utilities, and marketing documents. Here you will also see if your property has been listed for rent.

>The next tab will be work orders where you can see any of the work orders for this property that the property manager has shared with you. You can click on an individual work order to view the work order details and this will take you to the work orders tab.

column1: Please note that you may not see the Work Orders tab if it is disabled or there are no work orders shared with you by your property manager

column2: >In the bills tab you will be able to see all of the bills for this property. You can click on each one to view the individual details. When you click on a bill you can also view files that are attached to them (if any) if you click on the files tab

column1: Please note that you may not see the Bills tab if it is disabled or there are no bills shared with you by your property manager

column2: >In the documents tab, you will be able to see all of the files that your property manager has shared with you that are related to the property or lease on this property.

column1: Please note that there is another files section but all files shared on a lease or property will be stored here. Please see below for all areas with a files section.

column2: >The Rent Roll tab will have a report that will show you all of your properties, lease info, move-in dates, current rent set, any deposits that are being held, and the total balance due. This information updates in real-time if any changes are made. You will also have an option to print this report by clicking the green print button in the top right.&nbsp

column1: Please note that you may not see the Rent Roll tab if it is disabled by the property manager.

column2: >In the Statements tab, you will be able to see every single statement packet that your property manager has posted to your portal. You can click on an individual statement packet to view the details and view the files within it.

>To filter your statements you can click the green actions button and click ""Filter Statements"". You can also download all of the files within the statement packet by clicking the blue ""Download Files"" button on the right of the packet.

>If you click on a specific statement packet you will be able to view the owner statement and any files or reports that your property manager has included in the packet. You can also click on the blue ""Download File"" to download individual files.&nbsp

column1: Please note that you will need to contact your property manager if you would like specific reports added to your statement

column2: >In the Files tab, you will be able to view any files that your property manager has shared with you. To view the file, you can click directly on the individual item to maximize it.&nbsp
column3: Here you can also upload files that you have by clicking the upload files box in the top right-hand corner.

column2: >By selecting files, you will then have the option to download them to your device by clicking the green download button.

column1: Please note that there are other files sections within your portal. Please see below for all areas with a files section, if you cannot find them within this section.

column2: >Please note that you may not see the Bills tab if it is disabled by your property manager

column3: The Bills tab will show you all of the bills that have been shared by your property manager. It will also show the amount of these that are paid or if the bill is not paid and how much is owed.

column2: >You can click on the bill to view more details about the bill. You will be able to see who the payee is, when the bill was created, when it is due, and the individual itemized charges.

>If you click on the Files tab within this Bill details page, you will be able to see the invoice and or any other files related to the bill. You can also click on the individual file to view it or click download to download it directly. Please note this might not always be the case and there may be no files within here.&nbsp

column1: Please note that you may not see the Work Orders tab if it is disabled by your property manager

column2: >The Work Orders tab will show any work orders that the property manager has shared with you. On the main page, you will be able to see all of the work orders, for what property they are for, the vendor, status, priority, &amp

>If you click on an individual work order, it will give you a breakdown of the details of the work order. You will be able to see things like a breakdown of the set dates for the work order, more specific vendor details, any notes shared with you, and any attached bills.

>The Estimates tab will show you all estimates for work orders that have been sent by your property management company. Here you can view all pending estimates that are awaiting approval, all approved estimates previously submitted, and any estimates that have been rejected.
>

>You can click into an estimate to view more information regarding it. From this page you will be able to accept the estimate or reject it. You can also view any associated files by clicking the files tab on this page.&nbsp
>In the Payments tab, you will be able to see your distribution method. You can see how distributions will be currently sent.&nbsp
column3: You can update this by clicking the edit button and adding new information.

column1: The Edit button will not appear if your property manager has disabled the ability to modify your distribution method.

column2: >In this section, you can also make a contribution to your account in Rentvine. If your property manager ever needs funds from you, this spot in your portal is the way to send it.&nbsp

>You will have the option to make a contribution from a saved payment method that you have set up, an echeck payment using your account and routing number, or a credit/debit card. You will just need to select the desired tab at the top, fill out all of the information, make sure you turn the toggle on to agree to the terms and conditions, then submit the payment. This will go straight to your property manager to allocate the funds correctly.
>Please note that if you choose to make a contribution via a credit/debit card there will be a non-refundable 4% processing fee
>In that same area, you can also create a saved payment method. Doing this will save all of your payment information so if you ever need to send a contribution in the future you can do so quickly.

>Your Chat tab is used to communicate with your property manager. This functionality uses the Rentvine portal. Your property manager can send you chat messages and you will receive a text or email notification that a chat was sent to you, and you can click on that to view and respond to it within your portal.&nbsp

column1: • This Report Tab allows Owners to run their own report regarding their associated portfolio. Clicking on a report will open a new tab to show the report details, allowing you to adjust the filter, columns, and grouping of the report selected.

column2: >Users can hover over the i icon for a brief overview of the report
column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202025-06-02%20at%2012-03-43%E2%80%AFPM-png.png"" width=""52"" loading=""lazy"">

column2:
>For more information on how to utilize the reports, please see the article linked:
How to Use Reports

>The Settings tab is where you will be able to enable or disable if you would like to access your owner statements without logging into your portal. If this is activated you will be sent an email with a code to view your owner statements without having to sign into your portal whenever owner statements are shared with you.&nbsp

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"What is a Watcher on a Work Order?","Do you need an additional user to be notified for events that occur on a work order","en","https://help.rentvine.com/what-is-a-watcher-on-a-work-order","

A Watcher refers to users who have a vested interest in a work order and receive the same notifications as the assignee. If a user adds a note, edits a field, sends a chat or sends an email, they are automatically added as a watcher to the work order. Watchers can also be added manually. Watchers will receive all of the same notifications that the assignee receives.
<li>To add a watcher to a work order you can go to a specific work order. On this page you can click the two blue arrows in the top right to pull out a sidebar.&nbsp
column2: In here you will see a ""Watchers"" tab that you can click to drop down.
You can add yourself as a watcher to be notified by clicking the start watching button.

column1: <li>You can add users in the system to be watchers by selecting them from the dropdown list.&nbsp
• You can also remove watchers by clicking the ""X"" next to their name on this page.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Create and Use Snippets","Snippets enable the creation of reusable text blocks that can be swiftly accessed using keyboard shortcuts. They can be used throughout Rentvine in places such as vendor instructions, descriptions, chat messages, etc...","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-create-and-use-snippets","<h3>&nbsp

Currently, Snippets are limited to being used solely on work order descriptions, vendor instructions, closing comments on work orders and mass texting . However, the intention is to make them accessible for use throughout the rest of Rentvine in the near future.

column2: Snippets
column4: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-05-22%20at%2010.24.31%20AM.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • Name - Enter a name for the snippet
• Template Object - Select which object you will use this snippet.
column2: I.e., Work Orders, Leases, etc... Leave blank if you want to use it in multiple places and will not be adding hotfields to the snippet.

column1: • Snippet - Enter the body of your snippet in the text rich editor.
• Shortcut - Provide a name for the snippet shortcut which will be utilized for inserting the snippet in various places such as descriptions, chat messages, vendor instructions, emails, etc...
<h4><strong>You can use snippets as an efficient way to add text throughout your Rentvine account.&nbsp
column2: Some examples are when adding notes, entering vendor instructions, entering a description, when writing an email, sending a chat. &nbsp
column3: It enables you to input a considerable amount of text efficiently and rapidly.

column1: <li>Type the # symbol in the text editor, then begin typing the snippet shortcut and select it from the dropdown menu.&nbsp
column2: (Alternatively you can also press the TAB key or Return Key).
column3: The text editor will automatically populate with the snippet.

src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/snippet-gif.gif"" width=""559"">","Settings & General","General","How to create snippets,how to edit snippets,shortcut,snippet,snippets,template,text,what are snippets,where to create snippets","2024-05-28T17:59:36.530Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Credit Card Chargeback","Do you have a tenant or owner who has disputed a credit card payment? You see Credit Card Chargeback as the reason for the returned payment. This article will give you steps to try to recover the money.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/credit-card-chargeback","

A chargeback occurs when a credit card holder disputes a charge and the transaction is reversed.

As a property manager, receiving a dispute from a tenant/owner can be a frustrating experience. However, it's important to handle these situations calmly and professionally in order to resolve the dispute and maintain positive relationships with your tenants or owmers. Here are some steps you can take to help resolve a payment dispute:

• Gather information: First, review the details of the disputed payment. Look for any discrepancies between the amount paid and the amount owed, as well as any issues with the payment method or processing. Check your records to ensure that the payment was properly applied to the tenant's or owner's account.

• Contact the tenant/owner: Reach out to the tenant/owner to discuss the dispute and try to understand their perspective. Ask for any additional information or documentation that may help clarify the situation. Be sure to remain professional and respectful throughout the conversation.

• Review the lease agreement: Review the lease agreement or management agreement to see if there are any clauses or provisions that may apply to the dispute. For example, if the dispute is related to a late fee, the lease may specify when and how late fees can be assessed.

• Consider a payment plan: If the dispute is related to a tenant/owner’s inability to pay the full amount owed, consider offering a payment plan to help them catch up on their payments over time. This can help avoid future disputes and maintain a positive relationship with the tenant / owner.

Unfortunately, if the credit card holder claims they did not make the transaction and was a result of fraud on their card, the tenant/owner’s credit card company takes the funds back, and Rentvine does not have the ability to pursue the chargeback any further. The customer purchasing laws are so stringent and in favor of the payer, that the power is not in our hands with the merchant processor and these chargebacks are a cost of doing business with a dishonest individual who claims they were a victim of fraud.

Overall, the key to resolving a payment dispute with a tenant or owner is to remain calm, professional, and responsive. By taking the time to understand the situation and work with the tenant/owner to find a solution, you can help ensure a positive outcome for all parties involved.

We wanted to inform you that our management team will be reaching out to you within a short time period regarding the recent chargebacks. They will provide you with all necessary details and assist you in addressing any concerns you may have.
We will explain the two options that we offer to help you argue this dispute. If you do not hear from us please feel free to reach out to
column2:
Support@rentvine.com

","Property Managers","Payment Processing Information","CC Chargeback,chargeback,credit card chargeback,dispute,returned tenant payment,reversal","2024-08-22T16:41:25.675Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"What is the Process For Requesting and Viewing a Vendor Review?","This article will show you how to ask a resident to review a vendor after a work order has been completed.  Then once the review is submitted, how to view it","en","https://help.rentvine.com/what-is-the-process-for-requesting-a-vendor-review","The Vendor review feature is to let the property manager know how a specific vendor is treating the tenant and property, that the property manager is managing. The resident is the one who gives the review on the vendor.&nbsp
• Navigate to the work order that you want to request a review
<li>Once you are on the work order details page, change that status of the work order to one of the closed statuses.&nbsp
column2: You can do this by clicking Edit and then selecting the relevant status

column1: • After choosing a Closed status, provide the Date closed and enter any Closing Comments. Upon doing so, you will see a message indicating that a review request will be sent to the resident. To proceed with sending the request, simply save the form. This will result in the closure of the work order and an automatic notification to the resident, informing them that you have requested a review of the vendor.
To refrain from sending a vendor review request, select Disable instead. Afterward, save the form, and the work order will be closed without sending any vendor review request.
<li>The resident will receive a notification that looks similar to the example below.&nbsp
column2: They can simply click on the Complete Review button and they can complete the review
column4:
src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202023-03-05%20at%2011-33-03%20AM-png.png"" width=""523"">

Example of what the resident sees when submitting the review for the work order

column1: <li>Once the resident completes the review the property manager assigned to the work order receives a notification that the review is completed.&nbsp
column2: The review is then viewable by going to the work order details page.

column1: If you want to delete the review for any reason, click Delete.
column2: If the review is deleted, you will then have the option to resend a review request
","Maintenance","Maintenance","request to review,review,review a vendor,review work order,vendor review,view review,work order review","2024-01-22T03:37:26.445Z","PUBLISHED","false"

The steps to transfer the ownership of a property from one owner to another may vary based on the specific situation and applicable laws. However, the following are general steps that may be involved in the process:

After saving, all subsequent accounting transactions created will be associated with the new ownership/portfolio.

• Update accounting records - Rentvine does not automatically transfer any of the previous accounting records or transactions that occurred on the previous portfolio / ownership. Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Utilize Quickbooks Export in Rentvine","Are you trying to export payments that are in Rentvine to Quickbooks? This article will show you how to utilize this feature, and get it configured. This feature also works with Xero Accounting Software.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-utilize-quickbooks-export-in-rentvine","<h3>&nbsp

column2: >This Quickbooks Export feature also work with Xero accounting software

column1: Enable Quickbooks Export for your Property Management Company in Rentvine
• At the bottom of the page you will see a ""Quickbooks Information"" section
• Please make sure the ""Quickbooks Export Enabled"" is toggled on.
As for the ""Quickbooks Customer Name"" this needs to reflect the same company name, you have in Quickbooks.
For Example: If your company name in Quickbooks is 123PM. Then type in 123PM in the ""Quickbooks Customer Name""
(Optional) Enable Quickbooks Export for a Vendor
• Select the Vendor you want to configure for the Quickbooks Export
• Scroll down until you see ""Quickbooks Export"" section
Please follow the same steps above to get the Quickbooks Export Configured for this specific Vendor.
How to Match your Rentvine Chart of Accounts to your Product and Services in Quickbooks when doing the Export
• Select the Chart of Accounts in Rentvine you are going to be utilizing with the Export
Once the chart of account is selected you will see a ""Quickbooks Service Name (for exports)"" field, under account details.

The Chart of Accounts you would want to add a service name too are the ones you plan on exporting to Quickbooks. Typically these are the chart of accounts that the property manager uses in Rentvine to collect their Property Management fees.

Please make sure the Quickbooks service name in Rentvine is the same as your product and service name in Quickbooks. It's important to have those two names match identically, so when the export happens it will reflect correctly in Quickbooks. Not reflecting these names could cause confusion once the export happens in Quickbooks.
How to export Quickbooks Invoice from a Rentvine payment
<li>Click on the Accounting tab and then click Money out. From this page click the payments tab. Here you can search for the payment you would like to export and click into it.&nbsp
<li>In the payment you will click the green actions button. Click on the option labeled&nbsp
column3:
src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-06-03%20at%201-33-40%20PM-png.png"" width=""2248"" loading=""lazy"">

This export will produce a CSV file that can be used to import into Quickbooks as an invoice.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"ACH Chargeback (within 60 days of payment)","Has an eCheck (ACH) payment from a tenant been returned with a reason for return that indicates the payer is contesting it, rather than due to insufficient funds? This article will explain why.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/ach-chargebacks-within-60-days","<h4>&nbsp
If the ACH Chargeback is from a payment that is OVER 60 days, click here for more information
<h4>Tenants or Owners have a right to dispute an eCheck (ACH) payment within 60 calendar days.&nbsp
column2: Below is an explanation from our payment processor:

column1:
""Due to the NACHA rules and regulations ACH disputes must be handled outside the ACH network . The customer also has a Right of Return. The consumer has 60 calendar days to challenge any ACH transaction with their bank and have it returned. NACHA is the network that governs the ACH payment system. Within the ACH network’s Rules, there is no requirement to notify the Originator (Merchant) or anyone else of the return. The consumer must complete and sign a Written Statement (WSUD), submit it to the bank and the transaction will be returned.

Either way, keep in mind that a valid, properly executed authorization is for all intents and purposes a contract and if one party breaches the terms of the contract, you have rights outside of the ACH Network. You can send to collections, have an attorney send a notice or take the consumer to court (regular or small claims – depending on the value of the transaction or authorization in question).""

column2: >are the reasons for return that apply to this particular situation:
= UNAUTHORIZED DEBIT TO CONSUMER ACCOUNT USING CORPORATE SEC CODE
CUSTOMER ADVISES ORIGINATOR IS NOT KNOWN TO RECEIVER AND/OR ORIGINATOR IS NOT AUTHORIZED BY RECEIVER TO DEBIT RECEIVER’S ACCOUNT

column1: • Code R29= CORPORATE CUSTOMER ADVISES NOT AUTHORIZED

column2: >It is important to note that there will be a $35 fee for each of these return types, which will be included on your Rentvine invoice.

column1: Example of email notification that signifies this type of return: Notice the return reason on the email.
Example of the Return explanation on the Tenant payment details page

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Proof of Authorization (POA) for a Tenant or Owner Payment (Money In) - ACH ChargeBack (over 60 days)","Did you receive an email from Forte asking for Proof of Authorization (POA) for one of the payments you received from a tenant or owner? See the article below for more information of what it means and what to do","en","https://help.rentvine.com/proof-of-authorization-ach-chargeback-after-60-days","<h4>&nbsp
If the ACH Chargeback is from a payment that is WITHIN
column3: click here for more information

column1: This will typically happen if a resident or owner disputes an eCheck (ACH) (Money In) payment after 60 days
Here is an example of the email:
Subject : POA Request 123 PM MID 99999 Authorization for [Tenant or Owner Name]

column2: Today, CSG Forte received a request for a copy of the Proof of Authorization (a “POA”) for the payment transaction identified below. A POA is authorization you obtained from your customer to debit their bank account for a specific amount on a specific date.

column1: The POA may be a signed receipt, written contract or other documentation (as specifically described below) that you have retained relating to the specific payment transaction.

column2: Please provide a copy of the POA requested to us by 4/1/2023.

column4: – Please provide a copy of the internet authorization, along with authorization time and date stamp (basic WEB documentation requirements are attached).

column1: Thank you in advance for your attention to this matter. Please let me know if you have any questions regarding this request for a POA.”

This happens when Forte, Rentvine’s partnered payment processor, receives a POA (Proof of Authorization) requests from banks when a tenant or owner states that a transaction was not authorized by them.

In order to resolve this quickly and avoid a reversal of the payment please reply to the email from Forte by providing a document showing at least the last 4 digits of the debited account.
column2: A receipt of the payment will usually satisfy the request.&nbsp
column3: You can print the receipt as a PDF by going to the details of the payment in Rentvine, click the green actions button and select print. In addition you may need to provide a copy of the lease agreement (for a tenant)&nbsp
column4: or management agreement (for an owner). This is very important as this is the tenant or owner bank's way of verifying that the transaction was indeed authorized in the correct bank account.

column1: • Click into the lease where the payment in question is from
<li>Once in the lease, click on the&nbsp
column3: tab. This will show all of the payments and charges for this particular lease

column1: • When you have located the payment, click on the amount of the payment to take you into the Payment Details
• In the Payment Details, click on the green Actions button and select Print
<li>A PDF of the receipt will open.&nbsp
column2: You can then download it and provide it to Forte.
","Property Managers","Payment Processing Information","60 days,Forte,POA,over 60 days,proof of authorization,return","2024-05-29T20:00:04.550Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Configure Personal Notification Settings","This article will show you how a user can decide which notifications they want to receive and how those notifications are delivered (system, email, text or slack)","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-configure-personal-notifications","

The personal notifications setting page provides users with the ability to customize their notifications according to their preferences. Users can easily check notifications on or off based on their importance. Additionally, users have the flexibility to choose the preferred mode of receiving notifications, such as through the app (system), email, text, and/or Slack.

column2: >This page is where every user added in the system can update their notifications. If you would like to add a group email or an email/number for someone that is not a user in the system, then you can configure that here Account Notifications.
Settings / Personal Notifications

column1: <li>Once you are on the page you can customize your notification contact methods.
• To receive text notifications you can enter your phone number in the top field. Once entered you will be able to select the ""Text"" checkbox for your notifications.
• To integrate Slack you can click the ""Add to Slack"" button at the top and this will allow you to select the ""Slack"" checkbox for your notifications.
Integrate with Slack to receive notifications to your slack account

The integration with Slack not only enables users to receive notifications, but also empowers them to take action directly from Slack. For instance, if a user is notified about a new work order submitted by a resident, they can easily assign the work order within Slack without the need to go through Rentvine.

• You can then scroll down the list to view all of the notifications that you would like to be notified for. When you see a notification that you need you can click the enable check box. You can choose from the four options of how you would like to be notified. You can choose as many notification methods as you would like.
• System- this will add it to the notifications tab internally within Rentvine. You can view these by clicking the bell icon in the top left of your account.
• Email- a notification will be sent to the email you used to register your Rentvine account.
• Text- a text notification will be sent to the phone number you configured at the top of this page.
• Slack- a notification will be sent to the Slack account you integrated at the top of this page.

column2: >

column1: <li>For lease notifications and work order notifications you will notice there are added fields for assignees. You will have three options for these notifications.
• I'm Assigned- you will only receive this notification for leases/work orders where you are listed as the assignee.
• Unassigned- this will send the notification if there is no assignee attached to the work order or lease
• Assigned to Someone Else- you will receive a notification for leases and work orders where someone else is listed as the assignee.

column2: data-hs-callout-type=""note"">If you would like to receive this notification regardless of the assignee you can select all of these options. This will notify you whenever this event happens.
>Examples of Assignees on Work Orders and Leases
>
>

column1: • When you are complete with your notification configuration make sure to click the green save button so save any changes made.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"User Roles","This article is going to go over all of the role settings and explain what they do.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/user-roles","

Roles are a set of different permissions that can be applied to all users in your Rentvine account. To create a new role, access your global settings by clicking on your profile icon in the top right-hand corner and selecting ""Settings"". From there, navigate to ""Users, Roles, &
column2: API"", click on ""Roles"", and create a new role with a unique name and desired settings. Once created, you can assign these roles to your users to adjust their permissions accordingly.

column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202025-05-15%20at%208-24-35%E2%80%AFPM-png-2.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

column2: API"". From here, you can click on Roles and click Create New Role. Here you will be able to create a name for the role and choose all of the settings you want to attach to the role. When you are done, you will be able to attach these roles to your users, and it will change their permissions accordingly.

column1: There are a lot of different role settings you can set up for your users. These are all broken down into different categories. Those categories are listed below, and you can click each one to take you to those settings on this page.

column2: >Helpful Tip: If you are looking for a specific role, press the Cmnd+F buttons on your keyboard to search for a specific role setting's name.

column1: The toggles for ""Administration"" are related to all of the global settings. The global settings will change certain settings for the whole Rentvine account. This is where you choose what you will choose what you allow users to change and what they can't change.

column2: ""Administration"". If you toggle this on, it will turn on all toggles for this field, and will toggle off all if you toggle it off.

column1: • Manage Account Settings- allows the user to edit, add, or delete the ""account manager"" settings from the global settings page. This toggle will also allow the user to view and edit the tax reporting settings (1099 Reporting).
• Manage Users- allows users to edit, add, or delete users from the global Users, Roles, &
column2: API settings page.

column1: • Manage Accounting Settings- allows users to edit, add, or delete the settings from the global ""accounting settings"" page.
• Manage Chart of Accounts- allows users to edit, add, or delete the settings from the global settings page.
• Manage Management Fee Settings- allows users to edit, add, or delete the settings from the ""Management Fees"" global settings page.
• Manage Late Fee Settings- allows users to edit, add, or delete the settings from the ""Late Fees"" global settings page.
• Manage Posting Settings- allows users to edit, add, or delete the settings from the ""Postings"" option on the global settings page.
• Manage Statement Settings- allows users to edit, add, or delete the ""Statements"" settings from the global settings page.
• Manage Check Templates- allows users to edit, add, or delete the ""Check Template"" settings from the global settings page.

• Manage NSF Fee Settings- allows users to edit the NSF settings within the accounting settings from the global settings page. Please note that if ""Manage accounting settings"" is off, the user will not be able to edit the NSF settings either.

column2: >Manage Property Custom Features- allows the user to edit, add, or delete the ""Custom Features"" settings from the global settings page.

column1: • Manage Maintenance Inspection Default Areas- allows user to edit, add, or delete ""Default Inspection Areas"" settings from the global settings page.
• Manage Maintenance Inspection Items- allows the user to edit, add, or delete the ""Inspection Items"" settings from the global settings page.
• Manage Maintenance Inspection Actions- allows the user to edit, add, or delete the ""Inspection Actions"" settings from the global settings page.
• Manage Screening Application Template Settings- allows the user to edit, add, or delete the ""Application Templates"" settings from the global settings page.
• Manage Custom Fields- allows users to edit, add, or delete the ""Custom Field"" settings from the global settings page.

column2: >This is what users will see when they try to go into one of these settings that are turned off on the user roles for administration.
This will allow the user to view the

column2: Allows users to manage webhooks within the system

column1: The accounting toggles are going to give access to certain actions within the ""Accounting"" tab of your Rentvine account. These include different tabs such as the Money In, Money Out, Banking, Transactions, Diagnostics, and Manager.

column2: ""Accounting"". If you toggle this on, it will turn on all toggles for this field, and will toggle off all if you toggle it off.

column1: • Modify Lease Transactions- This toggle will be for the tenant receipts/charges within the money-in section. Once they click on one of these, they will be able to view the payment, and there will be an edit button in the top right to change some information. They will also be able to do this on credit. This works the same way from the transactions tab on a lease, where they will have the same ability. If this is off, there will be no edit button.
column2: >This will also allow the user to record tenant payments. They can do this through the quick actions or the Money In green actions button. If this is off, they will see the screen saying they don't have permission.

column1: • Void Lease Transactions- This toggle deals with the same thing as the above toggle, but just deals with the voiding. If this is on and the charge isn't paid, the user will be able to click the green actions button and void the lease transaction. If this is off, the user will not see that from the green actions button.
column4: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202025-05-15%20at%209-06-39%E2%80%AFPM-png-1.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • Post Late Fees- This is a toggle for the money-in section. This is for if you pay late fees manually. If this is on a green actions button will appear for the user to post late fees (This will only show if it is the only toggle on
column2: a green actions button will appear if multiple actions are enabled).

column1: • Modify Owner Transactions- This toggle will be in the money-in section as well. This will allow the user to edit certain information for individual owner payments. There will be an edit button in the top right to change the information. If this is toggled off, the user will not see anything here.
column2: >This will also allow the user to record owner payments. They can do this through the quick actions or the Money In green actions button. If this is off, they will see the screen saying they don't have permission.
column4: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202025-05-15%20at%209-10-42%E2%80%AFPM-png.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • Void Owner Transactions- This toggle deals with the same thing as the above toggle, but just deals with the voiding. This is for those owner payments. If a user clicks a specific one, they will have the option to void the payment if it was recorded via check. They will do this through the green actions menu. If this toggle is turned off, they won't see that option.

column2: This toggle will be in the money-in section. This will allow the user to edit certain information for individual owner payments. There will be an edit button in the top right to change the information. If this is toggled off, the user will not see anything here. <span style=""text-decoration: underline
column3: >This will also allow the user to record other payments. They can do this through the quick actions or the Money In green actions button. If this is off, they will see the screen saying they don't have permission and won't see it in the green actions button.
column5: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202025-05-15%20at%209-13-25%E2%80%AFPM-png.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • Void Other Payments- This affects the same toggle as the above. It will be for voiding other payments. If the user clicks on the other payment, they will be able to void it from the green actions menu. If this is not toggled on, the user will not see that option.

• Modify Bill- This toggle will affect the bill's section under ""Money Out"". It will allow the user to edit a bill within their Rentvine account. If the user clicks on a bill here, they will see an edit button to change the information regarding this specific bill.
column2: >The user will also have the ability to create bills from this section under the green actions button, or the quick actions. If this toggle is off, they will not see either of these options.
column4: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202025-05-15%20at%209-16-36%E2%80%AFPM-png.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • Pay Bill- This toggle will be in the green actions button of the ""Money Out"" tab in the quick actions menu. If this is turned on, it will allow the user to click and pay bills that are already posted in Rentvine. If this toggle is off, they will not be able to see this action.

• Approve Bill Pay Batch- This toggle will only work if a payment or a payout has been created and the toggle for approval on submission is turned off. This will make it so the payment batch is pending, ready for approval. This will give that user the authority to approve those payment batches.
• Void Bill- This will allow the user to void any bills. This is from the money out section>
column2: bills. If they click on a specific bill, they will be able to click the green actions button within here and void the bill. If this is off, they will not be able to see this option in the green actions button.

column1: • Pay Owners- This toggle will allow the user to do owner payouts either through the quick actions or through money out>
column3: pay owners. Instead of a green actions button here, they will have a green button that says ""Pay Owners"".

column1: • Modify Deposit- This toggle will be in the ""Banking"" section of the accounting tab. This will allow the user to create new deposits for funds within their Rentvine account. They will be able to do this from the main banking page by clicking the green actions button, then new deposit, or clicking on a bank account. In here, they will see the options for a new deposit. If this toggle is off, they will still be able to view all of the deposits they will not be able to edit them, and those options above will not be there.

• Void Deposit- This toggle will go with the toggle above. For those same deposits, it will allow the user to go into each deposit for a bank account and click the green actions button. In here, they will be able to void and void any deposits recorded.

• Modify Reconciliations- This toggle will be in the ""Banking"" section of your Rentvine account. This will allow the user to create a new reconciliation for a certain period and edit what is chosen to reconcile within it. To do this, they will go to the banking tab and click the green actions button>
column2: reconcile, or click on a bank account and click the reconcile button in the top right. If this toggle is off, the user will not be able to click the reconcile button but will still be able to view previous reconciliations.&nbsp

column1: • Void Reconciliations- This toggle will be for the same reconciliations as the above toggle. The user will be allowed to go into the reconciliations tab for any of the bank accounts you have in Rentvine. They will then be able to click on a specific reconciliation, and under the green actions button, they can void it.

• Modify Transfers- This toggle will be in the ""Banking"" section of your Rentvine account. This will allow the user to go to the ""Transfers"" tab, and under the green actions button, they will have the ability to create bank transfers.

column1: • Void Transfers- This toggle will be in the ""Banking"" section of your Rentvine account. In here under the green actions button, they will have the ability to void any of these bank transfers.

column2: >Modify Adjustments- This toggle will be in the ""Banking"" section of your Rentvine account. This will allow the user to either go into a bank account or click the green actions button and click ""New Adjustment"". The user can create these for any of the bank accounts you have within Rentvine.

column1: • Modify Fees- This toggle will be in the ""Banking"" section of your Rentvine account. This will allow the user to create new bank fees within any of your bank accounts that you have within Rentvine. They can click the new bank fee from the banking main page>

• Modify Ledger Transfers- This toggle will be in the ""Transactions"" section of your Rentvine account. column1: • Print Checks- This toggle will be in the ""Money Out"" section of your Rentvine account. If they go to the ""Payments"" tab, they will be able to click on any check payments. This toggle will allow the user to approve those bills so that they can be paid
