column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Two-Factor Authentication","For security reasons and to avoid any fraud potential, it is always a good idea to add two factor authentication when generating payouts. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-set-up-two-factor-authentication","

column2: >Please note that two factor authentication is enabled for all users, owner, tenants and vendors in order to register and login to their Rentvine account.

Two factor authentication will default to your email address used to register your Rentvine account. You will be prompted to sign in and receive an authentication code to your email. This will look like the below.&nbsp

column1: <li>If you would like you can enable the two factor code to be sent via a text message to your phone. To do this you can click the ellipses next to your name in the bottom left. From here click ""My Profile"".&nbsp
• From here you will be able to click on ""Setup Phone Number"" under the Two Factor box.

<li>This will take you to a screen where you can enter your phone number. This will also prompt you with another verification code that will be sent to your email. You will need to enter this MFA code in order to change your phone number.&nbsp

column2: ><strong>Once this is done the two factor verification codes will be sent to this phone number by default. If needed, you will still have the option to send this by email even after it is sent to the phone number on file.&nbsp

>You can also control if you want to require two factor authentication for all payouts. From your global settings you can click on accounting settings. Under general there is an option to enable ""Is Two Factor Required for Payout Approval"". If this toggle is on it will be required to enter in the MFA code that is sent to either your phone or email. This is to add an extra layer of security so every payout uses MFA before being sent out.&nbsp
>
>

>Please note that this toggle will be set on by default. You can disable this two factor authentication for payout approval. For security purposes this is not recommended and you will see the following notice:
>Here is an example of a payout with two factor authentication required.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Void a Lease Charge that has a Receipt Allocated to It","Do you need to void a charge on a lease but don't see the option to void it? This is most likely because there is a receipt applied to the charge. This article will show you how to unallocate the receipt and void the charge.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-void-a-lease-charge-that-has-a-payment-allocated-to-it","
<li>To get started you will need to go to the lease and click on the transactions tab. This will show you all of the tenant receipts, lease charges, and credits attached to this lease.&nbsp

column2: >For this example, you will notice that there is a $1000 charge for Rent and a $1000 receipt. $900 of the receipt is applied to the rent charge. Even though the charge isn't fully paid you still do not have the option to void. No amount of a receipt can be applied to a charge in order to void it.

column1: • The next step would be to click on the charge you would like to void. This will take you to the lease charge information screen. If you scroll down on this page you will be able to see the allocated receipt that is applied to this charge. You will need to click this receipt to continue.

<li>This takes you to the receipt information screen. Here you will be able to scroll down to the ""Applied To"" field where you can see all of the charges a certain receipt is allocated to. In this box, you will click ""Reapply""&nbsp

<li>This will allow you to reallocate the receipt. You will need to type in a zero for the charge you are looking to void. This makes it so no receipt is applied to the charge. For this example there is $900 receipt applied to the rent income charge so this needs to be zeroed out. When you are done you can click the green reapply button at the bottom to save these changes.&nbsp

column2: >Please note that multiple receipts could be applied to a charge. If this is the case then you would need to repeat this process for all receipts currently applying to that charge.

column1: <li>Once this is done you will need to go back to the lease transactions tab. You will see that the charge will have a flag with ""Amount Unpaid"". This should be the total of the actual charge as there are now no receipts applied to it. You can now click on the charge you would like to void. From the green actions button on this page, you will now have the option to void.&nbsp

column2:
src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-06-20%20at%2010-20-47%20AM-png.png"" width=""2192"" loading=""lazy"">

","Leases","Lease Financials","delete a lease charge,delete charge,how to delete a charge,how to void a lease charge,lease charge,remove charge,remove lease charge,void a charge,void a lease charge,void lease charge","2024-06-20T14:22:09.125Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Manage Copies of a Rentsign Document","Do you want to receive a copy of a Rentsign document but do not need to be a signer on the document? This article will show you how to receive a copy of the signed document.

<li>To get started, you will need to go to the Rentsign tab. In here, you can create a new Rentsign document or view documents that have yet to be sent out. For this example, we will click into an existing Rentsign document that has not been sent for signatures. In here, you will need to click on the ""Builder"" button.&nbsp

<li>In the builder of the document, you will see a button to ""Manage Copies"". If you click on this, you can add an email address to which the signed copy will be sent. You can add as many emails in this section as you need. This will work similarly to a CC where the parties attached to the document will receive the signed document as well as the people listed in the manage copies field.&nbsp

column3:
src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-01-16%20at%206-15-36%20PM-png.png"" width=""684"" loading=""lazy"">

","Rentsign","Rentsign","copy of document,copy of signed document,manage parties,rentsign,signed Rentsign Document,signed document","2025-05-12T15:14:40.050Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1:
Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Sending Bulk Reports To Owners","Do you want to send bulk reports to your owners? This article will show you the process of sending bulk reports to owners by using the ""create owners statement"" function. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/sending-bulk-reports-to-owners","

Step One:
Go to your global settings and create a statement with all toggles turned off.
column2: The idea behind this statement setting is to not show any financial details on their statement.&nbsp
column3: Use your other statement settings for that.&nbsp
column4: Use this new statement for only sending BULK REPORTS to your owners.&nbsp

column1: Click the New Statement Setting and name your new statement.
Next, make sure all toggles are set to OFF on your new statement settings.
Now you can add all the reports you want to send in Bulk to your owners here.

Now that your statement is all set up correctly, you can start sending this statement to your owners so they can receive their Bulk reports. You can do this by selecting the portfolio tab and moving to the green action button and selecting Create Owner Statements.
Make sure you toggle on the ""override statement setting"" and choose the statement you created to send bulk reports to your owners.
Select the owners to whom you want to send the reports to.
The next page will be the statement batch page where you can review the reports before you publish them to the owner(s).
These are the reports that will be sent to the owners you selected.
Don't forget to publish the ""report"" statement to the owner after reviewing it, as shown in the screenshot below.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Complete a Pending Bank Transfer","Did you recently complete a move out and the final step of the move out and the system wanted you to create a pending bank transfer? This article will explain why this was created and how to complete this in the system. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-complete-a-pending-bank-transfer","<ul>

• The pending bank transfer setting in the system is based off of your posting setting. For this example the posting setting connected to this portfolio has the operating balance set to the client trust and the escrow set to the escrow trust account. The lease refund bank account is set to the client trust account. The funds for the security deposit are held in the security deposit bank account but are refunded out of the operating account. This means after a refund is completed the full amount of funds held in the security deposit will need to be transferred.

column2: ><strong>Please note that this is just one example of a posting setting. No matter the posting setting set up the pending bank transfer section will correctly calculate the amount that needs to be transferred.&nbsp

column1: • The below screenshot is from a lease move out. If you need more information on completing the move out you can click here. For this example there was $1000 held for the security deposit and the whole security deposit is being refunded to the tenant. Based on the posting setting mentioned earlier the pending bank transfer if toggled on will want to create a transfer of the full $1000 from escrow to the operating trust.

<li>When you are ready you can click the submit button to complete the move out and this will give you another confirmation on the pending bank transfer. Once you approve the submission and click ""Complete Move Out"" this pending transfer will be created.&nbsp

• To view these pending bank transfers you can click on the accounting tab. You will then need to click the banking tab. There will now be a tab at the top of the screen that is labeled ""Pending Transfers"". This page will show you all of the pending transfers that have been created but have yet to be transferred. This will combine all transfers based off of the bank accounts. I.e. escrow transferring to operating or operating transferring to escrow.

<li>This will show you the source/ destination bank account, amount of the full transfer for all the pending transfers, reference, description, and date posted. Under this you will see all of the pending transfers from move outs that show the ledger, created by/ date, and the amount. These will all be selected by default.&nbsp

<li>You can select individual pending bank transfers for the actual amount you would like to send. You can do this by clicking the check boxes next to the transfer. For this example I am only going to select the $1000 transfer that was just created.&nbsp

column2: ><strong>Please note that you will need to update the amount at the top of the page to match the selected pending transfers.&nbsp

column1: <li>From the bottom of this page you can add additional transaction if you would like. You can do this by selecting the ledger and the amount. This pulls from the settings set at the top of the page. This is not required to complete the transfer for the selected transactions. Please note that the total amount at the top will need to be updated to include this amount.&nbsp
<li>When you are done you can click the ""Transfer Funds"" button in the bottom right to finalize this transfer.&nbsp

column2: >Please note that you will still need to complete a bank transfer in real life for these bank accounts. This will be for the amount you selected here. The transfer in Rentvine should match the date you recorded this bank transfer in real life. This is to make sure your reconciliations are balanced.

","Accounting","Banking","automatic,automatic bank transfer,bank transfer,move out,pending,pending bank transfer,pending bank transfers,transfer security deposit to operating","2024-05-28T20:53:29.693Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Applications Dashboard","This article will walk you through customizing and adding widgets to your applications dashboard.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/applications-dashboard","<h3 style=""text-align: center
column3:
Viewing the Dashboard

Customizing Your Dashboard

Adding Widgets

Widget Setup

column2: >To view your applications dashboard, you can click the screening tab and then click ""Dashboard"". This will show you the default screening dashboard and will save any changes made. This dashboard is on a per-user basis, so all users can customize this dashboard to their needs.

column1: • To start configuring your dashboard, you can click the green actions button and click on ""Configure Dashboard"".

• This will allow you to edit the current widgets you have selected on the dashboard. The first thing you will notice is an ""X"" in the top right of every widget. You can click this to remove any widgets from your dashboard. Make sure to click save to confirm and changes made.

• You also have the option to click and drag the arrow in the bottom right corner of every widget. This will allow to to edit the scale of the widget if you would like to make it smaller or larger. Make sure to click save to confirm and changes made.

• If you click anywhere on the widget, you will also be able to drag and drop it to different areas. This will allow you to move the widgets around to any position you prefer. Make sure to click save to confirm and changes made.

<li>If you ever need to edit any of your current widgets, you can click the gear icon in the top right of the widget. This will allow you to edit the current settings and filters that are being displayed.&nbsp
<li>You can add an assortment of different application widgets by clicking the green actions button and clicking ""Add Widget"".&nbsp

• By clicking the dropdown, you will be able to select from the list of widgets. This will be grouped by the different types of widgets. You will have three different groups of widgets. These are the following:

column2: This will allow you to choose columns to add to the widget, like applicants, date created, and status. It will also allow you to add a filter by application statuses.
column4: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-01-28%20at%2010-03-50%20PM-png.png"" width=""614"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • Application Group- This widget will allow you to create a graph based on certain metrics, like application count. It will also allow you to add filters to sort this graph to what is most useful for you.
column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-01-28%20at%2010-06-22%20PM-png.png"" width=""621"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • Applications by month- This will display a graph of the application count. This can also be filtered by the assignee and the date created.
column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-01-28%20at%2010-07-13%20PM-png.png"" width=""615"" loading=""lazy"">

column2: >Please note that you will have widgets labeled as ""Custom"". These custom labels are the default widgets that can be customized from scratch. You will also have other widgets that are not labeled that already have custom filters and statuses set. These are suggested widgets for useful information.

column1: <li>Once you click into a widget, you will see the settings. These are different for each widget and can be customized to what is most useful for you.&nbsp
column2: For this example, we will select the Application List widget. You will have the following settings/filters:
Name that is displayed for the widget on the Dashboard.

column1: • Columns to Display- These are all of the columns that will show on the actual widget on your dashboard.
• Sort By- This will be the order that the items display on the widget.
• Number of Items- The number of items shows on the widget before you have to click ""Show More"" to view more items on the list.
• Filters- These will be per widget. This will allow for a specific widget by adding filters like assignee, creation date, and different statuses.

• When you are done adding your filters and settings, make sure to click save to add this to your dashboard. This will appear at the bottom of your dashboard. If you would like to edit the position or size of this widget, please view the ""Configuring Dashboard"" section of this article.
column4: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Example%20Widget%20Setup%20Filters%20Update-png.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

column2: >Please note that every category will have its unique filters and settings. You can also create multiple widgets using the same category with different settings/filters.
>All of these dashboard widgets are available on your global dashboard. For more information regarding your global dashboard, please view this article.

column1: • If you need any further assistance with creating custom application widgets, please don't hesitate to contact our support team at support@rentvine.com. We are here to help you with any customizations you may require.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Leases Dashboard","This article will walk you through customizing and adding widgets to your applications dashboard.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/leases-dashboard","<h3 style=""text-align: center

• To view your leases dashboard you can click the leases tab and then click ""Dashboard"". This will show you the default leasing dashboard that you have configured. This dashboard is on a per user basis so all users can customize this dashboard to their needs.
• To start configuring your dashboard you can click the green actions button and click on ""Configure Dashboard"".

• This will allow you to edit the current widgets you have selected on the dashboard. The first thing you will notice is a ""X"" in the top right of every widget. You can click this to remove any widgets from your dashboard. Make sure to click save to confirm any changes made.

• You also have the option to click and drag the arrow in the bottom right corner of every widget. This will allow to to edit the scale of the widget it you would like to make it smaller or larger. Make sure to click save to confirm any changes made.

• If you click anywhere on the widget you will also be able to drag and drop it to different areas. This will allow you to move around the widgets to any position you prefer. Make sure to click save to confirm any changes made.

<li>If you ever need to edit edit any of your current widgets you can click the gear icon in the top right of the widget. This will allow you to edit the current settings and filters that are being displayed.&nbsp
<li>You can add an assortment of different maintenance widgets by click the green actions button and clicking ""Add Widget"".&nbsp
• From this page you will be able to pick from the main list of widgets. These are the following groups:
• Rent Statistics- This will allow you to display the average rent and the total rent of all of the leases in the system.

• Lease List- This will allow you to choose from columns like start date, end date, tenants, status, etc. It will also let you select from a list of filters to customize this widget to your preference. A good use case for this is for grouping pending move outs or move ins.
column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-01-28%20at%2010-35-47%20PM-png.png"" width=""619"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • Lease Balance Statistics- This will allow you to display a number of statistics like current charges, current rent charges, and current balance paid.
• Lease Group- This allows you to display a graph based on your lease count. This can be filtered by an assignee, creation date, and move in date.
column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-01-28%20at%2010-36-12%20PM-png.png"" width=""618"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • Lease By Month- This will allow you to display a graph based on move ins and move outs over a span of time. This can also be filtered down to an assignee, move in date, or move out date.
column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-01-28%20at%2010-36-27%20PM-png.png"" width=""618"" loading=""lazy"">

column2: >Please note that you will have widgets labeled as ""Custom"". These custom labels are the default widgets that can be customized from scratch. You will also have other widgets that are not labeled that already have custom filters and statuses set. These are suggested widgets for useful information.

column1: <li>For this example we will use the ""Lease List"" custom widget. Once selected you will see the follow settings and filters:
• Title- This is where you can put a custom name that will display on the widget.
• Columns to Display- This will show all the columns that can be added to the widget. This includes things like unit, tenants, start date, days until lease ends, etc.
<li>Sort By- Allows you to sort the order by date created (newest to oldest),&nbsp
column2: move in date (oldest to newest), etc.

column1: • Number of Items- This will be the number of rows that display on the actual widget before you have to click ""Show More"".
• Filters- This allows you to filter down even more using filters like move out date, pending move in, lease status, etc.

When you are complete with your settings and filters make sure to click ""Update"" to add the widget to your dashboard. This will add the widget to the bottom of you dashboard. If you would like to edit the size or position of this widget you can follow the ""Configure Dashboard"" section of this article.

column2: >Please note that every category will have it's own unique filters and settings. You can also create multiple widgets using the same category with different settings/filters.
>All of these dashboard widgets are available on your global dashboard. For more information regarding your global dashboard please view this article.

column1: • If you need any further assistance with creating custom application widgets, please don't hesitate to contact our support team at support@rentvine.com. We are here to help you with any customizations you may require.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Maintenance Dashboard","This article will walk you through customizing and adding widgets to your maintenance dashboard.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/maintenance-dashboard","<h3 style=""text-align: center

• To view your maintenance dashboard you can click the maintenance tab and then click ""Dashboard"". This will show you the default maintenance dashboard that you have configured. This dashboard is on a per user basis so all users can customize this dashboard to their needs.
• To start configuring your dashboard you can click the green actions button and click on ""Configure Dashboard"".

<li>This will allow you to edit the current widgets you have selected on the dashboard. The first thing you will notice is a ""X"" in the top right of every widget. You can click this to remove any widgets from your dashboard. Make sure to click the save button to confirm any changes made.&nbsp

<li>You also have the option to click and drag the arrow in the bottom right corner of every widget. This will allow to to edit the scale of the widget it you would like to make it smaller or larger. Make sure to click the save button to confirm any changes made.&nbsp

<li>If you click anywhere on the widget you will also be able to drag and drop it to different areas. This will allow you to move around the widgets to any position you prefer. Make sure to click the save button to confirm any changes made.&nbsp

<li>If you ever need to edit edit any of your current widgets you can click the gear icon in the top right of the widget. This will allow you to edit the current settings and filters that are being displayed.&nbsp
<li>You can add an assortment of different maintenance widgets by click the green actions button and clicking ""Add Widget"".&nbsp
• From this page you can choose to add widgets from the following categories:
• Work Order List- Allows you to sort work orders by different columns (work order number, date created, days open, etc.) and filter by user based parameters (assignee, work order statuses, etc.).
column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-01-28%20at%207-42-17%20PM-png.png"" width=""618"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • Work Order Group- Allows you to build a graph (pie, bar, table) for many different metrics on your work orders. Also, it allows you to filter for the specific work orders you are looking for.
column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-01-28%20at%207-47-56%20PM-png.png"" width=""620"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: <li>Work Orders By Month- Allows you to display certain metrics for certain work order statuses. Also allows you to filter by certain assignees or creation dates.&nbsp

<li>Work Order Statistics- Allows you to select between a wide range of statistics (average cost, pending work orders, open work orders, average days to close, etc.) and filter by the assignee, date created, and date closed.&nbsp
column4: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-01-28%20at%207-48-28%20PM-png.png"" width=""619"" loading=""lazy"">

column2: Allows you to add important vendor information to easily access, sort by different parameters, and filter by vendor insurance expiration dates.&nbsp
column5: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-01-28%20at%207-48-41%20PM-png.png"" width=""619"" loading=""lazy"">

column2: >Please note that you will have widgets labeled as ""Custom"". These custom labels are the default widgets that can be customized from scratch. You will also have other widgets that are not labeled that already have custom filters and statuses set. These are suggested widgets for useful information.

column1: <li>For this example we will go to the add widget screen and add a ""Work Order List"" widget. In here you will see the following settings and filters:
• Title- This is where you can put a custom name that will display on the widget.
• Columns to Display- This will show all the columns that can be added to the widget. This includes things like property, date created, days open, and status.
• Sort By- This will be how you would like the information to display. This includes date created (oldest to newest) , days open (highest to lowest), etc.
• Number of Items- This will be the number of rows that display on the actual widget before you have to click ""Show More"".
• Filters- These will be important filters that every user can use to show data that is useful for them.

• When you are complete with your settings and filters make sure to click ""Update"" to add the widget to your dashboard. This will add the widget to the bottom of you dashboard. If you would like to edit the size or position of this widget you can follow the ""Configuring Dashboard"" section of this article.

column2: >Please note that every category will have it's own unique filters and settings. You can also create multiple widgets using the same category with different settings/filters.
>All of these dashboard widgets are available on your global dashboard. For more information regarding your global dashboard please view this article.

column1: • If you need any further assistance with creating custom application widgets, please don't hesitate to contact our support team at support@rentvine.com. We are here to help you with any customizations you may require.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Global Dashboard","This article will walk you through customizing and adding widgets to your main dashboard.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/global-dashboard","<h3 style=""text-align: center

• To view your global dashboard you can click the Rentvine logo in the top left of your screen. This will show you the default dashboard that you have configured. This dashboard is on a per user basis so all users can customize this dashboard to their needs.
• To start configuring your dashboard you can click the green actions button and click on ""Configure Dashboard"".

• This will allow you to edit the current widgets you have selected on the dashboard. The first thing you will notice is a ""X"" in the top right of every widget. You can click this to remove any widgets from your dashboard. Make sure to click save to confirm any changes made.

<li>You also have the option to click and drag the arrow in the bottom right corner of every widget. This will allow to to edit the scale of the widget it you would like to make it smaller or larger. Make sure to click save to confirm and changes made.&nbsp

• If you click anywhere on the widget you will also be able to drag and drop it to different areas. This will allow you to move around the widgets to any position you prefer. Make sure to click save to confirm and changes made.

• If you click anywhere on the widget you will also be able to drag and drop it to different areas. This will allow you to move around the widgets to any position you prefer. Make sure to click save to confirm any changes made.
• To add a widget you can click the green actions button of the dashboard and click ""Add Widget"". This will pull up all the widgets that are available at the global dashboard level.

• This will show you the complete list of widgets that are available in the system. You can click into each one of these and add certain settings and filters. Since this is at the global level every widget on every other dashboard is available.

column2: >To view the specifics of every widget group you can view the following articles based on the dashboard each widget is from.
>Leasing Widgets","Property Managers","Dashboards","add widget,dashboard,global,global dashboard,main,main dashboard","2024-05-28T17:42:45.039Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Request/Add a Vendor Estimate","Do you need to request/record a vendor estimate for a work order? This article will walk you through recording an estimate and assigning the vendor from an estimate. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-request/add-a-vendor-estimate","<ul>

<li>If you go into an individual work order within the system, you will see the ""Estimate"" tab to record and manage estimates for a work order. In here, you can click on the actions button and you have the option to record an estimate&nbsp

• If you select ""New Estimate"" this will be a way to record an estimate that you received from a vendor. You will have the option to choose the vendor this estimate is from, the amount, the date received, any comments, the estimated completion date, and any pertinent files you would like to upload.

• Once this is created you will have the option to send this to the owner for a approval or you can approve it directly. Once approved, the total estimate amount will be established as the work order estimate cost, and the vendor will be assigned to the work order.

• The other option you have from the work order estimates tab is to request estimates. If you select this option, you will be able to choose multiple vendors that you would like to send an estimate request. You will also be able to select a submission deadline, any extra details, and select if you would like to notify the vendor that a request was sent to them. Once you click request in the bottom right, it will show the requests submitted. You'll be able to view the status of the estimate.

column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-05-30%20at%2011.25.36%20AM.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: <li>Hopping over to the vendor portal, you can see what the vendor sees during this process. The vendors also have a new tab in their portal dedicated to just estimates. In here, the vendor will be able to see any current requests,&nbsp
column2: all submitted requests, and any declined requests.&nbsp
column3: When the vendor clicks on the current request they can either submit the estimate or decline it. If they want to submit an estimate, they can enter in the amount, any comments, the estimated completion date, and any files they want to include. Once they click submit it will send it back to the manager.

column1: • Back on the manager side of things, you will now see the submitted estimate. This will have all of the information the vendor submitted. You have the option to send this for owner approval. If you choose this option you will have a field to enter in an adjustment. If you enter an amount here it will add to the total work order estimate that the owner sees. They will not see this adjustment amount, only the full amount of the estimate. This is useful if you are budgeting for any markups that might be added to the work order bill later. You also are able to view the total estimate from this page. There is another flag that lets you know if this estimate exceeds the maintenance limit that is set on the property. The last thing you can do is add any additional comments for the owner to see. When you are ready, click the green send for approval button and it will notify the owner asking for their approval.

• Viewing the owners side of things from their portal, you will see that they now also have an estimates tab just like the vendor. It will be very similar with the pending approval tab, approved tab, and the rejected tab. If you click on the pending approval you will see the owner has the option to either approve the estimate or reject the estimate. Once this is either approved or denied it will update on the manager side. I will approve this one and then head back over to the management side.

• Once that is done, you will see that the status has updated and automatically approves the estimate for you. You will notice that the vendor that submitted the estimate is automatically set as the assigned vendor on the work order. The estimate amount is also automatically set as the estimated cost on the work order upon owner approval.
column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-05-30%20at%2011.29.40%20AM.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">
column5:
src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-05-30%20at%2011.29.57%20AM.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">
The last option you have in here ia if you approve the estimate without owner approval. There is an option to notify the vendor that their estimate has been approved. If this is toggled on, the vendor will receive an email notification that this was approved and will also appear in their approved tab on their portal. Once you click approve, you can go back to the main details page of the work order and you will notice that the vendor that you approved the estimate for will automatically be the assigned vendor for this work order. This will also automatically set the work order estimate cost.

column2: ","Maintenance","Maintenance","estimate,quote,quote from a vendor,vendor,vendor estimate,vendor submitted,work order estimate,work order quote,work orders","2024-05-30T15:31:33.394Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Add a Signature to Checks","Do you need to add a signature to your checks and remote checks? This article will walk you through adding this information.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-add-a-signature-to-checks","<ul>
• The first step is to go to the accounting tab and click on banking. From here you will be able to select one of your bank accounts.
<li>From the details page, scroll down until you see the box labeled ""Bank Account Information"". In the top right of this box you will need to click the edit button.&nbsp

<li>This will pull out a side bar where you can scroll down until you find the field ""Check Signatory"". You can enter the signature here and this is what will be displayed on the check. Make sure to click save to save this change.&nbsp
• To make sure this displays on your checks you will need to make sure it is added to your check template. You can find this under your check template settings in your global settings.

<li>In here you will see the field ""Check Signature"". This will pull from the signature that was added under the bank account. You can click on this and drag and drop it to the desired location.&nbsp

column2: >Here is an example of how this will display on a printed check

column1: This will also change the check signature for remote checks sent from the system if you have not already set up your remote check processing. If you have already been set up for remote check processing and would like to have a new signature set, you will need to reach out to support@rentvine.com. We will be able to resend the verification and it will then pull the new check signature.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"What is a Watcher on a Lease?","Do you need an additional user to be notified for events that occur on a lease. This article will explain what lease watchers are and how to add them to a lease.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/what-is-a-watcher-on-a-lease","<h4 style=""text-align: center
column2: >A Watcher refers to users who have a vested interest on a lease and need to receive important notifications regarding a lease. Watchers can be added manually or added by other users. Watchers will receive all of the same notifications that the assignee receives.

column1: <li>To add a watcher to a lease you can go to a specific lease in the system. On this page you can click the ""eye"" icon in the top right to pull out a sidebar.&nbsp
column2: In here you will see options to configure watchers on this lease.
You can add yourself as a watcher to be notified by clicking the ""Start Watching"" button.

column1: <li>You can add users in the system to be watchers by selecting them from the dropdown list.&nbsp
• You can also remove watchers by clicking the ""X"" next to their name on this page.

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Offboard an Owner/Portfolio","Has an owner ended there management agreement and now you need to remove them from Rentvine? This article will walk you through an option you have to offload them. This includes moving their security deposits and deactivating their properties. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-offboard","<ul>

column2: >To start you will work your way backward from the lease to the portfolio. You will need to click on an active lease attached to any of the properties under this portfolio. If there are no active leases or security deposits held, then you can skip to the next step by clicking here.

column1: • You have two options for the security deposit. These options will be to send the funds directly to the new property management company through the move-out flow (option one) or first release the funds to the owner and then send the funds out to the new property management company (option 2). The first option is quicker, but will not show the flow of funds to the owner. The second option takes longer but will show this flow.

column2: >If you are using option one you can click this knowledge base article.
>If you are using option two you can click this knowledge base article.

column1: <li>You will repeat whichever option you pick for all of the leases that you need to send the security deposit out of for this portfolio.&nbsp

column2: >This step will be posting all remaining management fees and paying out all bills associated with this portfolio.

column1: <li>First we will go to the accounting tab and click on ""Manager"". You can then click post management fees.&nbsp

<li>From here you can filter by the specific portfolio you are offboarding. You can then click search to view any management fees for all of the properties under this portfolio. <strong>Please note that it is important to check the current period and the previous period in case any management fees were missed.&nbsp

<li>If there are any management fees to post then you can select them all and you can click the ""Post Management Fees"" button in the bottom right. This will create the bills to be paid out to your company.&nbsp
column2: If there are no bills to post then you can ignore this action.&nbsp

>The next step will be to pay any bills for this portfolio. To do this you can click the quick actions which will be the rocket ship icon in the top left and then clicking pay bills. You will be able to filter this page by the portfolio and you can select the portfolio that you are offboarding. Click search to pull up all bills.

>Click the search button to view all of the bills for this portfolio. You can then select all of the bills by clicking the check box next to the bills. When all of these are selected you can click the green ""Post"" button. This will take you to the payment details page where you can make any changes and then finalize and post the payments.&nbsp

>To confirm everything is paid up to this point you can go to the portfolio. Here you can click on the ledger tab and you should see a $0 amount in the all categories except for the operating balance, cash balance, and a reserve amount/additional reserve if that is set.&nbsp
><em>This step will deal with removing any reserve on the portfolio, disbursing the remaining funds to the owner, and sending a final statement.&nbsp

>If there is any reserve or an additional reserve set then you can follow these knowledge base articles to remove this amount. This will make it so you can distribute the full amount of funds back to the owner.

column1: • With the reserves removed you can now click the green actions button from the portfolio and click ""Pay Owner"".

• You can now select the owner by clicking the check box next to the amount to pay. You can then click the submit payments at the bottom of the page. This will take you to the approval page where you can submit the payment and disburse the funds to the owner.
<li>You should now see a $0 balance on all of the ledger balances as all bills have been posted, paid, and the final disbursements have gone out.&nbsp
To send out a final statement to the owner you can click the ""Portfolios"" tab. From here you can click the green actions button and click ""Create Owner Statements"".
• You can then set the parameters for this statement like the date range, name, statement message, and notification settings. When you are ready you can click next to go to the next page.

<li>Since this is just for one owner you can search for them. Make sure to click the check box next to their name and then click create. If you did not select the auto publish toggle, then you can click the green actions button and click ""Publish"" to send this out.&nbsp

column2: >This step will deal with deactivating the portfolio, properties, and owner contact.

>Now that the owner's ledger is zeroed out you can now start deactivating items. You can start at the portfolio level. You can go to the portfolio and click the green actions button. From the options you can select ""Deactivate Portfolio"". You will also be able to select the date that this is closed.&nbsp
>By deactivating the portfolio, all of the properties under this portfolio will automatically be deactivated as well.&nbsp
>The last step is if you would like to deactivate the owner contact. To do this, click on the ""Contacts"" tab and click ""Owners"". You can then search for the owner contact and click on it.
>You can then click the green actions button and click ""Deactivate"".&nbsp

>Please note that this is just an overview of steps that need to be taken to close out a portfolio. There may be more specific steps that you need to take during this process. If you have any questions while completing this process please reach out to support@rentvine.com

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Webinar on Reconciliations","This webinar will take you through the basics of reconciliations and making corrections on common issues within the reconciliation process. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/webinar-on-reconciliations","{% video_player ""embed_player"" overrideable=False, type='hsvideo2', hide_playlist=True, viral_sharing=False, embed_button=False, autoplay=False, hidden_controls=False, loop=False, muted=False, full_width=False, width='688', height='387', player_id='165925724334', style='' %}

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Account Settings","This article will review all of the global account settings. This includes Account Manager, Users, Roles, & API, Personal Notifications, Account Notifications, and Reminders.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/account-settings","<ul>
• Account notifications deal mainly with setting up users and information for your account as a whole. You will see this at the top of the page within your global settings.

column2: >The account manager tab will have all of the information pertaining to the property management company. The first one being ""Account Info"". This will hold the following:
>Company Name- default named used for the property management company.
>Address- default address used for the property management company.
>Email- default email used for the property management company.
>Phone- default phone used for the property management company.
>
>The next thing will be the ""Branding"" section. This will be the info that is pulled on reports and owner statements within the system. This contains the following fields:
>Website URL- URL of the website for your property management company.
>Address- this is displayed on owner statements and hot fields that pull branding information.
>Phone- this is displayed on owner statements and hot fields that pull branding information.
>Email- this is displayed on owner statements and hot fields that pull branding information.

>Show Email on Print Header- this is where you can choose whether you would like to display the email listed above on headers within the system. This also relates to what shows on the owner statement header.
>License Info- this is displayed on owner statements and hot fields that pull branding information.
>Logo- here you can add an image of your company logo that will be added to important items like the owner statement.
>The next box will be the ""Payment Information"". This will be the payment information for your company and will be how you designate your payouts. This includes:
>Check- whenever you pay yourself out a check will be generated that you can print out.
>Other- does not actually send the funds but records them being paid out. (i.e. if you pay yourself out with a manual bank transfer and need to show that paid).
>eCheck- will send an eCheck to be processed through Forte when you pay yourself out.
>NACHA- will generate a NACHA file for you to download and send to your bank when you pay yourself out.
>Default Other Payment Type- only applicable if you have the payment type set to other. This option will default to a certain type like bank transfer, cash, CC/debit card, etc.
>Max Line Items per Check- this will be where you can set the max amount of line items on a check if the check payout type is selected.

column1: • Follow this you will see the ""Tax Information"" box. This will house important information regarding 1099 reporting for your company. This includes:
• Payee Name- this will be the name you would like to show on the 1099.
• Tax ID- this will be the tax ID for your company.
• Form Type- here you can select ""1099"" to make sure one is generated for your company.

column2: >The last box will be ""Quickbooks Information"". Here you can turn on the quickbooks export and enter in your company name. For more information on enabling this export you can click here.
You can control all of the users that have access to the administrative side of your account. This will also be where you set the role for different users in the system.

column1: <li>To invite a user you can click the blue ""Invite User"" button. This will pull up a side tab where you can enter in the email address of the person you are trying to invite and you can select the role for their login.&nbsp

<li>After a user is created and their role is set you can still make changes. To do this you can click the ellipses next to the user. In here you can either change the role or revoke access from the user.&nbsp
• The next tab you will see on this page is Roles. Here you will be able to create new roles and set the permissions for your users in the system.
<li>To create a role for your users you can click the ""New Role"" button in the top right of this box.&nbsp

• From this page you can enter in the name of the role and you can turn on the toggles for the different permissions of this role. For an in depth overview of all the role settings you can click here.
<li>You can also click the ellipses next to any of the role settings you have. This will give you the ability to edit the settings or delete the role entirely.&nbsp
• The last setting in here is going to be the API. Here you can create a new API key that can be sent to third party vendors in order for them to access information in your system.
<li>To create an API key you can click the ""New API Key"" button in the top right of this tab.&nbsp
<li>Here you will enter in the name of the API key and then select a role from your list of roles for what this key will allow them access to.&nbsp

<li>If you ever need to edit, update, or delete an API key you can select it on the right side of this screen. Please note that if you update the API key you will need to update any applications using this key.&nbsp

column2: >For more information regarding this API and API documentation you can click here.

column1: <li>Personal notification settings allow every user in the system to customize the notifications that they need to receive. From here the user can also configure if they would like to receive notifications by text or Slack.&nbsp
• This also allows the user to break up most of the notifications to only receive them if they are the assignee. For any in depth look into personal notification settings you can click here.

<li>Account notifications are configured per user and cannot be disabled here. This page enables you to set up extra email addresses or phone numbers to receive notifications. This section is used to add a group email or the email/ phone number of a someone that is not a user in your system.&nbsp
<li>From this page you will also be able to configure notifications that are sent out to owner, tenants, and vendors by clicking on the designated tab.&nbsp

column2: >For an in depth look into account notifications you can click here

column1: <li>The reminders tab is going to be a global hub for all of your reminders in the system. On the main page you will see what the reminder is attached to, the name, description, next reminder date, the users it is attached to, and the contacts.&nbsp
<li>You can click into each of these reminders. In here you can click the actions button and you will be to edit any information or delete the reminder.&nbsp

column2:
>To learn how to set reminders on a lease, property, etc. you can click here

","Settings & General","Global Settings","account,account manager,account notifications,account settings,api,personal notifications,reminders,roles,users","2024-05-28T13:33:50.689Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Send a Security Deposit to a New Property Management Company through the Move Out Flow","Have one of your owners recently ended their management agreement, and now you need to send the security deposit(s) to the new property management company? This article will walk you through this process using the move-out flow.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-send-a-security-deposit-to-a-new-property-management-company-through-the-move-out-flow","

column2: >This article will walk you through sending these funds to new management, but it will not show the owner the flow of funds. If you would like the owner to see the flow of money in the process, then please follow this article.

column1: <li>To start, you can go to the lease and click on the transactions tab. If there are any unpaid charges on the lease, you can click on them, click the green Actions button, and void them. This is only if you do not like the security deposit for these charges. If you would like the security deposit to pay for these charges, then you can ignore this step.&nbsp
<li>Now you can click the green Actions button and click Move Out. This will take you through the move-out flow to release the security deposit.&nbsp

<li>You can follow the first step of the move-out as normal by entering the move-out details. This includes the notice date, expected move-out date, move-out reason, and unit availability date. Most of this information is not necessary, as the lease is most likely still active.&nbsp

<li>The second step of the move-out is where you can enter the forwarding information. Since this is not going to the tenant, you can enter the information for the new property management company. This will be the address and name on the check that gets printed. Click the green next button to continue.&nbsp

<li>You will then reach the accounting tab. Here you can enter any charges you would like to apply the security deposit to or credits to add to the security deposit. This will not be necessary if you are just sending the whole security deposit over to the new company.&nbsp

• After this, you can click next to reach the review and complete page. You can select the date this is posted, and you will change the status to closed. You can also enter more information like the move-out date, close date, and close descriptions if you would like.

<li>The next important section is the refund details. Here you can enter the payment type, the name of the new property management company for the name on the check, and select the check address from the forwarding information entered earlier. You will then click submit, and this will close the lease and generate a check that you will be able to print the check to send out.&nbsp

• To view the check, you can click on the Accounting tab and click on Money Out. You can then click on the payment screen, and you will see the check that was generated. You can click on this to view it.
<li>From this page, you can click on the green Actions button and click Print Check.&nbsp

column2: >Below is an example of how this check will look with the new information for the new property management company.
","Leases","Security Deposits","new management,security deposit,send deposit,send deposit to new management","2025-05-13T23:11:13.789Z","PUBLISHED","false"

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to View Settlements in Rentvine","Do you see a settlement in your bank account and are wondering what that amount is from? This article will show you how to view your settlements and the money in/ money out payments that make up the settlement amount. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-view-settlements-in-rentvine","
<li>To view your settlements, you can click on the Accounting tab on the left side of your screen. From here you will click on the Banking tab.&nbsp

<li>From this screen, you can click on the Settlements tab to view all of the settlements in the system no matter the bank account. If you are looking for settlements for only one bank account you can click on that bank account and view its own individual settlements tab.&nbsp
• From the settlement page, you will see the Settlement Date and the Total Amount which will match the amount that you see in your bank account.

<li>To view all of the individual transactions that make up this settlement, you can click the Linked Money Out and Linked Money In dropdowns. This will show the total amount and the individual line items that make up that total.&nbsp

column2: ><strong>The total amount of the settlement is the total amount in Money In minus that total amount of Money out. Electronic check payments that occur around the same time and are batched together to create these settlements.&nbsp

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Send a Security Deposit to a New Property Management Company from the Owners Operating Balance","Has one of your owners recently ended their management agreement, and now you need to send the security deposit(s) to the new property management company? This article will walk you through this process by releasing the funds to the owner first. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-send-a-security-deposit-to-a-new-property-management-company-from-the-owners-operating-balance","

column2: >This article will show you how to send the security deposit to a new company and have it show on the owner's ledger. If you do not need this to show on the owner's ledger, then you can follow this article using a quicker process.
>To start, you will go into the lease(s) under this portfolio.

column1: • In the lease search box, search for the address or tenant(s)
• Click on the lease when you have found the correct lease
• Create a charge on that lease using the ""Owner Distribution""
column2: account in the amount of the security deposit (or the amount of the security deposit you are sending to the owner)
of the security deposit that you are giving to the owner

column1: • You can then complete the move-out flow and have the security deposit apply to the charge, or you can follow the steps below to manually apply the security deposit. For additional assistance with the move-out out you can follow this article.
<li>Go back into the lease, click the green&nbsp

column2: Release Deposit, enter the amount of the security deposit. Then, enter that amount in the Security Deposit spot below, and in that charge you just created below that

column3: of the security deposit that you are returning to the owner

column4: of ""Returning security deposit to owner"" or something similar

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Vendor Service Request Workflow","Are you a vendor that just completed a work order and need to show it as completed in your portal? This article will walk you through completing a work order and uploading/adding an invoice.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/vendor-service-request-workflow","<ul>
• The first step is to click on the Work Orders tab that you see on the left navigation bar of your screen. This will show you all of the current work orders assigned to you in the system.
<li>You can click on the work order that you have accepted. This will take you to the work order details page. You can view all of the information for the work order here.&nbsp

column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-05-30%20at%2010.52.33%20AM.png"" width=""688"" loading=""lazy"">

column1: • In the top right of this page, you can click the green ""Complete"" button to start the work order completion flow.

• The first step is to enter complete comments. This is a required field so something needs to be entered in this field. If there are no comments to add, you can add ""N/A"". You also have the option to upload any resolution photos to this page. If you are on your phone you can upload pictures from your photo library. This is not a required field so images do not have to be uploaded. Click the ""Next"" button in the bottom right to continue.

column3: src=""https://9252921.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/9252921/Screenshot%202024-05-30%20at%2010.58.21%20AM.png"" width=""686"" loading=""lazy"">

column2: ><strong>If images are uploaded in the resolution photos, you can see them as an attachment. If they show here this means that they have been successfully uploaded. You can also remove any by clicking the trashcan icon next to it.&nbsp
>

column1: <li>The next page will be where you can upload an invoice. If you do not want to upload an invoice, you can select no and submit the work order. If you would like to you can click yes. You will also have the option to click upload invoice or to create an invoice.&nbsp

• If you choose upload, you will have a field for a reference that is required. You will need to fill out this information. You will then see a perforated box that you can click on to pull up files from your computer. This will upload and you will be able to see the attachment underneath this box. Under that, you will see additional files where you can upload any other files from your computer that pertain to this work order.

<li>If you choose the create option there will be an invoice or reference number, a due date, and line items with a description and amount. You can also click the line item button to add more line items to the invoice. These are all required fields so they all need to be filled out before you can submit the invoice.&nbsp
<li>When you are done, make sure you click the green ""Submit"" button in the bottom right. This will show the work order as completed and upload the invoice if attached.&nbsp

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Lease Settings","This article will review all of the global lease settings. Lease settings configure default lease statuses, move-out notices, fee postings, and activation options for streamlined management.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/lease-settings","

column2: >

column1: The lease status that is placed into this domain will, in turn, be auto-populated when creating new leases that are set to a Pending
column2: status or when creating a lease on a property that already has an existing active lease.

column1: The lease status that is placed into this domain will, in turn, be auto-populated when creating new leases and setting the lease to an Active

column2: >When a tenant gives notice from their portal, the lease status will automatically update to the lease status that is inputted into this domain.&nbsp

column1: With this toggle on, the tenant will receive a default past due email notification. This will be sent out the day after any charges on the lease are past due. For more information regarding this notification, click here.
• Email Template For Tenant Past Due Notices:
When a tenant has a past due balance, the template selected here will be sent to the tenant directly.
Note: The email template that is associated can only be a
Move-in Date- The lease fee will be posted on the move-in date that is set on the lease.
Start Date- The lease fee will be posted on the start date of the lease.
Today, the lease fee will be charged on the day you create the lease.
Manually Activate Lease- Will leave the lease in a pending status and will only activate the lease upon the property manager manually activating it.
Activate Lease on Creation- If there is no active lease on the property upon lease creation completion, the lease will activate automatically.

Automatically Activate Lease on Start Date- Upon lease creation, the lease status will be pending. Upon reaching the lease start date, it will automatically activate. If there is still an active lease when this start date passes, the lease will stay pending and need to be automatically activated.
• Create Pending Bank Transfers on Move Out:

In the process of moving out, it's common for tenants to have a security deposit. When a tenant submits a payment for the security deposit, the funds are directed to the escrow account linked to the portfolio's posting setting. To streamline this process and avoid manual bank transfers for each transaction, you can opt to enable automatic fund transfers when going through the move-out flow. For more information regarding pending bank transfers, you can click here.
When you go through the move-out flow for a specific lease, the statement that is set on this domain will be the default move-out statement that is formulated and sent to the tenants via email.

When you initiate and complete the rent increase for a specific lease or leases, the system will ask you for a letter template. The letter template set in this domain will be the default that is sent to tenants when submitting a rent increase.

When going through the move-out flow in Rentvine, the system will ask you the reason for the move-out. In this section in the lease settings, you can add different move-out reasons than the default ones provided.

This section is where you can customize and create your lease statuses. This is very important in property management, so we can record exactly what happened in real life. For example, if someone was evicted in real life, we would want to make sure we record that correctly in Rentvine. In this case, we would move the tenant out and make sure we change the status of the lease to Evicted.
To create a new status, we would select Add Status
column2: in the top right of the page. Then we would simply create a name for the status and associate the name with a lease status.

column1: Please note: There can only be one

An 'active status' denotes that the lease agreement is currently in effect. This can occur either because the lease end date has not yet arrived or because the lease has not been terminated. In essence, it signifies that the contractual obligations between the landlord and tenant are still ongoing.

A 'pending status' indicates that the lease agreement is not currently active but is in a transitional phase. This status may arise for various reasons, such as awaiting an inspection to determine if repairs or maintenance tasks need to be addressed before the lease can become active. Additionally, it could be pending because the tenant still needs to fulfill certain obligations, such as making outstanding payments. Essentially, a pending status signifies that there are pending actions or conditions that need to be resolved before the lease can proceed to an active state.

A 'closed status' indicates that the lease agreement has reached its conclusion and is no longer active. This status typically occurs after all financial transactions have been completed, including rent payments and any outstanding fees.
column2: Alternatively, a lease can be closed if the tenant is evicted or if the lease is terminated prematurely due to a breach of contract. In some cases, a closed status may also arise when there is a formal disposition or resolution in place, such as a legal settlement or agreement between the landlord and tenant. Essentially, a closed status signifies the end of the lease agreement and the cessation of ongoing obligations between the parties involved.

column1: This section is going to be mainly tied to the lease creation process. When creating a lease, you will see a section for Monthly Charges. This section of the Lease settings is tied to that section. Here is where you can input recurring charges that you would like to populate by default on all leases.

Property managers often find this feature invaluable because it eliminates the need to manually input the same charges. Instead, you can set up recurring charges that are standard across all leases within your property management company. By utilizing this feature, you'll save time and effort, ensuring consistency across all leases without the need for manual input each time.
To create these recurring charges, you would select + New Default Monthly Charge.

Then you will enter the Charge Account, which would be the matching GL code/COA. You can add a description of your choice and the amount of the charge. If the amount is subject to change, you can leave that field blank and adjust it per lease.

When creating a lease, you will see a section for Move In Charges. This section of the Lease settings is tied to that section. This area allows Property Managers to add a Default Move In Charge for all leases created within Rentvine.
column2: This allows you to eliminate the need to manually input the same one-time move in charges and have this auto-generated for you.

column1: To create these recurring charges, you would select + New Default Monthly Charge.

Then you will enter the Charge Account, which would be the matching GL code/COA. You can add a description of your choice and the amount of the charge. If the amount is subject to change, you can leave that field blank and adjust it per lease.

column1: Rentvine Knowledge Base,"How to Add Webhooks","Are you looking to send certain information to a third party software when an event occurs in Rentvine? This article will show you how to add a webhook which will accomplish this. ","en","https://help.rentvine.com/how-to-add-webhooks","

column2: >What is a Webhook? A webhook is an HTTP request, triggered by an event in a source system and sent to a destination system, often with a payload of data. Webhooks are automated, in other words, they are automatically sent out when their event is fired in the source system.

column1: • To add a webhook you will need to click on the ellipses in the bottom left of the screen and click on settings.
<li>Under the ""Other"" box you will click on the setting labeled ""Webhooks""&nbsp
<li>From this page, you can click the green actions button and click ""New Webhook"".&nbsp
• You will then select an event. This event will record when an action occurs in Rentvine and it will be sent out to the designated URL.

<li>The next thing you will enter is the ""Post URL"". This will be the designated URL that the event information is sent to when it occurs in Rentvine. When you are done you can click ""Add"" to save that webhook.&nbsp
<li>If you click the ellipses on the right side of this webhook you will be able to edit it to change the event/URL or delete it to remove this webhook.&nbsp

<li>Also from the green actions button, you will have the option to view the signing key.This key is used to sign all HTTP payloads that we send to your webhook receivers. This is used to confirm the data is being sent from Rentvine.&nbsp

column2: ><em>If you ever need to change this signing key you can click the reset icon and this will generate a new unique key. Please note that this will invalidate the old key and you will need to update the webhook receivers of the new key.&nbsp
>

Rentvine Knowledge Base,"Property Manager Field Diagnostics","This article will explain all of the property manager field diagnostics and how to make any necessary corrections.","en","https://help.rentvine.com/property-manager-diagnostics","<div class=""hs-callout-type-note"" data-hs-callout-type=""note"">

column2: >With the introduction of the new property assignee field, there may be necessary corrections that need to be made. To make this transition easier, there is a diagnostic page to help guide you to where corrections need to be made.

column1: <li>To view the diagnostic page you will click your settings and then click ""Property Managers Diagnostic"" under the Properties &amp
<li>You will see three sections in here for any corrections that need to be made. These three sections will be reports, saved searches, &amp

<li>The first section will be reports. Here you will see the name of the report, the type, and the usage. These are saved reports in the system that are currently using the property manager object as either a filter, column, or a grouping. These will all need to be changed to use the new property assignee field.&nbsp

<li>To start correcting these you can click on the row. This will take you to the saved report that you have in the system. You will then need to change the object that is using the property manager field and change it to the property assignee field. For this example, this report had it as a filter, a column, and a grouping.&nbsp

• You can click the ""Customize"" option in the top right. If it is a filter you will click the filter section and deselect the property manager option. You can then click the add new filter and add the property assignee filter. You will have the option to select the same user that was previously the set property manager.

<li>If the object you need to change is a column, then you can click on the columns tab. Here you will be able to drag and drop the property assignee from the available columns to the selected columns. You will also need to move the property manager column from the selected columns to the available columns to remove it from the report.&nbsp

• If the object is a group then you can click the grouping tab in the customize report section. In here you will just need to change your selection from property manager to the property assignee option.

column2: ><strong>Please note that for all of these options, you will need to run the report and then click the save icon. You can also turn off the toggle for ""Save as New Report"" to override the saved report you currently have.&nbsp

column1: <li>This tab will show you any saved searches that are currently set throughout the system. This will show you the name of the search and the list view where this saved search is set.&nbsp

• To view these you can click the row and it will take you to that saved search with all of the current filter options. You will need to remove the user from the property manager field and add that user as the property assignee.
• You will then need to click the save icon. In here you will enter the name of this saved search and save it as a new one.
• To remove your old saved search you can click the save icon and then click view all saved searches. You will see the old saved search here and you can click the trashcan icon to delete it.
<li>The last tab will be the migration issues tab. This will show you any issues that the system had during the migration&nbsp
column2: where it could not automatically update the information.

column1: <li>The first section here will be for property manager issues. During the migration,&nbsp
column2: the system read the email set under the property manager and read the list of users in the system. If these emails matched, it would automatically add that user as the property assignee if they were set as the property manager on a property. If you see users here then it means the email did not match and could not be changed.&nbsp

column1: • To view all of the properties this occurred on for a user you can click the row. This will pull up a list of properties that user is listed as the property manager.

<li>You will first need to remove the property manager field by clicking the edit icon under the rental details. You can click the ""X"" in the property manager field to remove them. Make sure to click ""Update"" after this is done to save these changes.&nbsp

• You will then need to click on the edit icon in the details section and manually enter the user into the field for the property assignee. You will need to repeat this for all of the properties they are associated with.

<li>The last diagnostic is for property issues. This occurs because the new property assignee field is just at the property level. The property manager field used to be at the unit level so multiple managers could be attached per unit. This only affects multi units with different assignees.&nbsp
<li>To make these changes you can click on the address in the row. This will take you to the property where you can change the assignee for the property as a whole including all of the units.&nbsp
